loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and blocks

loans.name: Samit

texts.en: Mrs. Samit Y. and her family are living in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She was born in 1977 who is a farmer who owns three-hectare plot of land where she can earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Phoeurn Nak, is a horse cart driver who can also earn some money to support his family. Now she has some problem because her field is time to do farming, but she did not have enough money to support. So to improve current production, Mrs. Samit Y. is seeking for a loan to purchase rice seed and rest of the loan she hires farming laborers to help her to do farming. She is a mother of four children whom all are studying in school and helping their parents’ businesses. Her husband is taken the photo with her.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed

loans.name: Aidarbek

texts.en:
Aidarbek K. was born in Nurmanbet village, where he still lives. He is 32 years old and has three sons who are seven, four and two. He was the youngest child in a large family, where all the children helped their parents in the household and they cultivated land and pastured cattle. After graduating from secondary school and serving in the Army, Aidarbek got married. His parents gave a milk cow to the couple, thereby making a distinctive contribution to the start of Aidarbek’s business.

Aidarbek is a hard worker and his strong efforts allowed him to broaden his business with three cows and two bulls. His wife milks the cows and sells about 20 liters of milk daily to the loyal customers. Also, Aidarbek cultivates a small plot of land with red beets and cabbage. Aidarbek plans to use this loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy one milk cow and sheep, because it’s a good way to find the means for subsistence of the five member family. 

Aidarbek believes strongly that his children will become educated in the future. And today, he makes every effort to reach this goal. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Germeline

texts.en: Germeline operates a rice retail business, which she started only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The business is a big help for the family in covering their expenses and setting aside savings for the future. Germeline is requesting a new loan of PHP 12,000 to buy inventories of rice to sell. Germeline hopes that her business will become successful someday. She also dreams of seeing her six children graduate from college and find stable jobs. Germeline wants to thank ASHI/Kiva lenders who are sponsoring this loan. It is one of the greatest opportunities for her to start reaching for her goals.

loans.use: To buy inventories of rice to sell

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en: Julie Ann S. J., 28 years old, is married to Philip S. J., a driver. The couple is blessed with only one son. These young parents are very industrious and full of dreams. They wish to have a stable business, to build their own house, to send their only child to a better school and to live comfortably and happily. It was 2008 when she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), partner Microfinance Institution of KIVA in the Philippines. She joins ASHI and KIVA because she believes that these institutions can help her achieve her dreams. When she received her loan she used it properly on farming and now she earns a profit. She also maintains very good performance and shows discipline as a member. She is rewarded for her effort. Now, she is applying again for a new loan to use towards their rice field production. This loan will be used to purchase sacks of organic fertilizers, pesticides and to pay for the farm labor. The income from this business will help the couple in their daily needs and in preparation for the future of their children. The couple's plan is to expand their business and to seek an additional income generating project venture in the near future. They are hoping that ASHI and KIVA will always support their plan and their financial needs to be freed from the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer, pesticides and to pay farm labor.

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
La Sra. Celia  D. 68 años D. edad , casada tiene 3 hijos , todos ya  formaron sus propias  familias,  sólo uno D. ellos vive con ella .
Es oriunda luego D. la ciudad D. San Antonio, siempre se dedicó al comercio, pues se dedicaba a comprar y vender mercerías y bazar en forma ambulante, pero luego D. a poco fue ahorrando y decidió habilitar una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, y así D. esa manera ya no salir fuera D. su casa, y compartir un poco más D. su familia, su esposo actualmente ya no trabaja, por la edad pero le ayuda atendiendo el negocio, que ya tiene 25 años.
La misma ha recurrido al crédito pues le permite abaratar los costos D. las mercaderías comprándolo al contado, ya que como tiene  proveedores que le hacen llegar los productos y a veces no cuenta con suficiente capital entonces los deja a créditos, es por eso que ella cuida mucho en devolver en forma puntual cuando acceD. a un préstamo porque eso le permite renovar en forma más ágil el siguiente.
texts.en:
Celia is 68 years old. She is married and has 3 children, all of who have their own familes. Only one of them lives with her. She is from the city of San Antonio. She has always been a merchant; she would buy and sell merchandise in a variety store and as a street vendor. Later, little by little she saved up and decided to outfit a well supplied convenience store in her home. That way, she wouldn't have to leave her house and she could spend more time with her family. Her husband is not working at this time due to his age, but he helps her attend to the business, which they have had now for 25 years. She has turned to loans because it allows her to keep costs down by buying merchandise up front. She has suppliers that bring her products and at times she doesn't have enough capital so she buys on credit. That is why she is very careful to make her payments on time when she has a loan because this allows her to renew easily the next time.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her kiosk such as herbs, snacks, baked goods and beverages.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca;  La socia tiene  45 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la distribución de cigarrillos y venta de juegos pirotécnicos, la socia es visitada por muchas personas en las fiestas patronales y fiestas locales con realce de aniversarios honrosos, La socia distribuye junto a sus hijos los juegos pirotécnicos a diferentes ciudades en el país. La socia en esta ocasión necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de algunos juegos y abastecer su mercadería para las fiestas que se vienen en el mes de octubre, noviembre y diciembre.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería y juegos para abastecer su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisca, 45, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is a single mother of two children.  She distributes cigarettes and sells fireworks.  She is visited by many people during the Patron Saint festivals and local fiestas associated with important anniversaries.  She and her children distribute fireworks to various cities in the country.

On this occasion she needs funds to invest in merchandise and fireworks to stock her business.

She is grateful for and values the loan granted through this means and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and fireworks.

loans.name: Yost

texts.en: Yost Y. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and five of his children in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a chief villager, and he is also has a grinding mill business. He typically makes US$4 of profit a day. His wife sells gasoline from home and earns US$3 per day as well. Three of the children are in school, while two are technicians. Yost Y. is asking for a loan of US$200 to buy more gasoline for his wife to sell and also to fix his leaking roof.

loans.use: To sell gasoline.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Maria Cristina tiene 43 años y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú, ella desde hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Cristina es madre soltera pues su pareja la abandono con su hijo, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora pues tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa de baño y muchas cosas más. 
 
Maria Cristina con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de $ 400 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar mas ropa como por ejemplo toallas, polos, etc. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 43 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member of Arariwa's “Patrón de San Sebastián” community bank for a long time.  Maria Cristina is a single mother since her partner abandoned her and her child.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has a small business selling swimsuits and many other things.

Maria Cristina plans to use her loan for $400USD to increase her business capital.  She would like to buy more merchandise such as towels, polo shirts etc.

She is grateful for the opportunity which she is being given with this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as towels, polo shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: 2 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La banca comunal “2 de Julio” es parte del centro focal de Panamericana. Cuenta con  nueve integrantes (en esta oportunidad estaban almorzando, también estaba la mamá de una socia, la señora de manta beis a rayas café y sombrero mostaza), este es su segundo ciclo y se encontraban muy conformes por que el no tuvieron tropiezos en el ciclo primero.  Entre los negocios de las señoras, se cuenta con: transporte público, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, costura de sacos de dama, venta de detergentes, venta de vajilla, venta de zapatos, venta de ropa y cobradora de minibús.

La presidenta, la señora  Marcela es una mujer que ya tiene un hogar consolidado con su esposo y sus dos hijos.  El negocio de la señora Marcela es la cobranza de los pasajes, en el minibús que conduce su marido.  Ella indica que trabajan en forma conjunta porque han comprobado que cuando ella maneja el dinero de los pasajes, tienen más ganancia.   Su solicitud es por Bs. 2500.- y será invertido en la reparación de la movilidad, compra de llantas y otros. Trabajan de lunes a domingo, de seis y media de la mañana hasta las nueve de la noche.

Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el plazo de pago.
texts.en:
The “2 de Julio” (2nd of July) community bank is part of the Panamericana regional office.  It has nine members.  (In the photo the group members are having lunch.  One of the members' moms is also present - the lady in the beige shawl with coffee-colored stripes and a mustard-colored hat).  The group is in its second loan cycle and its members are very happy because they didn't run into any problems during their first loan cycle.  The ladies' businesses include: public transport, neighborhood store, clothing sales, sewing ladies' bags, detergent sales, crockery sales, shoe sales, clothes sales and minibus conductor.

The group's president, Marcela, is a woman who has a strong household together with her husband and two children.  Her business is collecting fares on the minibus which her husband drives.  She says that they work together because they have found that when she handles the fares, they make more profits.  She is requesting 2,500 bolivianos which will be invested in repairing their vehicle and buying tires and other parts.  They work from Monday to Sunday, from 6.30am to 9.00pm.

When we asked Marcela what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the repayment terms.

loans.use: To repair a minibus and buy tires

loans.name: Laxita

texts.en:
Laxita D. is from the city of Bagakay Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Laxita is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Laxita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting banana for sale. Laxita has been engaged in her business for over one year and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Laxita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laxita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Laxita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laxita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: La Capilla De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, está ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo en Atlacomulco México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.Marina López es integrante del grupo. Tiene 33 años estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, ella deseaba seguir estudiando y culminar el nivel medio superior, pero por recursos económicos sólo terminó la secuandaria, es ama de casa y también se dedica a la atención de su negocio de abarrotes tiene 3 hijos:1 mujer y 2 hombres a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a invertir en su tienda de abarrotes que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en ello y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, con la inversión de su negocio ha atraido más clientes y ha mejorado la calidad de servicio, pero ella espera a futuro aumentar su capital e invertir en recaudería y asi dar un mejor servicio y calidad de producto, con el prestamo espera tener un crecimiento amplio que le permita cumplir sus objetivos y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y ayudar al desarrollo de la sociedad.
texts.en: This group is called  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, and is located in San Lorenzo in Atlacomulco México. The group has 12 members. Marina López is a member of the group. She is 33 years old and studied until her 3rd year of high school.  She wanted to continue studying and complete high school, but because of economic resources she was not able to finish.  She works in a grocery business and is a housewife of 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  She dedicates herself to investing in her grocery business, which she started 1 year ago. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and satisfy her customers' needs.  This investment will attract more customers and improve the quality of service.  In the future she hopes to raise capital and invest in fruits and vegetables and thus provide better products and services.  With the loan she hopes for growth that can meet her objectives and provide a better future for her children and assist in the development of society.

loans.use: Invest in groceries.

loans.name: Aberi

texts.en: Aberi is a 60-year-old married man with six children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children. Ten years ago, he stopped farming and began selling fish. He feels the idea was a good one, as he has reaped tangible benefits. Aberi needs the loan to buy fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun V. and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Ok, have been married since 1988 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two are garment factory workers, one is a construction worker and one is in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Saroeun has been raising cows for more than ten years. His wife works in a factory. The couple has asked for a loan from Kiva twice. Saroeun is requesting another loan of $700 in order to renovate their house.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Lorma

texts.es:
La señora Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández, vive en Chicoasen, Estado de Chiapas México. Vive en unión libre con el señor  José Gonzales Arévalo, con quien procreo dos hijos  quienes aun están a su responsabilidad: Edison de nueve años y Bridni de tres años.


      Ella invierte el préstamo  en la compra de zapatos por cátalo de la marca Andrea, en donde lleva  trabajando seis años, y comenta que le va bien ya que le deja buenos ingresos desde que inicio con esta pequeña actividad.
 

     En esto inicio por su propia  creatividad ya que para  obtener ingresos tiene que tener una actividad que le deje buenas ganancias y de ello poder superarse con su familia a un qué pequeña pero importante para ella.

 
    Con lo que vende está ahorrando para que  así logre agrandar su negocio y tener su propia zapatería  de la que pueda seguir trabajando y  así logra salir adelante.

 
    Su deseo es que  logre seguir trabajando para comprar material y construir su casa que es lo que más desea, como también darle lo mejor a sus  hijos.
texts.en:
Lorma Gutiérrez Hernández lives in Chicoasen, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives with her common-law husband José Gonzales Arévalo and they have two children who are still in their care: 9 year-old Edison and 3 year-old Bridni.

Lorma is investing her loan in buying Andrea-brand shoes from a catalog.  She has been in this business for six years and she tells us that it is doing well and has made her good profits since she started.

Lorma started her business through her own creativity since, in order to make income, she needed a business activity that would make her good profits and allow her to get ahead in life with her family which, although small, is important to her.

When she sells products, Lorma also saves so that she can expand her business and one day own her own shoe store.  This will enable her to continue working and get ahead in life.

Lorma's wish is to continue working so that she can buy materials and build her own house.  This is what she most wishes for.  She would also like to be able to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: To buy Andrea-brand shoes through a catalog

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en:
Battulga, 28, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, residing in a two-room house in his father's backyard on the outskirts of the city. Two of their children attend a local primary school.

Battulga began making Mongolian traditional boots in 2006, assisted by his wife while taking care of the children at home. They manufactured the footwear by hand until they bought a sewing machine for 365,000 MNT in 2010, a purchase that has made their job much easier. The boots they now produce are both traditional and modern styles which are bought by both Mongolians and foreign visitors. Battulga and his wife currently have one employee who earns a salary of 150,000 MNT per month.

Their business has expanded little by little and will continue to grow. Battulga is a hardworking person and caring father who says, "We have our sewing machine and we need to have our own workshop in the future." He is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to buy leather and other necessary materials for his boot-making business.

loans.use: To buy leather and other necessary materials

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S., age 25, is a sewing worker in the garment industry. She has been working in this sector for over one year and has a formal salary. 

Her husband earns a living as a cow trader. He buys oxen in rural areas from farmers and re-sells them. He occasionally supplements his income as a motor broker. Though the couple has been married for a few years, they have no children as yet.

Pov S. is aware that her husband’s business is becoming increasingly profitable and she hopes to sustain it through a Kiva loan by accumulating a larger quantity of cows for future sale.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of cows to offer for sale in the future

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Drissa B. est un célibataire de 25 ans, qui vit chez son grand frère à Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, un des quartiers périphériques de ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  B. après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  il y a plus de trois années au commerce notamment  à la vente d’articles divers (d’huile alimentaire, sel, spaghetti, savon etc.) dont il dispose une place au  marché avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménages. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Il est à son troisième prêt individuel. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce  troisième prêt, il compte acheter, 6 sacs de sel, 5 futs d’huile alimentaire, 2 cartons de cubes maggi, 3 cartons de spaghetti, 2 cartons de savon, 1 carton de sardine, 3 cartons de concentrée tomate, etc. Il s'approvisionne auprès de commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail, au  comptant et à crédit.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Drissa B., aged 25, is unmarried and lives at his older brother’s place in Hamdallaye “Zantiguibougou”, an outlying district of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Drissa became familiar with commerce over three years ago, especially in the sale of various goods (cooking oil, salt, spaghetti, soap, etc.). He has a place at the market and a customer base composed essentially of housekeepers. He is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his products.

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Drissa decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago. He is now on his third individual loan. The previous loans were properly repaid. 

With this third loan, he intends to buy: 6 sacks of of salt, 5 barrels of cooking oil, 2 boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes, 3 boxes of spaghetti, 2 boxes of soap, a box of sardines, 3 boxes of tomato paste, etc. He gets his supplies from local wholesalers and then sells them retail, for cash or on credit.

He envisions using this loan to make a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business capital and to cover the loan interest. The rest of the profits will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Enkhtuvshin

texts.en:
Mrs.Enkhtuvshin is a 43 year old tailor. She lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works as an electrician. They own a plot of land and recently built a family house. The roofing on their house still needs to be finished. 

Mrs.Enkhtuvshin runs a tailoring business. She rents a small workshop in the basement of the building. She makes and fixes clothes and dresses by customers' orders. The loan she is requesting will be used to complete the roofing at her house and a small portion of the loan will be used to buy some textile materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy wood planks, rockwool insulation, roof tiles to complete the roofing on her house. A portion of the loan will be used to buy textile (materials) for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIESSIRI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 36 ans, 4 enfants et vivant avec leurs époux et enfants dans des familles nucléaires à Massablacoura Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leurs entreprises, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles achètent avec les  prêts des condiments alimentaires, des habits, des chaussures et des ingrédients pour faire de la restauration tel Chitan D..
Avec ce prêt la dame Chitan D., compte 2 sacs de 50 kg de Riz, 1 bidons de 10 litres d’huile et biens d’autres articles pour une bonne restauration. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Bougouni pour faire sa vente dans son restaurant à la gare routière de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’étranger d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elles compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans son entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI group are married women with an average age of 36 and four children. They live with their spouses and children in nuclear families in Massablacoura Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are acquainted through kinship, business activities, and neighborhood proximity. 

In order to satisfy their clientele and expand their businesses, they decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With their loans they are buying condiments, clothing, shoes, and ingredients for prepared food. 

For example, Chitan D. is using her loan to buy 2 50-kilo bags of rice, 1 10-liter container of oil, and many other products necessary for preparing food to sell. She gets her supplies at the Bougouni market and sells at her restaurant at the Bougouni bus station to both male and female customers, including tourists. With this loan she plans to make a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, some of which will be reinvested in her business. The rest will be used to pay her children's health expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for prepared food

loans.name: Las Azusenas Group

texts.es:
En el municipio de Tezonapa existe una comunidad llamada Ixtacapa el chico y en esta comunidad se ha conformado un grupo llamado Las Azalias que esta formado por 12 integrantes. 

Alba es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 23 años, estudio solo la secundaria y es madre soltera de un niño de tres años de nombre Alejandro. Alba nos platica que siempre habia tenido que trabajar y viajaba todos los dias a tezonapa para trabajar, pero al nacer su hijo tuvo que buscar una manera de trabajar en casa para poder cuidar a su hijo asi que la invitaron a vender antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, gorditas, tortas y tacos) en la hora del receso en la primaria. ella nos dice que todos los dias sube a su carretilla su mesa y su comida y pone su puesto en la primaria en la que vende a los niños el desayono.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de maiz, frijol, tomate, chile, cebolla, carne, pan, mayonesa, queso, aceite y crema para la elaboracion de su comida y posteriormente venderla.

ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea que darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y en un futuro le gustaria hacer un pequeño local afuera de la escuela en la cual vendera sus productos.

Los demas intrantes del grupo son:

Genoveva - panaderia 
Maria de Lourdes - panaderia 
Guadalupe - venta de dulces 
Maura-venta de pollo
Nallely-venta de refrescos
Lizbet-venta de zapatos
Ernestina-venta de antojitos mexicanos
Blanca - venta de abarrotes 
Guadalupe- venta de frutas y verduras
Juana - venta de antojitos maxicanos
Ana - venta de pollo
texts.en:
In Tezonapa municipality, there is a community called Ixtacapa el Chico and, in this community, there is a group called Las Azalias which has 12 members.

Alba is one of the group's members.  She is 23 years old and has a high school education.  Alba is a single mother and has a 3 year-old son called Alejandro.  She tells us that she has always had to work and used to travel to Tezonapa every day to work.  However, when her son was born, she had to find a way of working from home so that she could look after him.  She was invited to sell Mexican snacks (empanadas, gorditas, tortas and tacos) at recess time in the local elementary school.  She tells us that every day she loads her table and food onto her little cart and sets up her stand in the school where she sells breakfast to the children.

Alba needs this loan to invest in buying corn, beans, tomatoes, chilis, onions, meat, bread, mayonnaise, cheese, oil and cream for making the food which she sells.

The other members of the group are:

Genoveva - bakery 
Maria de Lourdes - bakery
Guadalupe - sells sweet treats
Maura - sells chicken
Nallely - sells soft drinks
Lizbet - sells shoes
Ernestina - sells Mexican snacks
Blanca - sells groceries
Guadalupe - sells fruit and vegetables
Juana - sells Mexican snacks
Ana - sells chicken

loans.use: to sell footwear, groceries, chicken, soft drinks, sweets and bread

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and has one child. She sells curtains and accessories at Image Market in Beregovo city. Her monthly gross income is 20,000 UAH and her profit is about 6,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana started this business 8 years ago. She was lucky to choose this type of goods to sell, because she had very little competition then, and even now the competition is low. This gives Svetlana a good opportunity to make her living. Svetlana is a kind and hardworking person. She treats her clients well and has a desire to develop her business even more.

Svetlana would like to receive a loan of 20,000 UAH to purchase more inventories. Additional capital would allow her to offer a better assortment of curtains and serve even more clients.

loans.use: purchase more curtains and accessories

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. For 3 years he has had a shop that sells breads, biscuits & candies. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Wilson is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Las Trabajadoras De Manantay del Distrito De calleria, Departamento De Ucayali.
Se dedica a la venta de condimentos embolsados, los cuales repartes en las bodegas de la zona, viene  trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará 3 kilos de comino, 3 kilos de pimienta, 2 kilos de orégano, 2 kilos de guisador, 2 kilos de canela, 2 kilos de anís, 2 kilos de clavo de olor, 1 ciento de cartulina, pegamento, bolsa en tira.
Es un trabajo que no le quita mucho tiempo y que le genera unos ingresos extras a su hogar, para poder comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta, y también para poder darles a sus hijos las cosas que les piden en la escuela.  Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the "Las Trabajadoras de Manantay" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.

Olga sells packaged spices which she distributes to grocery stores in her area.  She has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for two years.

Olga will use this loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy 3 kilos of cumin, 3 kilos of pepper, 2 kilos of oregano, 2 kilos of turmeric, 2 kilos of cinnamon, 2 kilos of aniseed, 2 kilos of cloves, 100 lots of card, glue and bags in strips.

This work does not take up much of Olga's time and it makes her some extra income for her household so that she can buy some things that they lack and also provide her children with things they need for school.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy cumin seeds and other whole herbs and spices

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 41 years old and married to Henry; she has been operating her farming/green grocery business for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about 12,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to take care of her business and family. 

She has been loaned 30,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) from KADET Ltd. and intends to use the loan to fence her land; to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farming tools; and to pay laborers. 

She plans to use the profit from her business to educate her children and provide for their basic needs. 

In the future, she hopes to be a reliable green grocer producer in Kathuani, support her family fully through education, and provide them with other comforts.

loans.use: To fence her land, to purchase seeds, fertilizer, farming tools, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Laut

texts.en:
Laut (in the photo), 41, is a garment worker. Her husband, Sophal, is a security guard. They live in a village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Laut’s husband wants to supplement their income with a new business driving a motor taxi.  Hence Laut is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to launch the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to launch a new business driving a motor taxi.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Josefa, vive en la ciudad de León, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, ellas es comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería tiene 5 años de tenerla. Ella desde muy joven ha aprendido a ser comerciante a los 18 años ella vendía ropa, cosmético, verduras de manera ambulante por las calles de León. Con el tiempo se caso y junto con su esposo han venido luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida, tratando de sobrevivir atravez de su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar inventario para su pulpería tales como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite. De esta manera podrá mantener mas surtida su pulpería ofrecer de todo tipo productos que le demanden sus clientes.
Uno de sus proyectos más anhelados que ella tiene es convertir su pulpería en una Distribuidora de productos varios. Sus próximas metas son comprar freezer, comprar 2 estantes de vidrio y un estante de metal para colocar sus productos.
texts.en: Josefa lives in the city of Leon.  She is 36 years old and has 2 children.   Josefa is a businesswoman, and has owned a small shop for 5 years.   From the time she was very young, she learned about business, and at 18 years old she was selling clothing, cosmetics, and vegetables around the neighborhoods of Leon.   She has since married and together with her husband, they fight to improve the quality of life for their family, trying to survive through their business.   Josefa is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise for her store,, such as rice, sugar, beans and cooking oil.  In this way, she can keep her store well stocked and be ready to meet the requests of her customers.    One of her future projects is to convert her small store into a distributor of various products.   Her future goals include buying a freezer, 2 glass show cases, and some metal racks to display the products.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small shop, such as cooking oil, rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en: Sonik lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Ashotck. She is married and has three sons (20, 24, and 26 years old). She has a college education. Sonik has been engaged in farming for the past 20 years. Known as a hardworking, honest person, she has developed deep experience in agriculture. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase feed and to fix the cattle shed. She expects this investment to increase the family income by 25%. This is her sixth microfinance loan; she is pleased with the high quality of service. Sonik was born in Ashotck and hopes to live the rest of her life in her birthplace.

loans.use: to purchase feed and to fix the cattle shed

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maimouna  est une femme mariée de 54 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 12 et 18 ans. Elle évolue depuis plusieurs années dans le commerce de produits alimentaires. La raison fondamentale du choix de son activité est la recherche de source de revenus. Elle est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 1999. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires (riz, mais, sucre lait et divers autres produits ).Son objectif est  d’accroitre les bénéfices générées par son activité  qui lui permettront de payer les frais de  scolarité de ses enfants et participer  a  assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: Maimouna is 54 years old and married with 3 children aged between 12 and 18. She lives in Senegal. She has been selling food for several years in order to earn a living, and has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since 1999. Maimouna is a requesting a loan of 200 000 francs in order to restock on food products (rice, corn, sugar, milk, etc.). Her goal is to increase her business profits so that she can pay for her children's education and contribute to the daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Yandag

texts.en: Yandag is 56 years old and lives with his son and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His son is a college student. His wife sews and makes clothes as a family business. He and his wife started this business in 2006. They are planning to expand their business operation by purchasing new equipment and applying new sewing techniques. They are currently operating this business from their home. He believes that shortly he will gain more experience and become a successful businessman. He is a diligent man who says, "With the bank loan, I want to improve my business. In the future, my family wants to have a tailoring service center." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase new equipment and materials for their business.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and materials for the family's sewing business

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 31 years old, married and has two children who are in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Cherry has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets and feed for her business.

Cherry has been raising pigs for one year now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40 year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school.  She has a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan.  She has been in this business for six years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan, to enable her to purchase clothes to sell.  She will use the extra income from this loan to build a department store to extend her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells fish, pegs, sandles, and slippers at Ayensudu near Elmina by moving from one place to another. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Vivian has been selling slippers for six years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy sippers to resell.

loans.use: to buy sippers to resell.

loans.name: Marcelinda

texts.en:
Marcelina is 56 years old and lives in Catulayan, San Juan, Siquijor.  She is married with five children.

Marcelina engages in selling fresh fish in the market to earn a living.  She earns PHP 3,000 a month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy fresh fish to sell in the market.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one month. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Mayra Ximena

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una mezcla entre lo colonia y la moderno, sus amplios paisajes naturales, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente quienes son cálidos y amables hacen de esta ciudad hermosa y muy hospitalaria.

Doña Mayra es casada, su esposo es empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella al igual que su esposo es empleada privada y trabaja de lunes a viernes, en sus tiempos libres y fines de semana trabaja conjuntamente con su mamá en la confección de delantales.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como es tela, hilos, botones, cierres y elásticos para la confección de los delantales.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the "Estrellitas" communal bank.  She lives in the Totoracocha area of the city of Cuenca. This city is a mixture of the colonial and the modern, with vast natural landscapes. The variety of its cuisine captivates the palate of locals and visitors. Its people, who are warm and friendly, make this a beautiful and very hospitable city. 

Mayra is married, and her husband works for a private company. They don't have their own house, so they live in rented accommodation.

She is employed by a private company, just as her husband is, and works Monday to Friday. In her free time, and on weekends, she works with her mother making aprons. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and she will use her new loan to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, bottons, zippers, and elastic for making aprons.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, bottons, zippers and elastic.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 27 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single and has a two children, 4 and 7 years old. They are in school and live at home. For the past 4 years, Mamie has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal and oil for her business

loans.name: Ma Elenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma Elenita works hard to support her family.

She has a jewellery (fancy earring) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Ma Elenita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more jewellery to sell.

Ma Elenita has been sustaining her business activities through her previous twenty-one loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more jewellery to sell

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Ms Thanh is 66 years old with three children who are grown. She is a paper artificial goods maker - a traditional business in Vietnam. Her business started 2 years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2008, she has used loans for expanding her business activity. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,048,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) to buy material for her making process.

Ms Thu is 52 years old. She has a shop that sells fresh fruit in local market. She wants to borrow a loan of 6,048,000 VND to buy more fruits for sale.

Ms Luong is 52 years old. She has a small wood work shop that make housing furniture. She wants to borrow a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy wood.

loans.use: to buy material for her making process.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 45 years old, married to Angeline, and they have children aged between 25 and 3 years old. He has been selling fish for ten years earning a monthly income of KES 9,000.

He is borrowing his first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 30,000 which he intends to use to purchase fish to sell. He plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business.

His hopes and dreams are to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Benkagni Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAGNI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAGAN, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est le riz  avec  NASSIRA, 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Carlos Abel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido, y también por desarrollarse la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de uva, espárragos, entre otros. Carlos es un joven muy trabajador, sobre todo con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Día a día Carlos trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una institución de la ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y él cree que está saliendo adelante con su trabajo porque es responsable y sobre todo cuidadoso en su trabajo.

Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente construirá una cerca de ladrillo, de esta manera podrá tener mayor seguridad en su vivienda ya que ahora estará cercada, así el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Carlos is 26 years old and lives in the city of Ica, which is known for its warm climate and also for its farming, especially grapes, asparagus, among others. Carlos is a hard working young man, who above all uses the fruits of his work to support his parents with the household expenses. Carlos works day after day as a cleaner in an institution in the city. He works around 8 hours a day and he believes he is getting ahead with his job because he is responsible and above all careful in his work.

Carlos is very grateful for the Kiva loans as thanks to the help they have given him he will be able to make improvements to his house. In particular he will build a brick fence and in this way he will give his house great security as it will have a fence. The result will be an improvement to his family's quality of life and he will fight to fulfil his greatest dream: "To have a university degree".

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Mpererwe Old Tax Park Group

texts.en:
Juma  is a new client in UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd mdi. He is a resident of Kawempe Wakiso District. He is a married man, aged 40 years, with two children. He is a businessman and owns a taxi operating in the city. 

The business is lucrative and that's why he joined it. But the taxi is apparently in poor mechanical condition, so in a bid to improve service  delivery and raise more income, he has through the group applied for a loan portion of UGX 500,000 to do the repair. He hopes this will improve its efficiency and also bring in more income. He is hard-working.

He is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance has offered to him.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela opened this beauty shop shortly after separating from her ex-husband. She not only provides beauty services she also sells a variety of products to her clients. Included in her beauty services are facial treatments and massages, which are not very common in the area she works in. Her clients are loyal and are very satisfied with her work.

This business is the main source of income for her and her two children. She plans to use the loan to invest in beauty supplies and tools for her salon. She needs to buy massage creams and also hair dye for these upcoming months that are always busier.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs to buy massage creams and also hair dye for these upcoming months that are always busier.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima lives in the Vingunguti Ilala District of Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children. Halima sells charcoal in a store located in her house. She has been in this business for more than ten years now. She is planning to increase the size of her charcoal store. Unfortunately, the charcoal business has been barred by the government because of environmental conservation issues. This has decreased the supply of charcoal, causing prices to rise. Limited by capital, Halima is not able to implement her plan. She needs the assistance of USD  550 from lenders to implement her plan.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali S. is twenty years old, and the father of three children. He is engaged in the business of selling peanuts and onions from the neighboring country of Guinea and sells them in the local market. With his customers being mainly women with smaller businesses in surrounding local villages, Ali sells his products as a wholesaler. He has brought the products closer to the women sellers. Peanuts and onions are used in many local dishes. He will use the funds to purchase more stock to cover the off-season.

loans.use: Ali would like to increase his stock of onions and peanuts for off-season selling.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina supports herself and her 15-year-old daughter with the income from her small women’s clothing business. During the cold winter months she sells warm coats, and in the warmer season she sells T-shirts and undergarments. Irina has had her business for eight years. She now operates two sales kiosks, one of which is in a very good location at the market with a lot of passing traffic and good sales.

Irina has developed a good reputation in the market. She is a delightful lady with a grateful attitude. Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to buy new clothing inventory and continue developing her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory for her women's clothing business

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a married mother of eight children, who lives at Leloto Leauvaa. She is now 56 years old. She is the one who started the centre with just twelve members but now it has been extended to twenty-eight ladies. She is also the centre chief. Her business is selling ice cake and she gets $40.00-$60.00 a week from it.

loans.use: To buy cordial, a freezer, and sugar

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is a 48-year-old mother of five. She lives with her husband in Bware Migori, Kenya, where she is well known as a japur (or farmer) because she owns a large plot of land where she grows sugarcane. She also raises cattle that produce between 8 to 10 liters of milk a day, which she sells to the people of her community  for $0.45 a liter. Priscilla has come to us for a loan of $800 to buy enough new cattle to increase her output of milk to 15 liters a day.

loans.use: Buy additional cattle to produce more milk

loans.name: Subgroup C Of Group Tegemeo

texts.en:
ASILI, age 46, is married with 5 children (ages 15, 11, 8, 5 and 3). He used to work with Total Petrol Station but had to leave because the station went bankrupt. As a result, he started his own business in 2003, a hardware store called the “Mkopi Store.” The shop is open daily from 7am to 6pm. He hires 2 shopkeepers and pays a shop rent of about $45 per month. He makes a profit of around $273 per month which he uses for home expenses and school fees for his children. He also takes care of his mother who is living with them.

Asili is the leader of Subgroup C of Group Tegemeo (Swahili for “expectation”), which totals 21 members. He is going to share this loan with his subgroup members: Zainabu R. (selling charcoal & fire wood), A. M. (selling charcoal), Colleta M. (shop owner), and Zainabu A. (selling snacks). This subgroup has already shared 2 previous loans which they were able to pay back successfully.

Asili used the previous loans to buy hardware appliances for his shop. With the new loan, he hopes to once again increase his stock.

In the picture, Asili is front row and center.

loans.use: To increase stock of hardware

loans.name: Louinsa's Group

texts.en: Louinsa has a poultry farm for layers. With the extra profits from the business, Louinsa wants to help pay for her son to do a master's degree.

loans.use: To buy more chicks.

loans.name: Ajka

texts.en: Ajka was born in 1972 and she lives in a small village called Seoci, near Zenica. Her husband has a full-time job as an ironworker. He earns about US$ 500 monthly. The  family has 2 children, 14 and 11 years old. Ajka is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 900 and she will use it for buying a cow, because she wants to improve their monthly household income.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 29 years old and is a single woman with one child, age 2 years old. She also takes care of another child, age 5 years old. Bahati owns a small grocery store that she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

In the past, Bahati has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food item for her business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi T. is a trader who buys goods in large quantities and sells smaller quantities to her customers. She is married and has 3 children. She doesn't have the funds to purchase enough goods to meet the demand of her customers.

Esi T. is asking for a loan of $425 to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita wishes to embark on a promising future and for that reason she left the city where she was born, Pampas, to dedicate herself to growing potatoes in the middle of her country. She arrived at Huancayo city a while ago and has been selling them there since. She has been able to position herself in the market and she wishes to increase her production and prepare her land now in order to have excellent harvest results.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Anita, tiene deseos de emprender un futuro prometedor y por esa razón abandonó su tierra natal Pampas para dedicarse al cultivo de papas en el centro de su país. Llegó a la ciudad de Huancayo hace mucho tiempo y desde este punto las comercializa. Ha logrado posicionarse en el mercado y desea mejorar su producción y preparar sus tierras de cultivo desde ahora a fin de obtener excelentes resultados.

loans.use: capital to increase her potato production

loans.name: Mujeres Esforzadas Group

texts.en:
Josefina is a 40- yearold woman who lives with her three children in the Barrio of Ginebra Arzerno on the north coast of the Dominican Republic. She has a small business selling watches, and she hopes that in the future she will be a successful and respected business woman. With this loan she will buy more inventory for her business, and will make some cosmetic improvements to her store as well. When she is not working, she enjoys spending time with her children and watching TV. Esperanza is looking forward to seeing this group of women succeed as they take the first step to improving their economic situation.

Note: This is a group loan. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy a larger selection of watches for resale.

loans.name: Sofía Albina

texts.es:
Sofia helps her husband with the household expenses by renting out her two motor taxis. The income helps support their three children who attend school. Sofia's work is very tiring, even though it's not physical work, she needs to be vigilant in the care and maintenance of the motor taxis, which is ongoing work. She also needs to be careful that the motor taxis are used responsibly. Sofia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. With high aspirations, she hopes to build her own successful transportation business one day.

She is requesting a loan to purchase new motortaxis. With more vehicles to rent, she will also increase her income, and as more time passes, she will be closer to achieving her goals.

Sofía, es una madre de familia que ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y por ello tiene a su cuidado sus dos motocarros. Su negocio es alquilarlos por día y así obtienen ingresos para su hogar y lo que significa tener a tres hijos en la escuela. El trabajo de doña Sofía es muy cansado, porque a pesar que no es un trabajo físico, vigilar el cuidado y mantenimiento de las motos es un trabajo arduo y permanente, también debe estar pendiente de que no sean utilizados para otros fines que no sean los convenidos, y debe lidiar cada día con todo tipo de transportistas. Sin duda una de sus cualidades es ser una mujer valiente, y la otra es ser emprendedora, con aspiraciones muy altas, ya que ella quiere convertirse en una exitosa empresaria y tener una línea de transporte. El préstamo que ella solicita será invertido en la compra de nuevos motocarros. Al aumentar la cantidad de vehículos, aumentará también el ingreso de dinero diario, y con el paso del tiempo el sueño de Sofía se hará realidad.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE NEW MOTORTAXIS TO GROW HER TRANSPORTATION BUSINESS.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a 24-year old mother of three marvelous children who lives with her husband, David. He is a timber worker and both of them want to get ahead in order to give their children what they need and what is fair so they can grow up to be good people. Beatriz sells beauty products from a cosmetics line that is very well recognized on a national level. She has been doing this for three years, and she takes the products around the area to sell, for cash or on credit. She only works in the afternoons and she likes her job a great deal, as she is able to meet a lot of people and get to know them. Sometimes she has difficulty when customers do not pay what they owe. She considers herself a very dedicated woman and a fighter, and she finishes what she starts. She would like to supply herself with more beauty products and buy a showcase in order to show them, and at the time make them more secure. In the future she would like to have a clothing and perfume store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz tiene 24 años, es madre de 3 hijos maravillosos, vive con su esposo David que es maderero, ambos se han propuesto salir adelante para brindar a sus hijos lo justo y necesario para que sean hombre de bien. Beatriz vende productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, desde ya hace 3 años, estos productos los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares de su zona, dejándolos al contado y al crédito. Trabaja solo por las tardes y le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que por medio del mismo conoce a mucha gente y se relaciona más. A veces tiene dificultades cuando las personas incumplen con su pago. Ella se considera una mujer decidida y luchadora, pues lo que se propone lo cumple. Quiere implementarse con más productos de belleza y comprar una vitrina para mostrar sus productos los mismos que estarán más seguros. En el futuro quiere poner una tienda de ropas y perfumería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her cosmetics business and a showcase where she can exhibit her products

loans.name: Amir

texts.en: Amir is 31 years old and married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Khodjali region in Azerbaijan, and he settled in Baku city. Six years ago he started the taxi business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts to repair his taxi.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Juana Jeanethe

texts.es: La señora U. tiene 34 años  es casada madre de tres hijos de 8,14,16 años uno en primaria y los otros dos en secundaria, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica su actividad economica es la venta de granos basicos poteria, gaseosas y todo lo que es producto del hogar  tambien tiene como actividad el cultivo de pipian , flor de jamaica y frijol de vara el cual ella lo comercializa en los mercados de leon, para llevar a cabo esta actividad ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus tres hijos en su tiempo libre y cada tres meses su esposo regresa a nicaragua y  la apoya economicamente y en las labores del campo, el credito lo utiliza para capital de trabajo y las ganacias las reinvierte en el cultivo de las hortalizas, de esta manera doña juana es una de las tantas   empresarias emprendedoras que desean seguir contando con el apoyo de Fundacion Leon 2000 y el proyecto KIVA
texts.en:
U. is a married, 34-year-old with 3 children aged 8, 14 and 16 -- 1 in primary and the other 2 in secondary. Her husband works in Costa Rica. She sells basic grains, soda and anything that is a household product. She also cultivates squash and vara bean which she sells in the markets of Leon. She counts on the help of her children when she takes time off and every 3 months her husband returns to Nicaragua and supports her financially and in the fields with the crops. The loan will be used for business capital and the gained income will be reinvested in the cultivation of her crops. This is why Juana is one of the many business entrepreneurs that wants to continue counting on the support of "Fundacion Leon 2000" and the Kiva project.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
MwanaJ. J. has owned a small business in Zanzibar for two years. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is now requesting her second loan so she can buy more inventory to increase her sales.

MwanaJ. has five children, ages 9, 14, 16, 17, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.en: Mrs Bui Thi D. is 33 years old. She is married with three children and lives in Quang Yen Commune, Quang Xuong District, Thanh Hoa Province with her family. She joined TYM Fund in 2007. Her business is selling pork and growing rice with an average income of about 5 million VND/month. With this business, her family’s standard of living is becoming more and more stable. Bui Thi would like a loan of 9 million ($550USD) to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her food business

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang N. I., 54, is married and lives with one married child and her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home doing house work and cooking food for the family members. Her husband is a theater owner. Her child is also one of the theater members and normally, she makes $10 in revenue a day.

Mrs. Heang N. I. would like to take out a loan of $800 to purchase a generator to power the lighting when the theater puts on performances.

loans.use: To purchase a generator.

loans.name: Las Hermanas De Pantoja Group

texts.en:
“Las Hermanas de Pantoja”, or the Sisters of Pantoja, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their third loan from Esperanza International.  This group’s past two loans have been successfully repaid, and the group hopes to utilize a third loan for further business expansion.  Oneyra is the coordinator for this group in the town of Los Alcarrizos.  

Onerya, mother of two, owns a variety store in the front room of her house.  In her variety store she sells hygiene products, undergarments, accessories, and food products.  Oneyra desires to see growth in her business so that she will be able to fix up her home and continue to provide for the needs of her family.  

Other members of Onerya’s bank run similar entrepreneurial operations including fried food sales to local vendors and a recycled plastics operation.   

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Expansion of variety store

loans.name: Butusyo A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Butusyo K. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 14 and 25. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 2 dependants because their parents passed away with HIV.

Butusyo has been running a rice selling business since 2001. Her business is to buy rice in bulk and sell in retail. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Butusyo currently earns about $300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $700 USD in order to purchase more rice in bulk. In the future, she plans to open another business and to increase the stock of rice. Butusyo thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk

loans.name: Appolonia

texts.en: Appolonia is 47 years old and married with 2 children. She sells foodstuffs and soup ingredients to the people in her community. She hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila R. tiene ya más de 11 años dedicada a la venta de juguetes nuevo y usados, este es el ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando y quiere lo mejor para ellos. 
Actualmente tiene poco inventario y sus clientes de años le están haciendo varios pedidos pero ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio y cumplir con las necesidades de sus clientes por ese motivo esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila R. has been selling new and used toys for more than 11 years. This is the source of income for her family, since she is a single mother and has two children who are in school, and she wants the best for them.

Currently she has very little inventory to meet the needs of her clients, and this is why she is asking for a loan to be able to stock up on merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys to sell

loans.name: Marygine

texts.en:
Marygine is a mother of four and is married to Corat. She has a business buying vegetables from farmers and selling the vegetables in the local market in Belo, her village. With this loan, Marygine plans to purchase eight buckets of potatoes, ten buckets of cocoyams and 18 buckets of beans, including three buckets of koki beans.

With the gradual repayment schedule and the ability to set aside some of her profits, Marygine is confident her business will continue to succeed.  With this loan, Marygine believes that her business will help her community because she is providing more food to choose from at a convenient location.  

As her business profits from the loan, Marygine will be able to expand her business, buy food and needed items for her family, and most importantly, pay for her children's school fees.  Out of her four children, three of them are under the age of fifteen.  The ability to pay for these costs helps Marygine and her family, especially since they have faced some of life's challenges, like deep poverty.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cocoyams, beans, and koki beans

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es: María Esther N. de 54 años de edad reside en Ciudad Delgado junto a sus cuatro hijos los cuales dependen totalmente de ella, así también junto a su esposo. Ella posee una panadería en la cual trabaja junto a su esposo elaborando el pan, María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el capital necesario para comprar harina y manteca para la elaboración del pan, lo que más desea María es poder obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar su economía familiar ya que todos dependen de dicha panadería y e necesario poder suplir a través de esta todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
María Esther N. is 54 years old and resides in Delgado City with husband and four sons whom she supports entirely. She has a bread shop that she works at with her husband. Maria would like a loan in order to obtain the necessary capital to purchase flour and butter for bread making. What Maria desires the most is to earn higher profits and improve the economic well being of her family, all of whom depend on the bread shop to meet their household financial obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and butter

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Ruqaiya M. Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. R. who lives in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeat. People come from different cities to Multan with a belief that their wishes will come true if they visit the shrines.

Ruqaiya baji operates an embroidery business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband 

Her husband is a mechanic by profession. He learnt this skill by working in a workshop. He has been in this profession since he was 15 years old because his father was a poor man and couldn’t afford the rest of the family’s expenses. Ruqaiya baji feels proud to have a hardworking husband. She always stands by him in every circumstance.

Ruqaiya baji is applying for a loan to buy mechanical tools for her hsuband because he wants to start his own workshop. 

Ruqaiya baji is leading another lady in her group and her name is Bilquis. She is applying for a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy mechanical tools for her husband's motor workshop

loans.name: Seng's Group

texts.en:
This group has chosen Mr. Seng M. to be their group leader. Seng M., 33, is married and has three children who all attend the local secondary school. Seng is a fisherman who catches fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. He and his wife usually wake up very early each morning to prepare their tools for fishing. Then they sell the fish in the busy local market. Recently, they have not been able to catch as many fish as before because their tools frequently break down. Therefore, Seng M. is applying for a loan to buy additional fishing equipment so they can catch more fish. 

The other three borrowers who are taking this loan are:
Mr. Eak T.,  a local fisherman, who is asking for a loan to repair his old house.
Mrs. Ek C., who will use the loan to increase the size of her house.
Mrs. Toem C., a fisherman, who will use the loan to purchase more fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana R. lives in Pinig Village, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old, married, and has three school-age and four adult children.

Viviana operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities. She has been engaged in her business for some years and earns approximately 600 PHP daily.

In 2007, Viviana joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Viviana is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to invest in a refrigerator for expansion of her business. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenues generated from the business to pay education expenses and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for expansion of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Stela D. from Mwanza. She is married and has five children, who are between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. Since 2000, Stela has made a living running a grocery store where she sells  onions, tomatoes, chilli and cabbages. It is the kind of place that local people send their children running to when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and need a missing ingredient.

She works at this business for six hours per day, seven days per week. Stele earns about $100 a month from her business, and is requesting a loan of $200 to buy bananas, tomatoes and cabbages. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Stela thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, tomatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa R. is a 39-year-old mother of five. She is a rice grower in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. From time to time, she is busy visiting her farm with the help of her husband, Jebrick R..

She needs additional capital to run her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase certified rice seeds and 2 sacks of fertilizer. The loan will really help her achieve maximum harvest from their farm.

CEVI helps their clients grow their business. Like Adelfa, all CEVI clients receive not just loans but education as well about savings to mange their businesses well.

loans.use: For seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 27 años, es un joven tranquilo y muy trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Los días de José comienzan muy temprano, ya que llegadas las 6 de la mañana sale junto a su inseparable triciclo en busca de clientes para brindarles el servicio de transporte. Los mercados y lugares más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca son sus principales zonas de trabajo y es que él sabe que es ahí donde más gente puede necesitar sus servicios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede pasear por las calles de la ciudad y al mismo tiempo cumplir con su trabajo, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta muy altas horas de la noche, corriendo el peligro de que su triciclo sea robado, aun así el está dispuesto a sacrificarse mucho. Para el futuro espera implementar un negocio para que lo atiendan sus padres, tal vez una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual puedan trabajar sin mucho esfuerzo.
