Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y lo hará, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que no quiere quedar mal ante el resto de sus compañeros. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su triciclo, puesto que el tiempo ha hecho que se gasten y ya no tengan la misma velocidad que antes.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, a hardworking and quiet young man. He lives in his parents' house and what he most wants is to be able to give them a peaceful old age. José's days start very early, by 6 in the morning he leaves with his inseperable tricycle in search of clients to offer his transportation service. The markets and busiest places in the city of Juliaca are the main areas that he works since he knows many people there need his services.

What he enjoys most about his job is that he gets to travel through the streets of the city while at work. He has been doing this for four years and he considers the most difficult part of his jobs are the long hours at night, running the risk of having his tricycle stolen. He is willing to sacrifice a lot for his job.

In the future he wants to have a business that his parents can take care of, perhaps a grocery store, where they could work without too much effort.

This is his second loan with MFP, and he knows to pay all of his dues on time like he did last time. He is very responsible in his village bank and he does not want to look bad in front of the other members. With the loan of 1000 soles he will buy new tires for his tricycle, since he has been using them a long time and he can no longer travel the speed he used to.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tires for his tricycle

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a member of the Bwawani borrower group i Ilala,Iringa,she is 21 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 3 years.

Emma started her own shop business selling rice,sugar,cooking oil,etc 5 years ago,she works 11 hours and earn monthly profit approximately 240,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Emma`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan.Emma hopes to save money expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop  commodities

loans.name: Redemtha

texts.en:
Redemtha is a member of the Malandege borrower group in Ilala, Iringa. She is 26 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 5 years old.

Redemtha has owned a clothing business selling kanga for 2 years, she works 8 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Redemtha`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more kanga(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profits she gains from the use of this loan,Redemtha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Gladys Elita

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado de Cuturapi del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 1 hijo, vive en Cuturapi y estudio educación superior (profesora).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 5 años e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de ferretería.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar mayor cantidad de artículos de ferretería como candados, repuestos de luz, artículos de limpieza, herramientas, palas, picos, etc. Todo esto lo lleva directamente al Cusco, la señora también se dedica a la cría de animales menores.

Su mayor deseo es tener una ferretería grande.

A ella le  gustan las reuniones, los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de candados, repuestos de luz, artículos de limpieza, herramientas, palas, picos, etc.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Herlinda Gómez le está haciendo falta cambiar los cables de la luz y reparación de las puertas pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible.
Doña Herlinda se dedica a la venta de bolsa, perfumes, lentes del sol, productos para la belleza, este es el ingreso que ella tiene para su familia ya solo viven ella y una hija.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que le preocupa porque tiene nietos pequeños y teme que les pueda pasar algo.
texts.en:
At the home of Sra. Herlinda Gómez, the wiring for her lights needs to be changed and all of the doors are in need of repair. However, she does not have the money needed to make these improvements immediately. Doña Herlinda sells purses, perfumes, sunglasses, and beauty products. This is how she earns income for her family, which consists of herself and her daughter. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials and pay someone to make the repairs. She is concerned because she has young grandchildren and fears that something might happen to them.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the wiring for the lights & repair the doors of the house

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora ELENA G. S., tiene 58 años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria. Elena es madre soltera por lo cual desde joven tuvo que trabajar arduamente para criar a su hijos sin ayuda del padre de ellos, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad quienes no dependen económicamente de ella; sino ella cuenta con el apoyo de ellos ya que mensualmente ellos le dan su propina y cuando se enferma la llevan al médico.
La socia se dedica a la venta de menús y cenas en su domicilio. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró productos alimenticios como: arroz , menestras, fideos, aceite, papa, etc para preparar los menús y cenas.
Con este crédito de 3,000 nuevos soles comprará productos alimenticios para preparar sus menús como: arroz, aceite, menestras, fideos, etc
Elena sueña con tener su restaurante en su domicilio para así aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
ELENA G. S., 58, lives in the Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO communal bank. She finished 11th grade. Elena is a single mother and had to work very hard from a very early age to support her children without any help from their father. She has 4 children, all of whom are adults now and do not depend upon her economically. Quite the contrary, she receives some help from them in that they give her their tip money each month and they take her to the doctor when she gets sick. She sells prepared meals and dinners in her home. With her first 300 new sol loan she bought food products like rice, vegetables, pasta, oil, potatoes, etc. to prepare her meals and dinners. With this new 3,000 sol loan she will again buy similar products to continue preparing her meals. She dreams with having a restaurant in her home and thereby increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her meals like rice, oil, vegetables, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Yelenkoura Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Yelenkoura comprend six femmes dont une célibataire, une veuve et quatre mariées dans des familles  monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 5 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font toutes le commerce d’articles divers. 
C’est dans le souci d’augmenter le volume de leurs activités et de les diversifier qu’elles décidèrent de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après six prêts solidaires correctement remboursés, le groupe Yelenkoura est à son 7ème  prêt de groupe.
Ce prêt  servira à acheter, des condiments alimentaires:( 4grandes boites de concentrée de tomate, 2 sacs de sel de cuisine, 1carton de cube maggi, 20 kg de graines de dah) ; des articles divers d’étalage (1sac de sucre, 1dizaine de sachets de thé prisé par les consommateurs, 4 cartons de savon de lessive, 1/2 carton d’anti-moustique en spirale) ; 40 sacs de charbon de bois; 4 sacs de petit mil, 1sac de poudre de pain de singe et des ingrédients pour la crème séchée. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments alimentaires et en divers articles d’étalage à Bamako, le charbon de bois est fourni sur place  les transporteurs de gros véhicules venant  de Fana, le mil, la poudre de pain de singe  et les ingrédients au marché de Médine.  
Pour faire de la crème séchée : il faut piler le mil  et le réduire en farine fine, faire griller une portion  de ce mil dépourvue du  son et bien lavée, on y ajoute du riz étuvé de la poudre de pain de singe tamisée plusieurs fois, plus  les ingrédients nécessaires réduits en farine, bien mélanger et faire sécher dans les conditions d’hygiène requises. 
Les graines de dah  sont transformées en « datou » utilisé dans nos sauces en remplacement du sounbala. 
Les ventes se font   à domicile, souvent livrée à domicile sur commande, aux marchés,  en détail, au comptant et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 55.000 FCFA qui servira à rembourser les  intérêts du prêt, à compléter le prix de condiments, à l’achat de fournitures scolaires, du savon et à participer aux évènements sociaux.
texts.en:
The Yelenkoura group consists of six women of which one is single, one is widowed and four are married in monogamous marriages. They are on average 45 years old with 5 children and live in the Médine district of the town Ségou (4th administrative area of the Republic of Mali.) They know each other from the neighborhood and family ties. They all do business with various goods. It is in the hopes of increasing and varying their business that they decided to work with the micro-finance non-profit Soro Yiriwaso.

After six repaid team loans, the Yelenkoura group is on to its 7th loan. This loan would be used to buy food condiments (4 large boxes of condensed tomatoes, 2 bags of cooking salt, 1 box on bouillon cubes, 20 kg of dah seeds) ; various goods to display ( 1 bag of sugar, about ten packets of tea that is highly regarded by their customers, 4 boxes laundry soap, 1/2 box mosquito repellent spirals); 40 bags of charcoal; 4 bags of millet, 1 bag of powdered baobab fruit and the ingredients for dried cream.

They supply themselves with the food condiments and various goods in Bamako, the charcoal is made on site, the carriers for large goods come from Fana. The millet and the powdered baobab fruit come from the market in Medine. To make dried cream: you must grind the millet to a fine flour, roast a part of this millet, remove the bran, and wash it well. To that we add oven-dried rice and powdered baobab fruit and sift it several times. Add the needed ingredients and reduce them to a flour. Mix well and let them dry in required hygienic conditions. The seeds of the dah are modified into "datou" used in our sauces instead of "sounbala."

The sales are done from home, in the from of house deliveries, at market, and retail by cash or credit. The customers are made up of both women and men. They hope to earn on average 55.00 FCFA monthly, which would repay the interest on the loan, cover the cost on the goods, the purchase of school stationary and soap, and enable them to participate in social events.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of varrious goods

loans.name: Sonia Alberta

texts.en:
Sonia is a single mother who opened a bakery 16 years ago as a way to support her two children. Both of her kids are now grown and studying in the university. Based out of her home, Sonia began her bakery with just a few items, but with time and the financial support of Fundación León 2000, it has become an established business. With this loan, she will purchase more ingredients to make her desserts. 

Sonia’s goal is to provide for her children’s education and to be able to ensure that her family doesn’t go without a meal. She dreams that one day, her children will be able to have a better way of life. Sonia knows that she will continue with her business even though the economic crisis has made life difficult in Nicaragua and around the world. Sonia is grateful for those who support her in her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making desserts

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and the mother of one child who is currently in school. She is a 35 year old trader. She trades in lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She lacks adequate working capital, so Ama can only buy a small quantity of lace materials and sells them through hawking. She takes delivery of stock from Kumasi main market in bulk and sells them in pieces. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk quantity of lace materials and textile. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her child with a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantity of lace materials and textile.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has five children who attend school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community where the major occupation is trading. Rebecca works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Rebecca runs a provisions store by the roadside in the community. She procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy provisions.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is a 40-year-old married mother of six children between the ages of 6 and 15. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house, where she is staying with seven people. Annette takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. She doesn’t incur transport costs because she buys from her place of work. She works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people on a retail and wholesale basis.  

Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family and school fees for her children. Her major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her, as she works from a muddy place. Annette has been in this business for 15 years and with MCDT for six years, servicing her 10th loan and working with the same group mates. Annette joined MCDT, a Kiva partner, because it was near her home and was working with poor women. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of alcohol. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Mrs. Ang Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of fifteen people, is located in Srei Snam village in Kandal province. They will each use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Ang P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Ang P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Se Sorn, owns a rice mill and the rest of the time he mills rice to re-sell (milling removes the husk, bran, and germ. This is done largely to prevent spoilage and to extend the storage life of the grain).

Although they try to work hard, this family earns less income than needed. Thus, Mrs. Ang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice for her husband to mill and re-sell.

Mrs. Ang P. is the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is a laborer in a mill, another two are enrolled in the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more rice to mill and sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 52 years of age and married with six children between the ages of 10 and 28. Three of her children go to school. The family resides in and owns a two-roomed house, where she stays with eight people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include utility bills, school fees for children, medication and feeding the family. 

Grace owns stall in Owino Market selling bananas. Grace buys her paint from factories and cement bananas from delivery vans which get them from villages and so she doesn’t incur any  transport costs to and from shopping as she buys from her place of work. She receives an average of 40 customers a day. She has done this business for over 20 years. Her main challenges are defaulters, the rainy season (because she works from a muddy place),  and the ever increasing prices of bananas. She sells on a retail basis only. She has been with MCDT for over 10 years and is servicing her 26th loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to start going to farmers directly.
.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Raul Gerardo

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl  vive en la localidad de Santa Rita distante a 2 km del municipio de el Torno, su actividad principal es la de servicio de moto taxista.
Es soltero con muchas ganas de superación por lo que también se dedica a la cría de gallos de riña,  pelea de gallos (una pelea de gallos o riña de gallos es un combate que se lleva a cabo entre dos gallos de una misma raza de aves denominada "aves finas de combate", propiciados por el ser humano para su disfrute.
El origen de estas peleas está en Asia. En china ya se celebraban hace 2.500 años y es posible que mil años antes se hicieran en la india. En la antigua roma eran usadas para adquirir valentía. Posteriormente, esta práctica fue llevada a América por los conquistadores españoles. Sus deseos es poder formar su propio hogar con casa propia).
El Sr. Raúl con el dinero del credito comprara repuestos para su motocicleta, es una persona responsable y dinámica y esta muy agradecida con Emprender  y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Raul lives in the town of Santa Rita two kilometers from the municipality of Torno. His principal job is working as a taxi driver. He is single and his desire to improve his life is evident because he also raises gamecocks. Cockfighting, which is a combat between two roosters of the same species also known as "fine birds of combat", was created by humans for their enjoyment. The origin of these fights was in Asia. They began in China 2,500 years ago, and it is possible that 1,000 years before that cockfighting existed in India. In Ancient Rome gamecocks were used to inspire courage. Later, this practice was brought to the Americas by the Spanish Conquistadors. Raul great hope is to have his own house. With the loan money Raul will buy spare parts for his taxi. He is a responsible and dynamic person, and he is very thankful for the trust Emprender and Kiva have shown by awarding him with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Hadisa

texts.ru: Сафолова Хадиса проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает в Горэлектросети в качестве контролёра. Сын на заработках в России. Сама Хадиса занимается торговлей. Она продает продукты необходимые хозяйству. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hadisa S. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a controller at the municipal electric company. Their son works in Russia. Hadisa is involved in retail sales. She sells household-essential products. She is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz H., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She has been managing a water station while also renting out some apartment rooms. These two activities make up her total income per month. She also does a little food vending while maintaining her two main businesses.

Luz has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 45,000 Philippine peso loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by allowing her to pay for maintenance and repairs for her apartments. She will also pay for the needs and bills of the water station and buy groceries to replenish her current product stock.

She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Maintenance and repair for her apartments, to pay for needs and bills of the water station and to buy groceries to replenish her current product stock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 31-year-old hardworking lady. She sells movies, music tapes and DVDs in her shop to earn a living.  She was previously practicing farming before she ventured into this business.  Rebecca says that her passion for music is what drove her to this business, not the fact that the field is very profitable.  She supports both local and International music and she ensures that she sells only the original movies, music tapes and DVDs.   She is focused and determined to improve her living conditions and so she has joined a group in Faulu Kenya called Uwezo where she saves part of her profits. Being a member of the group, she has benefited in borrowing loans, which the group guarantees and from the training that Faulu Kenya offers. She has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of movies, music tapes and DVDs for sale.

loans.use: To add to her stock of movies, music tapes, and DVDs for sale.

loans.name: Maqsoodan Begum's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan begum is married to F. S.. They reside in a city named Multan (famous for its shrines and garments) in Pakistan.

She is a mother of four kids: two sons and two daughter. She has enrolled all of her kids into school because she knows the value of education and wants to grow them in a manner so they make their future bright.

Her husband is a vegetable vendor. He sells his vegetables in different areas of the community on his four-wheeled cart. He has 10 years of experience in this business.

Maqsoodan is applying for a loan from Asasah to purchase the seasonal vegetables in bulk so her husband can expand his business and generate more income.

They hope to earn good profit from this loan so they may open their own vegetable shop and improve the living standard of their family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don José  es un hombre trabajador, trabaja por turnos y abecés todo el día como recamarero, lleva varios años en esta labor, es padre de un hijo
Y su anhelo es lograr terminar su casa, su esposa trabaja de lavado y planchado para poder ayudar con los gastos del hogar pues todo ha incrementado. Con el financiamiento anterior logro terminar un cuarto, aun falta repellar las paredes, pintar, embaldosar, y lo que hará  a primera instancia es el cambio del techo de su casa ya que esta en malas condiciones y le es de gran necesidad poder hacer esta mejoras.

Sus planes es poder trabajar a tiempo completo para poder obtener ingresos altos y de esta manera ahorrar para poder hacer sus proyectos en su casa a largo plazo.Hasta ahora esta sastifecho por los logros ya que es de pocos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working man. He works shifts - and sometimes double shifts - as a cleaner. He has been doing this for several years, and he has one son. His wife takes in laundry and ironing to help with household expenses, which have gone up recently. José's greatest wish is to finish his house. With an earlier loan, he finished building a room. He now needs to plaster the walls, paint, and tile the floor. What he will do first, however, is change the roof, which is in a poor condition and really needs improvement. His plan for the long term is to be able to work full time and earn more, so he can save up to complete his home improvements. He is pleased with what he has achieved up to now on his limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy zinc, solder, and other roofing materials for his home

loans.name: Balqees' Group

texts.en:
Balqees has lived in the city of Multan, Pakistan, for the past ten years. She is a housewife who takes care of her family by staying at home. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He drives someone else’s rickshaw and receives an income not according to his struggle. This keeps him less energetic because he feels bad when he never completes the financial needs of his family.

Therefore, Balqees applied for a loan from Asasah to help him buy his own rickshaw so he can work with satisfaction and avoid paying the cost of renting one. This will enable him to work for more hours and also earn him more income.

loans.use: To purchase a rickhaw for her husband

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea C. is from the village of Amoyong, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Lea is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Lea owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lea has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lea is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana M. works as a nurse in the village of Vaghatin in the Sisian region. Nurses' salaries are very low in the country, and a family of 5 simply can not exist on it. With the help of her father-in-law, she keeps bees and cultivates the land (grain growing). Both industries are very dependent on nature and are not always profitable. To diversify and develop her household economy, Svetlana plans to buy some livestock.

loans.use: buying livestock

loans.name: Bendiya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENDIYA 2 sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
DIATOU C. qui est un des membre du groupe s’est spécialisée dans la culture du pois de terre.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est essentiellement vendue au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes.. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 000 FCFA par campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi à participer  dans certaines dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENDIYA 2 are married women with an average age of 34. They all have 3 children on average and most live in polygamous families in Moosibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the Microfinance insitution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their second loan with the institution, with the first being duly repaid. Diatou C., who is one of the members of the group, specialises in the cultivation of bambara groundnut. With her loan, she intends to buy agricultural products and equipment to cultivate 2 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold at the market of Louloni to male clientele. She hopes to make an average profit of 120 000 FCFA each season. Her profits will enable her to repay her loan and also to assist with the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat d’intrants et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia J. D. F. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, y se destaca por ser una persona con grandes ganas D. salir adelante y esforzarse mucho para poder lograrlo. Ella vive junto a su esposo y así mismo tiene dos hijos, los cuales viven con la madre D. Rosa. Como toda mujer responsable y trabajadora, Rosa se dedica a comercializar ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños, la cual venD. D. forma ambulante por algunas D. las calles más comerciales y populosas D. Usulután, a pesar que cuenta con poca variedad D. ropa, ella posee varios clientes, razón por la que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más variedad y cantidad D. ropa en diferentes tallas y colores. D. esta forma ella desea mejorar su negocio y así aumentar las ventas generadas por este todo con el fin D. contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia J. D. F., 41 years old, lives in the district of Usulután. She stands out as being a person with a great desire to do well, who makes a considerable effort to be able to achieve this. She lives with her husband and has two children who live with Rosa's mother. As a responsible and hard-working woman, Rosa sells clothing for women, men, and children, which she markets walking through some of the busiest, most populous commercial streets of Usulután. Despite having little variety of clothing, she has several customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan with which she would be able to purchase more variety and quantity of clothing in different sizes and colours. In this fashion, she wishes to improve her business and also augment the sales this would generate, with the goal of having a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa R. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Narcisa is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Narcisa makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling sweets and confectioneries such as gulaman (jellied) candies in the local community. Narcisa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Narcisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Narcisa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Narcisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Edwin Omar

texts.es:
el sr. Edwin Omar C. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la Colonia las Delicias Trojes El Paraiso, Edwin se dedica a la elaboracion de bloques para casas o muros. tiene varios años de decicarse a este tipo de actividad.
tiene mucha experiencia en hacer los bloques.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar cemento y arena al por mayor para fabricar los bloques, en estos momentos tiene un gran pedido y no tiene el suficiente capital para invertirlo en su negocio.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin Omar C. is 38 years old and lives in the Las Delicias Trojes housing development of El Paraiso. Edwin makes cinder blocks for homes and walls for a living. He has been in business for several years and has acquired much experience.

He will use this loan in order to purchase wholesale cement and sand so that he can make blocks. At this time, he has a big order to fill, but he does not have enough capital to invest in his business.

He needs these profits in order to help his family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase block making materials

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es: Emilio tiene la edad de 58 años, es casado, y tiene 5 hijos de 33, 24, 22, 20, y 18 de edad. Vive con la esposa, los hijos, y dos miembros más de familia. El quiere comprar una cerda para cria y empezar a sacar las crias para la venta y destase de ellos. Ademas, con el dinero que sobra compará algunas materiales para las mejoras de los chiqueros y luego invertir en la crianca de ellos. Despues de que las cerdas se engorde va a venderlas para cria y carne. Está el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron y con una tasa de interés más bajo que los otros prestamos que recibió en el pasado de Coopealianza y Banco Nacional de Costa Rica. El espera de salir adelante con su familia y lograr un futuro mejor con más estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Emilio is 58 years old and married with five children, who are 33, 24, 22, 20 and 18 years old respectively.  He lives with his wife and two other family members.  He wants to buy a pig for breeding and to begin selling the offspring.  He also wants to use the money to purchase materials for improvements to the pig pens and later to invest in breeding.  After the pigs have been fattened, he will sell them for breeding and for meat.

This is the first loan that Emilio has requested via Kiva partner FUDECOSUR.  He is very happy with the services they offer, and the interest rate is lower than for other loans he has received in the past from Coopealianza and the National Bank of Costa Rica.  He hopes to get ahead financially for his family and to achieve a better future with more economic stability.

loans.use: For breeding pigs and improvements to the pig pen.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Xiomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Xiomara Del Socorro tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Ella tiene su negocio que es una pulpería el cual está ubicado en su vivienda. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a la venta de estos productos, sin embargo fue hasta hace dos años que ha logrado invertir en una gran variedad de productos, buscando de esta manera como incrementar sus ingresos. Ella lo empezó por su esposo el cual también invirtió capital en la apertura del mismo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas mercadería que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas y de esta manera su ganancia. Últimamente han tenido muchos problemas relacionados con la inestabilidad en el precio del producto, y es por ello que necesitan financiamiento para cubrir cualquiera de estos problemas. Su sueño siempre ha sido agrandar más su negocio para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en: Xiomara Del Socorro is 47 years old, married and has a dependent child. She has her business which is a grocery store located in her home. She has dedicated herself to the sale of these products for 5 years. However, it wasn't until two years ago that she was able to invest in a variety of products, in this way seeking to increase her income. She started this business through her husband, who also invested capital in opening it. The loan will be invested in buying more merchandise which will allow her to increase sales and her profits. Lately they have had many problems related to the instability in product prices this is why they need funding to cover these problems. Her dream has always been to expand her business to provide a better quality of life for her son.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with six adult children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has owned a real estate agency for the past ten years in which neighbors and town dwellers are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. She hopes to build more rental houses in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase cement to renovate her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Ieng

texts.en:
Ieng S. U., 62, is an single father who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. He works as a craftsman and makes pipes to drain water.  His wife died some years ago.

Ieng lives with his two children, who assist him in his business. As a family, they typically earns an average of $6.60 per day to help cover their daily living expenses.  His children are single.

An old bridge in front of his house is broken down.  To fix this problem Ieng requests a loan to purchase material to make a new bridge.

loans.use: To purchase some material for making a new bridge for replacing the old one.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a retail shop for over one year, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Mariam faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and prosper in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for her retail shop. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr Luis es un Joven muy trabajador que dice que le debe todo lo que es a su madre ya que ella sola supo sacarlo adelante, El Sr Luis a su corta edad ya es propietario de un vehículo al cual lo hace trabajar como taxi de aquello recibe una renta diaria, el dinero que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo  y además de la compra de llantas nuevas para que este en buenas condiciones para este fin de año que mas ingresos tiene por las fiestas de esta época. El Sr Luis  indica que con el tiempo se comprara un segundo vehículo y uno le regalara a su madre a quien le esta profundamente agradecido por todos sus cuidados, es un joven muy responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr Luis is a very hard-working youth who says that he owes all that he is to his mother, because she alone know how to make him succeed. At his young age he is already the owner of a car with which he works as a taxi driver. From this, he receives a daily income. The money that he is requesting is for the maintenance of his vehicle, and for the purchase of new tires so that it will be in good condition for the end of the year, when he will make more income because of the holidays. Luis says that in time he will buy a second vehicle and give one to his mother, to whom he is profoundly grateful for all of her care. He is a very responsible youth and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of tires

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad P. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Trinidad is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling cosmetics and clothing products from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Trinidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Trinidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics & blouses

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda R. is 54 years old, married, and supports her family by operating three business ventures: firewood, live stock and charcoal businesses. 

She lives in Camanse, Brgy. Ibo, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans fR. NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her firewood, live stock and charcoal businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 14,000. Florenda is now borrowing PHP 15,000 as additional working capital.  This will be her 5th loan fR. NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Florenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress fR. earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Juan Raul

texts.es:
Juan Raúl tiene 49 años de edad y tiene cinco hijos, El nació en la ciudad de San Pablo de la provincia de Canchis del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juan Raul vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Juan Raúl es bridar servicio de transporte en su propio taxi, el cubre la ruta que va de la ciudad de Oropesa  a la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad Juan Raul requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro. 

Juan Raul pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juan Raúl, 49, has five children.  He was born in the city of San Pablo in Canchis province, Cusco department.  Currently, Juan Raúl lives in the city of Oropesa, Cusco province, Peru.

His main activity is providing transportation service in his own taxi; he covers the Oropesa-Cusco route.  Juan Raúl needs a loan for vehicle maintenance and repair on this occasion.

He belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” communal bank and is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means.  At the same time he commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a married woman who lives in Mabinay, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a tailoring/sewing business. Her husband Benjamin, who is 55 years old and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are between 14 and 32 years old. Felisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Felisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's education. Felisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Agar

texts.en:
Agar A. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Agar is single. To make a living, Agar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Agar has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agar has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC.  Agar is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Agar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a thirty-five year old married man with three children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. He is charged with the responsibility of looking after eight of his household members, four of them being his brothers. His goal is to educate them up to the university level. 

He has been in the transport sector for twelve years: he started as a driver, then later acquired a lorry, pickup, saloon car, and a motorcycle. Despite his success, Philip still has challenges in the high costs of repair and maintainance of these vehicles. His dream is to buy a bus and complete his house. Philip needs the loan to finish his house.

loans.use: to complete building his house

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 39 years old and married with two school-going children, aged 4 and 13.  He is able to provide for his family with the income he earns from his cafeteria.  He also runs a grocery for more income.  He has managed to sustain his business for five years because of the financial support he gets from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy beans, maize, rice and Irish potatoes.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, rice and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Faislabad, which is an industrial city in Pakistan known for its textile industry. She has been living there in a four-room brick house with her family for the past 30 years. She is a housewife and does her household work by staying at home.  Her husband's name is A. M. and he is 55 years old. He owns a small piece of land where he grows different seasonal crops. After cultivating, he sells them for a good profit. 

Razia has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her daughter is an embroidery expert and her sons drive their rickshaws and provide transport services to the passengers. They all contribute to their family financially from their earnings. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for his agriculture business. Her husband has been doing this business for the past 25 years and Razia is very confident that his business will grow further after investing the loan money into it. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Razia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es:
Nicolás es casado, tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Conavi de la ciudad de Pilar, donde tiene una casa propia, donde cuenta con las condiciones básicas para desarrollar tarea de venta de pescados.
El desarrolla esta actividad hace aproximadamente cuatro años, posee la insfraestructura necesaria para el llevar adelante su trabajo, ya sea canoa y mallones, además, se moviliza con una motocicleta propia. 
Nicolás es muy reconocido en Pilar por la gran variedad de pescados que tiene, es por ello que espera contar con este apoyo para poder seguir mejorando la calidad que ofrece a sus clientes, y solicita el crédito para poder comprar materia prima como caña, hilo de pescar, cebo, entre otras y continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Nicolás is married.  He’s 44 years old and lives in the Conavi neighborhood in the city of Pilar where he owns his house that has all basic conditions required for fish sales.

He’s been in this line of work for about four years.  He has the necessary infrastructure to continue with the work, that is, a canoe and nets.  He also owns a motorcycle to get around on.

Nicolás is very well known in Pilar because of the great variety of fish he has. Because of this he hopes to have this support to continue improving the quality he offers his customers and is asking for a loan to buy raw materials like a fishing pole, fishing line and bait, among others, to continue working.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies: fishing pole, fishing line, bait, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es uno de los productores del mejor café de las Bonitas de Pérez Zeledón.
El es uno de los productores de café para exportación de la zona, el tiene 4 hectáreas de café sembrado. En este momento él necesita un préstamo de  ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes y asegurar la calidad de su café. 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Comunal Las Bonitas, una de las 110 empresas de crédito comunal socias de EDESA
texts.en:
Juan is a producer of some of the best coffee in Las Bonitas, Pérez Zeledón.  He is one of the local coffee producers who grows his coffee for export and has four hectares planted with coffee.

RIght now, Juan needs a loan for 594,000 colones to buy fertilizers and thereby ensure the quality of his coffee.  He is a member of the Las Bonitas Community Credit Company, one of the 110 community credit companies that are members of EDESA.

loans.use: to produce coffee

loans.name: Luz Angela

texts.es: Luz Angela de 36 años vive en la linda Bogotá, ciudad capital de Colombia, allì tiene una confeccion de articulos de cuero y de tela, actividad que aprendiò de su madre hace 18 años cuando exportaban productos y justamente con ella construyó su mayor experiencia que hoy se traduce en la capacidad de  provisionar exclusivamente a empresas morrales, billeteras etc,  y  de ofrecer sus productos en un punto comercial especializado, ubicado en el barrio La Candelaria: “corazón histórico de Bogotà , de calles inclinadas llenas de colorido y escenario por donde artistas y turistas se cruzan a diario”. Asì es el panorama donde Luz Angela exhibe  todo lo que ella misma fabrica; sus principales clientes son turistas y visitantes del sector que gradualmente han ido creciendo y por eso ella necesita ampliar su negocio.  Este es el primer financiamietno que recibe de la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará cuero, pegantes, herrajes, y fabricar bosos, billeteras y morrales que exhibirà en la plaza de artesanias, porque su sueño es posisionarse en ferias microempresariales nacionales a traves del progama “Artesanias de Colombia” algun dia exhibirlas en otros escenarios del mundo.
texts.en:
36 year-old Luz Angela lives in the beautiful city of Bogotá - the capital of Colombia.  She has a business making goods from leather and fabric.  She learned the business from her mother 18 years ago when they used to export products and this is where she gained most of her experience.  Today this experience translates into the ability she has to provide companies exclusively with backpacks, billfolds, etc. and to sell her products in a specialized sales location in La Candelaria neighborhood ("the historic heart of Bogotá").  The streets of this neighborhood are sloping and full of atmosphere and events, where artists and tourists brush shoulders every day.  This is the environment in which Luz Angela displays everything that she makes.  Her main customers are tourists and visitors whose numbers have gradually increased and, for this reason, she needs to expand her business.

This is Luz Angela's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy leather, adhesives and metal hardware for making bags, billfolds and backpacks that she will display in 'la plaza de artesanias' (craft square).  Her dream is to take part in national small business fairs through the "Artesanias de Colombia" (Colombian Handicrafts) program so that some day she can display her products in other parts of the world.

loans.use: to buy leather, adhesives and metal hardware for making bags, billfolds and backpacks

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 42 year old weaver. She is married to Martin who is a bricklayer; they have 4 children. Those children are: Flora, 22 years old; Febrianus, 20 years; Juventus, 18 years old and in the second grade of Merchant-Marine Vocational School and Angela, 16 years old and in the first grade of Senior High School.

Maria runs a weaving business; she has been engaged in this business for almost ten years. She produces shawls, sheaths for clothing and blankets for house wall decoration. She usually spends five weeks to produce all materials. Maria sells her products to her customers at Inpres market. From the business she can generate IDR 400.000 to 500.000 in a month but the income she generates is insufficient in meeting her family needs. Moreover, her children are growing up and she has to meet their educational costs.

Maria would like to produce more stock in order to generate more income for her family’s living. Unfortunately, she does not have the capital to purchase the materials to produce more products with different colors and patterns. 

In this opportunity Maria would like to request a loan of IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. She is expecting that the application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase the materials to produce more weaving.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en: Romulo is married and a father of five adult-age dependents. He is 59 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Romulo has been a farmer for 21 years. He plants and harvests banana to earn a living. He sells bananas at home and at the local open market every week. Romulo earns approximately PHP 4,750 per month from these activities. Romulo has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to pay labor costs for soil plowing. Romulo has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Romulo hopes to expand his business and buy a hectare of land to be planted with bananas.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for plowing the soil

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school, lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwanaisha has operated a food-vending business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Seasonality is the major challenge she faces, as during the rainy season it becomes difficult to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, Mwanaisha is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Nhang

texts.en: Having life, it means that time for solving with struggles and problems. To living in good living standard as others, so lots of couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to improve economy in family. In the many choices of works, Mr.Nhang chooses one career as a construction worker. According to friendship and good relationship with each other, it makes him to earn around $5 per day. On his wife part, she is a farmer. Both of them have two children in duty .due to the improvement on his business from one day to one day, Mr.Nhang wishes to loan in amount about $500 in the purpose to purchase house materials.

loans.use: to purchase house materials.

loans.name: Eli Isael

texts.es:
Eli, de 28 años de edad, es originario de la comunidad San Antonio ubicada en Yali municipio de Jinotega, esta casado, ella se dedica a la siembra de café , su nivel académico es básico solo curso hasta el sexto grado de primaria . Inicio a la edad de 17 años ayudando a su papa quien le  enseño a trabajar la tierra cuando el se caso su papa le dio 2.5 manzanas de tierras para que las trabajara, y fue cuando el empezó a sembrar  café por su propia cuenta, ahora lo hace en conjunto con su esposa. 
Requiere el préstamo para alquilar un beneficio de café (lugar donde secan, trillan, clasifican y almacenan café orgánico). De esta manera podrá mantener en buenas condiciones su café orgánico y venderlo a un precio justo que le genere ganancias.
El va a seguir sembrando una manzana más de café próximamente, y quiere sembrar tomate.
texts.en:
Eli, 28, is from the community of San Antonio located in Yali, Jinotega.  He’s married and dedicated to growing coffee.  He only finished elementary school going up to sixth grade.  He started helping his father when he was 17 years old.  His father taught him how to work the land and when he got married gave him 2.5 manzanas (Central American unit of land measure) of land for him to till.  That was when he started to grow coffee on his own.  Now he does it together with his wife.

He needs the loan to lease a “beneficio de café” (a place where organic coffee beans are dried, threshed, sorted and stored).  In this way he will be able to keep his organic coffee in good condition and sell it at a fair price that will generate profits.  He will add another manzana of coffee soon and also wants to plant tomatoes.

loans.use: to lease a "beneficio de café" (a place where organic coffee is dried, threshed, sorted and stored).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling bed sheets in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bed sheets to sell

loans.name: Fany Monica

texts.es:
Fany nació en la ciudad de Sicuani (Cusco, Perú), ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre, ella desde hace 7 años que vive en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realiza sus actividades, ella  es costurera y confecciona ropa de vestir. Desde hace varios que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Su esposo es maestro albañil y es especialista en estructuras metálica y su esposo tambien se dedica a la construcción de casas y otras obras. 

Fanny en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de su esposo y desea comprar por ejemplo herramientas y materiales. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Fany was born in the city of Sicuani (Cusco, Peru).  She is 24 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has lived in the city of Cusco for seven years and this is where she carries out her business.  Fany is a seamstress who makes clothes.  She has been in this business for several years and it is doing well.  Her husband is a master builder and a metalwork specialist.  He builds houses and also works on other construction jobs.

On this occasion, Fany needs a loan to invest in her husband's business.  She would like to buy tools and materials.

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as a tourist and commercial area and for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta.  It is also well known because it is the home of one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu".

loans.use: to invest in her husband's business, buying tools and materials

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is widow with six children. She is 64 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Rebecca wants to purchase additional products such as canned goods, toiletries, etc. for her general store. She does this to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She has requested  a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar, 48 years old, has always been a hard-working man.  He has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without daily bread. He is married, with four children. Vuqar has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff.  With a starting capital of 100 USD, and perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise when he was 20. He has expanded his business and today his family helps him with the business. Today he needs to buy additional foods to increase the variety of his products. For this purpose, Vuqar is requesting a loan of 1500 AZN. He is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.  He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en: Hadidja, aged 31, is married to a driver. They have one child who is 12 years old. Hadijha sells clothes and she has been doing this business for more than five years. After making profits, Hadidja plans to build her residential house. She dreams of having a booming business of mixed clothes.  She would love to buy from Tanzania at low prices and sell others in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires en face de la rouite nationale qui traverse sa localité. Avec les revenus générés par son activité, il participe aux dépenses d'entretien des membres de sa famille.Il arrive à épargner sur ses bénéfices et a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC.Il sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acherter du riz, de l'huile, du sucre, du savon et d'autres produits divers destinés à la consommation.Son ambition est de devenir grossiste.
texts.en: This borrower is an unmarried man who owns a food-products store located across from the national highway that runs through his area. With the income from his business, he contributes to providing for the needs of his family members. He has been able to save some of his profits and has opened an account with U-IMCEC. He is seeking a loan of 250,000 F to buy rice, oil, sugar, soap, and various other consumer items. His ambition is to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, soap, and various other consumer goods.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Genalyn has a vulcanizing shop that provides air pressure in tires, tire repair and other vehicle repairs.  Her husband is the repairman. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed for the vulcanizing shop.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the vulcanizing shop

loans.name: Fedelito

texts.en:
Fedelito is 41 years old, married with two children. He is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Fedelito has been operating his business venture for one year. He sells a variety of different products in the local community and he earn 7,000 PHP a month from this business. 

In 2011, Fedelito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelito is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Fedelito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jaribu Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jaribu Women Group in Western Kenya! Linet is the facilitator of the Jaribu Women group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Linet takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Linet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Linet was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Linet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Linet will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Jaribu Women group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Linet and her group with the field officer who is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 8 years.

Celsa requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
La Paz surgió gracias a la unión de varias vecinas de Ciudad del Este, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente el grupo se encuentra con 17 integrantes, quienes están en el décimo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Todas ellas trabajan juntas para poder salir adelante.
Una de las miembros es la señora Juana, quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles. Nos cuenta que gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y ayudarlos. Comenta que gracias a la buena sazón que tiene ha podido formarse una buena clientela y de esa forma salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, panificados, hortalizas y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende. agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The group "La Paz" came about as the result of a number of neighbors in Cuidad del Este getting together.  They are very hardworking women who have a strong desire to get ahead.  At this time, the group has 17 members who are in their 10th loan cycle in the Enterprising Women program of Fundación Paraguaya. They are all working together so that they can get ahead.

One of the members is Juana, who has a business selling food.  She tells us that thanks to her work she has been able to support her family and provide them with assistance.  She comments that thanks to the good flavor of her food she has been able to establish a good customer base, and in this way, get ahead.  She requests a loan to buy meat, bread products, vegetables and other supplies that she needs in order to make the food that she sells.  She thanks the Fundacion for giving her this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread products, vegetables and other supplies

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 44-year-old divorced lady who has been working as a tailor for the last five years. Since she started, she has been able to buy another sewing machine. She also provides a gift-wrapping service.

Now Wafaa has applied for a loan to buy more material so she can later expand and open her own workshop rather than working at home.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Sophal is 40 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling dessert for more than three years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about $10 per day. One of her children is employed and earns about $4 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sophal is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Djiguiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  DJIGUIYA 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARANI, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  M BEMBA        PINDA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by five entrepreneurs from the Khelcom 2 Association, led by Ousmane N.. The group describes their business:

“Context of the project: Located in the tourist zone of Cap Skirring, the village of Boucotte Ouolof is a village of farmers who dedicate themselves to producing fresh fruits and vegetables. In fact, this village is the source of vegetables for the hotels in Cap Skirring. The dissatisfaction of the hotels and the fact that the demand exceeds the supply drives hotels, for example the Club Med, to purchase their fresh produce in Dakar [Senegal’s capital, a two day’s journey from Boucotte Ouolof]. In response to this situation, the Khelcom 2 Association proposes to launch this project in order to meet this demand.

Purpose of the loan: To combat migration from rural areas, improve the living conditions of our members, and satisfy the hotels’ demand for produce.

Activities: Plant 7 hectares of garden with: onions, okra, eggplants, peppers, wild eggplants, cabbage, potatoes, etc. These varieties will be sold to the hotels of Cap Skirring and other tourist-hosting facilities in the area.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet: Situer dans la zone touristique du Cap Skirring, Le village de Boucotte Ouolof est un village d’agriculteurs qui se donne au maraîchage. En effet ce village est la source de ravitaillement des hôtels du Cap Skirring en légume La non satisfaction des hôtels et la supériorité de la demande par rapport à l’offre pousse les hôtelier par exemple le club med à aller se ravitailler à Dakar. Pour faire face à cette situation, le groupement Khelcom 2 se propose d’initier ce projet pour répondre à cette demande.

Objectifs du Prêt : Lutter contre l’exode, améliorer les conditions de vie des membres du groupement, satisfaire la demande auprès des hôtels.

Activités : Exploiter 7 hectares de jardinage en culture de : oignons, gombo, Obergine, Piment, Obergine sauvage, choux, pommes de terre, etc. Ces variétés seront vendues dans les hôtels du cap Skirring et autres structures hôtelières de la zone. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of gardening equipment and seeds; installation of drip irrigation system; transportation to market

loans.name: Margerete
