El socio es el Sr: Carlos, el socio tiene 28 años de edad;  el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 1 hijo de  1 y medio años de edad; el socio trabaja en una imprenta, el socio es empleado en esta imprenta y está encargado de muchas labores dentro de ella, el socio desea ahora el crédito para poder comprar víveres para el hogar, el socio quiere comprar sacos de arroz, aceite, azúcar para su familia el cual pagara de una sola y con lo que le den de su sueldo el ira pagando en partes, para lo cual el socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar al por mayor los víveres que le servirán en su hogar. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de víveres para el hogar.

El socio esta agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE - CUSCO” and is located in Huanchac District which belongs to Cusco Province, Cusco Department.

Carlos, 28 is the member.  He has a spouse and a one-and-a-half-year-old son.  He works in a print shop.  He’s employed by the print shop and he's in charge of several jobs in it.

He needs a loan to buy groceries for home.  He wants to buy sacks of rice, oil and sugar for his family all at once.  He will use his salary to repay the loan in installments.  He needs the loan in order to buy the foodstuffs for his home at wholesale.  He asks for a loan to buy groceries for his home.

He is grateful and wants to express that he will repay his loan installments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Rositas Del Ocho Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Rositas del Ocho" este nombre fuen elejido porque las señoras viven en el barrio ocho de la comunidad y lo que más les gusta son las rosas. El grupo está ubicado en el estado de México. La comunidad se caracterisa por una laguna que se encuentra a 100 mts de la poblacion y la mayoria de las personas van a convivir ahí. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la tercera vez que solicita un prestamo. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama Laura, ella tiene 31 años, estudió solo la primaria, tiene 3 hijos, es ama de casa y a su vez comerciante, comenta que su negocio lo comenzo con mucho amor ya que es la herramienta para que sus hijos sigan estudiandiando y la manera de brindarles una mejor vida. La señora Laura se dedica a la venta de ropa que comercializa por catalogo, vende sus productos con las mismas personas de su comunidad, ya tiene 15 años en su negocio, su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que sus clientes sean fieles con el buen servicio y trato, el prestamo le ayuda a invertir más en ropa, sueña que algun dia tenga un estableciomiento que le permita mostrar todos sus productos y ademas de asesorar a la gente para que comiencen su propio negocio.
texts.en:
This group is called "Rositas del Ocho" a name chosen because it reflects the fact that the members live in the community’s Ocho neighborhood and what they like best are roses.  It is located in the State of México.  The community is noted for a lagoon located 100 meters from the town.  Most of the residents go there to relax.  The group has 10 members and this is the third time it’s requested a loan.

One of the group members is Laura.  She is 31 years old and only finished elementary school.  She has three children.  She’s a housewife but also a merchant at the same time.  She comments that her business started with much love since it’s the tool she uses to provide her children with a better life.

Laura sells clothes via catalogue.  She sells her items to residents in her community.  She’s been in business for 15 years.  Her dedication to her business has allowed her to establish a regular customer base that is faithful to her thanks to the good service and kind treatment.  

The loan will help her invest in more clothes.  She dreams with some day having an establishment where she can display all her products and counsel people who would like to start their own business.

loans.use: to invest in catalogue clothing.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en:
Fayza is a 44-year-old mother who has three children. After her children grew up, the family’s expenses increased so Fayza wanted to add another income source for her family (besides her husband’s salary) to support the family financially.

Using her creativity and her skills, Fayza started a year ago designing plastic flowers and trees as inside plant decorations, as shown in the picture. She basically takes orders and creates them at her house.

Having a pretty good space in her house garden, Fayza wants to add decorating with naturA. flowers to what she does, including making bouquets from naturA. flowers. In order to do that, she has applied for this loan to buy some seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.use: To buy seeds, plants and the tools she needs for the garden.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is a 48-year old married woman with five children. The oldest child is 25. Minda’s husband works as a farmer.

Minda is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land located in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Minda has been growing rice for 8 years. She also raises pigs and goats.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Minda hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and a mother of seven adult-aged dependents. She is 43 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Vilma is a farmer. She grows rice and harvests palay to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She earns approximately PHP 36,000 per quarter from this farm. She has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 at GDMPC to purchase rice seedlings to be planted this coming planting season.

Vilma has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Vilma hopes to gain more profit and purchase an additional rice field.

loans.use: To purchase rice seedlings.

loans.name: Take & Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Take and Pay” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yussuf is the leader of this group. He is 27 years old and married with 4 children – 3 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Yussuf sells building materials – cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. He has been a businessman for 15 years. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, corrugated zinc, nails, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Tahreer

texts.en: Tahreer is a 33-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Tahreer manages an animal farm raising cattle and goats. Her husband works on the farm and generates money by selling dairy products. This is the only source of income for the family. Tahreer wants to buy goat grains but she doesn't have enough money to pay in cash. Therefore, she took out a loan of JOD 800. By getting this loan, the animal productivity will increase and Tahreer will generate a better income. Tahreer is photographed in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase goat grains

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 42-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.

Laila started her embroidery business from home years ago, and over time, she could provide it with machines. Now she is requesting a loan of 1200 JD to purchase materials needed for the project.

An aspiration of Laila's is to expand her project and purchase another sewing machine to increase the sales volume and her income, which will help her daughter in continuing her university education.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Balikuddembe Women's Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Grace is a happy camper. She is highly optimistic. For the past decade, Grace has been bringing tenacity, diligence, and determination to her food sales enterprise in the Lugazi food market.
Hard work is an important part of her daily routine.
Grace, a happily-married mother of 7, has struck quite a chord with many of her clients with her friendly attitude and the way she acts expeditiously in attending to them.
Unbeknownst to her, it has kept clients coming and her business afloat.
Grace sells staple foods such as bananas, maize flour, sweet potatoes, yams, Irish potatoes, green vegetables, and rice.
Grace also subsists on some modest income from a cattle sales business. Prior to engaging in the above business, she was leaning more toward farming.
Grace is on the ball and she sees more success on the horizon. Her determination, hard work ethic, and tenacity are distinguishing traits that will continually work in her favor.
She says that her weekly gross sales are to the tune of Uganda shillings 50,000.
Grace says she intends to utilize this Kiva loan to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, rice, and sweet potatoes to resell, and to pay fees for her kids.

loans.name: Ana Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 34 años de edad, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos.   

Actualmente, Graciela vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta  de ajo, ella viaja a la ciudad de Arequipa a comprar sus productos (ajo). Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Graciela requiere el préstamo para comprar más ajos. Su sueño de Graciela es llegar a vender sus productos (Ajo) en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. 

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Graciela was born in the city of Cusco and is 34 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have two children.

Currently, Graciela lives and works in her native city of Cusco. She sells garlic, travelling to the city of Arequipa to buy her products (garlic). She has been involved in this business for five years already, and it is going very well for her. At this point, Graciela needs the loan to buy more garlic. Her dream is to eventually sell her products (garlic) in the city of Puerto Maldonado.

The "Comuzone I" communal bank meets every month in Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, as well as for having one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more garlic

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина жительница района Дангары. Ей 24 года. Она не замужем. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее имеет средне - специальное образование. По специальности она портниха. В этой области она работает три года. Кредит берет для покупки цветных ниток, пуговиц, бисера и однотонных материалов.
texts.en: Parvina lives in the Dangara district.  She is 24 years old and single.  She lives together with her parents.  Parvina has a secondary specialized education.  She is a seamstress.  She has been working in this field for three years.  Parvina is requesting this loan for the purchase of color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics.

loans.use: to buy color threads, buttons, beads and solid-color fabrics

loans.name: Patience Stella

texts.en: Patience is a 28-year-old divorced woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 1 to 8 years. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a cereal sales business where she sells maize, beans, peas, peanuts, millet, and sorghum. She has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase maize. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a van to facilitate running her business.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra money from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme célibataire sans enfants.Elle tient un restaurant au bord de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité.Elle vend le petit déjeuner , le déjeuner et le dinner.Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins et de participer aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter 2 sacs de mil, 3 sacs de haricot, du riz et de l'huile. Son ambition est de construire sa propre maison et de la mettre en location.
texts.en: This borrower is an unmarried woman with no children. She owns a restaurant on the side of the national highway that runs through her area. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her income allows her to take care of herself and help in providing for her family. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 F to buy two bags of millet, three bags of beans, rice, and oil. Her ambition is to build her own house and rent it out.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of millet, 3 bags of beans, rice, and oil.

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam is 25 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband is a clerk in the local market. 

She started her garment retailing business by renting a counter in a local market. Her products are very stylish and handpicked, and  therefore she has many regular customers. 

Now that her products are selling well, she needs to expand her supply in order to run her business successfully. She is a young and hardworking woman who says, "I have a baby coming, Every time I think about it, it makes me work even harder."

She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khi

texts.en:
Khi is a 47 year old married woman. She has 3 children, one son and two daughters. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khi earns a living running a general store which she has done for 10 years. Khi would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Doña Marlene de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida y nacatamales lleva 18 años dedicándose a este negocio. Inicio con sus actividades con dinero propio y apoyo de su esposo, compro materia prima para empezar con sus nacatamales tenia 33 años edad cuando comenzó. Anteriormente tenía una pulpería pero decidió quitarla para dedicarse a la venta de este delicioso plato típico.  
Ella requiere para compra de maíz, leña, carne,verduras, arroz. Ya que son los principales ingredientes que utiliza para realizar sus tan apetecidos  nacatamales. Uno de sus proyectos próximos es terminar de construir su casa que esta algo deteriorada e invertir en mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene is 51 years old, she is married and she has 5 children, all economically independent. She is a retailer and she engages in selling meals and “nactamales” (typical dish made of maize, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf), something she has been doing for 18 years. She started her activity with her own money and with some help form her husband. She began by buying ingredients for her nactamales, and she was 33 when she started. She had been previously running a corner shop but she decided to close it to engage in selling this typical delicious dish.
She is requesting a loan to buy maize, firewood, meat, vegetables and rice, as these are the main ingredients she uses to prepare her really tasty nactamales. One of her future projects is to finish building her house as it is a bit dilapidated and to invest in improving her activity.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, meat, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan wants a loan to buy new clothes to sell. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married, aged 42, and has the responsibility of taking care of her three children.

She hopes to educate her children and build a permanent home. Her business goal is to expand into new markets.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Fredy, es conviviente y tiene 38 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos; el socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos como detergentes,jabones entre otros productos,el distribuye a las diferentes tiendas que venden estos productos,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos . El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como jabones,detergentes y desinfectantes al por mayor.
El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Mr. Fredy, 38, has a common-law wife and two children.  He sells consumer products such as detergents, soaps and other items which he distributes to the specialist stores.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and is able to provide for his children through his work.  He wants to expand business to sell more products.  He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale items such as soap, detergents and disinfectants.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale soap, detergent and disinfectants.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a businessman who runs a computer college to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He is also married and has one child aged 3 years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to open a secondary school in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy computers.

loans.use: To buy computers

loans.name: Mahuclo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUCLO est un groupe composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nanan Awaou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 35 ans. Nanan Awaou n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Nanan Awaou est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Honoré. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Nanan Awaou et son mari. Pour cette raison,Nanan Awaou vend du riz accompagné de diverses sauces dans sa région depuis environ deux ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Nanan Awaou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Nanan Awaou sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MAHUCLO, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, de l'huile végétale et de la tomate.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy was inspired to improve her farming business when her friends told her about Juhudi Kilimo and the partnership they have with Kiva to support marginalized women smallholder farmers. Juhudi Kilimo was established with a mission to uplift, empower, and validate women across Kenya. 

Lucy is a farmer from Maara, a remote village in Chuka, Kenya, who believes that agriculture is not just for the older generation. She is a loving mother who has farmed for five years so that she can supplement her income from the small “side hustles” she does. Lucy grows crops and raises goats. She enjoys farming. Her biggest challenges are the lack of finances and fighting diseases. She will use the loan to purchase dairy goats. She will sell the goat milk and goat skin, which is very expensive and earns more profits. This will translates to more income and improved living conditions for her family. She will sell the milk, meat and skin to increase her income. 

The profits will be used to repay the loan on time and grow the business. Lucy wants to set up an example for her children by being the most successful dairy goat farmer in her village because she finds farming very rewarding.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy goat

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
To be a young smallholder farmer and starting a new family with a small portion of land is a challenge for people in the Kitale area of Kenya. Jane who is a mother of four has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Jane, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is only for the large scale farmers because although she is a smallholder farmer she is making progress. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she wants to diversify her product portfolio and start cereal selling business. Her remote village has a high demand for cereals the only problem is the unwilling nature of financial institutions to fund smallholder farmers but she is not worried because Juhudi Kilimo has provided the platform to help smallholder farmer like him access credit facilities. She is kindly requesting for a loan to buy cereals so that she can sell and meet the demand in her village and markets nearby. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.
Be inspired during this season of giving by granting her a loan!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by ten members of the ND.ène association, represented by Mamadou ND.. Nder is a tiny farming village on the southern edge of the Sahara desert, whose colorful history as the capital of the ancient Wolof kingdom of Walo is still celebrated in Senegalese folklore. In this arid region, profitable cultivation of Nder’s main crops of yams and peanuts relies on irrigation, but capital for investment in irrigation pumps has always been scarce. The ND.ène association therefore submitted the following application for a microfinance loan:

“The state having established a general support framework for community development associations since the 1960’s, our group quickly realized that grassroots community development will not be a reality unless our members are effectively mobilized and organized for this purpose. Taking into account the extremely difficult socioeconomic context characterized by: 1) migration out of rural areas due to the lack of promising local development alternatives, and 2) The absence in the Diéri zone of any hydro-agricultural system established by the state or managed by the local government, the group rolled up our sleeves and decided to rely on our own efforts and on those of our strategic partners in order to achieve our goals.

The purpose of this loan is to provide the members of the group with a motorized irrigation pump with a capacity of 300m3/hour, which can irrigate 10 hectares of fields and will be managed by a pump attendant who will ensure its maintenance and proper functioning. The team responsible for this project will keep track of its progress and will begin to repay the loan without difficulty as soon as the first harvests begin.”

Original French :

« L’état ayant défini le cadre général d’intervention des associations de développement depuis les années 1960, à cet effet le groupement a vite compris que le développement à la base ne sera une réalité que si les membres ne seront fortement mobilisés en s’organisant en conséquence. Compte tenu du contexte socio économique très difficile marqué essentiellement par :

• L’exode rural faute d’alternative de développement endogène prometteuse.

• Absence d’aménagement hydro agricole conçu par l’état et géré par les sociétés d’encadrement dans la zone du Diéri ;

le groupement s’est retroussé les manches, pour compter sur ses efforts propres et sur ceux de ses partenaires stratégiques pour atteindre l’objectif qu’il s’est assigné.

Objectif du Prêt :

Il s’agit de mettre à la disposition des membres du groupement un groupe moto pompe d’une capacité de 300m3/heure pouvant irrigué 10 ha de culture et sera géré par un pompiste qui assurera l’entretien et le fonctionnement.

Pour le Remboursement :

L’équipe de suivi du projet fera des descentes dans tous les projets et dès la fin des premiers récolte commencera à faire le recouvrement des crédits sans difficulté. »

Background :

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Irrigation pump purchase

loans.name: Santi

texts.en: Santi is a 27 year old mother of 3 children. The eldest is a boy and the younger two are girls. They are all in elementary school. She makes doormats using fabric remnants that she stitches together into nice doormats. She buys the material from garment factories nearby for $0.18/kg. She has been in this business since before she joined MBK. She sells her products for $2.50 - $3.80 per score through intermediary traders as she does not have the courage to sell them directly yet. She needs this loan so that she can buy more materials for making her products.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make her doormats

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 63 years old and has two children. For three years she has been working in a grocery store and she has now expanded her selection to include goods for the home. She travels once a week to San Cristobal (a two-hour trip) to acquire foodstuffs, and every fifteen days to Tuxtla Gutierrez (three hours by highway) to buy household goods in the city’s supermarkets. Her regular customers come from the indigenous communities near her area. She would like to use the loan to invest in supplies for her grocery store. She belongs to the Santa Lucia 4 group.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

MARIA VICTORIA TIENE 63 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, LLEVA TRES AÑOS TRABAJANDO EN UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y ACTUALMENTE LA A AMPLIADO CON ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. PARA COMPRAR MERCANCIA COMESTIBLE VIAJA A SAN CRISTOBAL (A DOS HORAS) UNA VEZ A LA SEMANA Y CADA 15 DIAS A TUXTLA GUTIERREZ (A TRES HORAS POR CARRETERA) A COMPRAR EN LOS SUPERMERCADOS DE ESA CIUDAD ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. SUS CLIENTES HABITUALES SON GENTE DE COMUNIDADES INDIGENAS CERCANAS A SU ZONA. LO DEL PRESTAMO QUIERE INVERTIRLO PARA ABASTECER SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO DE SANTA LUCIA 4.

loans.use: Merchant

loans.name: Elsa Eva

texts.es:
Elsa is currently separated from her husband and she has 2 children. One is 19 years old and the younger one is 16. She began her business because she wanted to give her children a better education and to improve their quality of life. Additionally, because she can’t count on her husband’s income, it was necessary for her to do something to get by. She began by selling a little bit of everything 6 years ago. During the past year she decided to work full time at selling cosmetics, and her sales improve day after day.

Elsa is requesting a loan of $475.00 to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her products more quickly to her customers. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for the support you give, allowing her to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Elsa esta actualmente separada de su esposo y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 19 y otro menor de 16 años de edad, ella empezó con su negocio por que quería brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejorar su calidad de vida, además de que al no contar con los ingresos de su esposo era necesario para ella hacer algo para salir adelante. Ella empezó vendiendo de todo un poco desde hace 6 años atrás, siendo el último año en el que se decidió dedicarse de lleno a la venta de cosméticos y sus ventas mejoran día a día.

Elsa está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar más mercadería y así poder ofrecer sus productos de manera más rápida a sus clientes y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics merchandise

loans.name: Maria Eneida

texts.es:
Maria, 51, is a widow. She has three children who no longer live with her. Maria is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She started her own business selling natural weight-control products three years ago, both to clear expenses after the death or her husband and to supplement her small pension. Fortunately, demand for the products is very good and her customers have seen good results from their use.

Maria is now asking for a US$275 loan to buy merchandise. She promises to repay it in 4 months. She hopes to continue growing her business and get ahead. You play an important part in Maria's life. She is very grateful for the opportunity you're giving her to improve her life and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos, que viven aparte. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, desde hace tres años que falleció su esposo, para poder solventar sus gastos, Maria inició su propio negocio con al venta de productos naturales para control de peso, porque que la pensión que recibe es muy baja. Afortunadamente la demanda por estos productos es muy buena ya que ha tenido buenos resultados en sus clientes.

Ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares para la compra de mercancía, que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con esto espera continuar creciendo con su negocio y salir adelante. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar su vida y su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla A. is 48 year old mother of five children. She lives with her husband in Bware Migori Kenya. She is well known in her the community as japur (local language meaning  farmer). She has a big chunk of land where she grows sugarcane. She also rears local cattle breeds that produce between 8 to 10 litres of milk a day which she sells to the community at US $ 0.45 a litre. She plans to buy a dairy cattle breed that can produce not less 15 litres a day with US $ 800 she has applied for.

loans.use: Buy hybrid dairy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicken feeders, drinkers, heaters, chicken feed, and medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S., 39, is married with six children and lives with her husband in a part of PreyVeng province, Cambodia. She opened her business in 2004 selling provisions of food and other grocery items. She typically earns around three dollars each day. Her husband is a village chief earning three dollars a day and helps his wife when he is available. One of her married sons works as a driver and the rest of the children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Meas S. will use this loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory and to repair her son’s car.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory and to repair her son’s car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more nutrition products to quickly sell / Invertir en mas productos para vender mas rapidamente

loans.name: Sai

texts.en: Mrs. Sai M. is 35 years old and earns about $4 a day raising pigs and growing rice on her farm. Her husband, Mr. Lao Siem, makes a living raising fish, and makes around $3 a day. They have three children who help their mother farm. They have applied for a loan to buy a grinding mill that they can use and also rent out to their neighbors. Mrs. Sai plans to use the additional revenue generated by the mill to support the family and buy fertilizers to use on her farm. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To buy a grinding mill and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel is a young mother who strives to provide the best she can for her family. She has been farmer since childhood and comes from a family that has had great success in agriculture. This is the livelihood that has allowed her to live independently. She has dedicated herself for the past 5 years to the cultivating of maiz, potato and wheat. At the end of the harvest, she sells her goods direct to consumers in the marketplace of her city. The loan she is requesting will be used for the purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor to prepare her farmland for the next growing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Raquel, es una joven madre de familia, que se esfuerza por lograr obtener los mejores ingresos para su familia, ella es agricultora desde muy niña, ya que su familia es cuna de famosos agricultores y esta es la fuente de ingreso que le permite vivir de manera independiente. Ella lleva 5 años dedicándose al cultivo de maíz, papa y trigo. Al término de la cosecha los oferta directamente en el mercado de su ciudad.Su solicitud atiende al deseo de adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y para alquiler un tractor a fin de preparar sus tierras para la próxima siembra.

loans.use:
Purchase seeds, fertilizer and to rent a tractor.

Compra de semillas abonos y alquiler de un tractor.

loans.name: Fofana Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. S. Fofana Mariama was born the 22 of April, 1953 in Sokodé, 470 km (292 miles) from Lomé. She is married and mother of 5 children. She has a business reselling plastic garbage cans, loincloths and toothpaste in the neighbourhood of Agoè. Generally she is in the habit of distributing her merchandise to her loyal clients and collects payment every 8 days. This is her second loan and she is asking for $600 (250000 FCFA) to buy 30 pieces of cloth for loincloths and 4 large plastic garbage cans. These purchases will allow her to replenish her stock.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame S. Fofana Mariama est née le 22 avril 1953 à Sokodé à 470 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de seau en plastique, de pagne en bazin et des pâtes dentifrices dans le quartier d’Agoè. Généralement elle a l’habitude de distribuer ses marchandises à ses clients fidèles et procède à la collecte des fonds chaque 8 jours. Elle est à son deuxième cycle de crédit et sollicite 250000 FCFA pour acheter 30 pièces de pagne bazin et 4 grands seaux en plastique. Ces achats lui serviront pour la reconstitution du stock épuisé.

loans.use: purchase of 30 pieces of cloth for loinclothes and plastic garbage cans

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly Y. lives in Deok Peang Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a garment factory worker. Her husband, Mr. Thol Lan, is a construction worker and subsistence farmer. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough cattle to plow his field. Therefore, Mrs. Ly Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals. Mrs. Ly Y. is 30 and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the last one is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ly Y. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers to support her husband’s field. Mrs. Ly Y. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase an additional cow to add to the old one to use as draft animals.

loans.name: Paulina's Kivulini Group

texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years. She is married with five children between the ages of twelve and three. She has been a farmer since 1999. Every day she works from 7am to midnight at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Paulina now hopes for a loan to buy more seed and farm instruments. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam, Lilian, Elibahati and Happness, who also sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more seed and farm instruments.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. is a cheerful person, always with a big smile and happy in spite of the fact that since 2005, she has been encarcerated in the women´s jail, the Centro Preventivo Santa Teresa, and that her husband abandoned her because of her problems with the law.

In spite of her situation, she did not give up and learned how to make crafts. In this way, she is using her time for something productive. When she first arrived at the Centro Preventivo she was not able to do crafts and now she can make a wiD. variety of articles using raffia and styrofoam. These sell very well, mainly on the days that visitors come to the jail.

With a loan she would like to buy a larger quantity of supplies at better prices. In this way she can produce and sell more of her products.

Her dream is to get out of jail and together with her daughter, start up a gift store to earn and save money. She thinks that she should now take care of herself and not be a burden to her family. Irma R. is a great woman and a good role model insiD. the women´s jail.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Irma R. es una persona muy alegre, siempre esta con una gran sonrisa, y contenta a pesar D. que desD. el año 2005, ella se encuentra en la cárcel D. mujeres, en el Centro Preventivo Santa Teresa, y su esposo la abandono por su problema con Ley.

Ella a pesar D. su situación, nunca se dio por vencida y aprendió a trabajar manualidades, D. esta forma aprovechar su tiempo en algo útil y productivo, cuando ella llego al Centro Preventivo ella no podía hacerlas, y ahora pueD. hacer una gran variedad D. artículos en materiales D. rafia y fomi, los cuales se venden muy bien, principalmente los días que reciben visitas en dicho centro.

Con su préstamo ella quiere comprar materiales por mayor cantidad y a mejor precio, D. esta forma ella podrá producir y vender más sus productos.

Su sueño es salir D. la cárcel y poner una tienda D. regalos en compañía D. su hija, ganar dinero y ahorrar. Ella piensa que ya tiene una edad en la cual tiene que luchar por ella misma, para no ser una carga para su familia. Irma R. es una gran mujer, un ejemplo dentro D. la cárcel D. mujeres.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making crafts.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria M., 47, is married with 11 children. She has many years of experience on the plantation with taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD). SPBD loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be used to improve business and help out the family. Her husband and children do the plantation too.

loans.use: To improve business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Uy

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Uy K. has taken a loan in order to improve her living conditions. She now lives in Ponlai village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem on her land because of infertile soil. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Uy K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make it more productive. Mrs. Uy K. is a 56-year-old widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to restore her field

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar

texts.en:
Shamim Akhtar baji is 58 year old married lady. Her husband's name is M. and he has a motor bike rental business. She resides in a historical place called Yadgar that is situated in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 30 years. Shamim baji is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons sell ready-made garments for both ladies and gents. Her daughter is 16 years old and reads in 10th Standard.

Shamim baji also has a garment selling business. She buys garments from Peshawar, which is famous for its garment collection, and then sells in different bazaars in Lahore. She has 30 years of experience in this business. She successfully repaid her five previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy garments to resell.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon M. is a villager in Ou Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small store where she sells groceries. Her husband, Mr. Chu Tith, helps her in the current business. They have a child who is a motorbike taxi driver. Although Mrs. Khon M. and her family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. In order to improve these, Mrs. Khon M. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 32 años, vive solo con sus tres pequeños hijos; Bladimir de 9, Yanira de 7 y Mery de 6 años, se divorció de su pareja hace algunos años, viviendo actualmente en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, sale desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para adquirir el pescado que necesita para vender y así mantener a su familia, realiza esta labor desde hace ya 14 años, tiempo en el cual se ha hecho una experta en el negocio, gustándole, ya que es un trabajo digno y tranquilo que le ofrece la oportunidad de brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. El negocio va bien y es muy rentable, pero muchas veces le resulta muy cansado, y el olor de pescado es difícil de quitar, pero Beatriz es muy persistente y espera crecer más en su negocio para salir adelante y poder forjar un futuro mejor para ella y sus hijos. Este es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy responsable y puntual en lo pagos, ya que no quiere defraudar a las personas que confiaron en ella. Beatriz espera mejorar en su negocio y con el préstamo obtenido quiere comprar pescado en mayores cantidades y así aumentar sus ingresos, invirtiendo todo su préstamo en ello.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 32 years old and lives alone with her three small children: Bladimir, age 9; Yanira, age 7 and Mery, age 6. She divorced her husband a few years ago and currently lives in the house she inherited from her parents. She is a very hard-working woman who goes out early in the morning to get the fish she needs to sell and in this way supports her family. She has done this work for 14 years during which time she has become an expert in the business. She enjoys it because it is honorable and quiet work, although sometimes is it tiring and the smell of fish is hard to get rid of. But Beatriz is persistent and hopes to grow the business so that she can get ahead and provide a better future for herself and her children. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma; she has been responsible and on time with her payments since she does not want to disappoint the people who have put their trust in her. Beatriz hopes to improve her business and with this loan wants to buy fish in greater quantities so that she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of fish she buys for resale.

loans.name: Gulzadeh

texts.en:
Gulzadeh M. is 46 years old. She is married and has two daughters. She is a very active woman. Six years ago she started her business of raising cattle. She now has 3 cows. She sells the animals after fattening them. She sells the animals to the local market and to local restaurants. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children. Her children are her main responsibility.

Despite recent success, since her business is still quite small, it doesn't generate enough income for the whole family. Gulzadeh would like to request a loan so she can expand her business and thereby increase her family's income. She will use the profit generated from the business to repay the loan on time. She is asking for a loan of $1200 for the term of 15 months. She will use the loan to buy two more young cattle, which she will sell when they are fully grown. The well-being of Gulzadeh’s family and her business are in your hands.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Kaniz M. Rafiq Group

texts.en:
Kaniz is 53 years old, married, and has five children. She lives with her family in Riwind, Pakistan. Her husband, M. R., has operated his own flour selling business for the past ten years. Two of Kaniz’s children work in a factory, while the younger sons are currently attending school. Kaniz believes in the value of hard work, and allows her to face each coming day. Kaniz knits and creates clothing to sell in the local market, and uses the income earned to pay the school fees. She has successfully completed three previous loans, and is now applying for another loan to sell more flour.

Kaniz is the group leader for women in the town. Hanfian baji and Sugran baji are both requesting a loan to purchase warm clothes to resell. Zubaida baji wishes to purchase cooking oil to use and vend as well.

This is a group loan. The funds will be evenly distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members will mutually cover each other’s loans- if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. They thank you advance for your generosity!

loans.use: To buy flour to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda A. is a 31-year-old divorced mother of three daughters. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She says she opted for divorce due to her husband's infidelity.

Linda works in order to support her children and has been in business for eight years. She buys footwear in Kumasi and treks to markets to sell it. She deals in all kinds of footwear – plimsolls, shoes, slippers, etc. for both men and women. Linda wants a loan to procure more goods. Her hope is to give her children all the financial support they need to succeed academically.

loans.use: To buy footwear for resale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa H. is 35 years old and is a single mother of one child. Her child is in school at the community where they live. Adwoa lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana with her family.

She trades in fish to earn a living. Adwoa buys her stock at the seashore directly from the fishermen, because at that place the fish are cheap. She buys what she can afford which is not much. She fries the fish and arranges them in a sieve. She mostly sells through hawking as she does not have money to rent a store in the market. She has customers whom she supplies with quality fish.

It is her dream to buy more fish so that she can better manage her trade. Her customers place their order for fish and Adwoa will take her time to smoke some of the fish for them, apart from the frying. This has helped her to maintain a strong customer base.

Her major problem has to do with adequate funds to expand her stock. She is therefore requesting a loan to enable her to buy more fish. Adwoa means ‘Monday born’ . She says your support is much needed. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Bekyere’ which means God will provide.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, fresh fish etc. for her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en: Christopher, 26 years old and single, lives with his parents in Barangay Alibago, Enrile, Cagayan. A tricycle driver in their village, he uses his income to support the needs of his parents since they do not have a stable source of income. Christopher is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 for the repair of his motorcycle for the safety of his passengers.  He hopes that someday he will able to sustain his business for his future family.

loans.use: Tricycle Repair

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en: Kwabena is 44 years old. He is married with four kids. Kwabena has been a taxi driver for the past 12 years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He drives passengers from the local lorry station to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 55 pesewas per head. However, his car has been giving him some problems and he needs money to maintain it. He therefore requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi to earn an income to support his family and get his kids back to school. He belongs to the community group called “Nyame be kyere” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To undertake maintenance on his car

loans.name: Soliboy

texts.ru: Солибой пожилой мужчина 67 лет. Он женат и отец 6-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Солибой занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Солибоя – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Солибой экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Солибой продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Soliboy is an elderly 67 year old man. He is married and is the father of 6 children. His wife does not have a job. She stays at home and does the housework and feeds the livestock. Soliboy fattens and sells livestock. The start of summer is the season to purchase livestock for Soliboy because in the spring livestock and feed are cheap and you do not need to pay a lot to fatten livestock. The livestock eats the mountain grass and Soliboy can save on the livestock feed. With the start of winter Soliboy sells part of the fattened livestock, but he does not purchase livestock. He purchases feed to fatten the leftover livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten and sell livestock

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is from the village of Santa Filomina in Iligan City. Rosalie is a 33-year-old, married woman with one infant child. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector; specifically, she operates a specialized retail store. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities (primarily from selling products her customers use on a daily basis, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste).

In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services and, in turn, to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This is the first loan Rosalie is seeking via HSPFI. Indeed, Rosalie is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of this loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and its purpose is to provide reach out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao to provide financial assistance.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by increasing inventory

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Abdufato

texts.en:
S. Abdufato has been in the bakery business for 10 years. So that he could provide for his family, he started working as a trainee in one of the local bakeries at the age of 16. For one work shift that usually lasted 17 hours he was only paid 6 to 7 loaves of bread, which was not enough for his family.

He started looking for a space so he could open his own business. Once he found one, he started his own bakery. In the beginning, Abdufato was only baking special orders for weddings because he was short of cash. After a period of time, when he accumulated more funds, he started producing bread for sale in the market. Currently, his father and two hired employees are helping him in the business. Abdufato is asking for additional funding so that he can increase his production.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour  wholesale for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 60 years old and a widow with 5 children. She sells foodstuffs and other items. She lives in Benin City, Edo. State.

She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more foodstuffs like rice, beans, peppers, and other items to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: La señora Wilma se dedica a hacer manualidades como manteles pintados y bordados, muñecos en soft, set de baño, set de cocina, esta 10 años con esta actividad, sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, ayuda a su hija con los quehaceres de la casa, ya que ella trabaja. Doña Wilma cuida y quiere mucho a sus nietos y siempre está pediente de ellos. Ella también dicta cursos de bordado y pintado en tela, es muy creativa y le gusta lo que hace. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela, hilos y demás material para los cursos que está dando.Es una cleinte  puntual y antigua de la institución.
texts.en:
Wilma makes handicrafts like painted and embroidered table cloths, dolls, bathroom sets, and kitchen sets. She has been doing this for ten years. Her children are grown and independent. Wilma helps her daughter with the household chores because she works. Wilma takes care of and loves her grandchildren very much. She always pays attention to them. She also teaches classes on embroidery and painting on fabric. She is very creative, and she likes what she does. The loan is to buy fabric, thread, and other material for the courses she teaches. She is an old and punctual client of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material to teach courses

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie S. is from the village of Lugait in Misamis Oriental province. She is 57 years old, married and has four adult children. For over three years Elsie has owned and run a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells both food and other daily necessities to her local community. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to their financial services. This will be her first loan from them. She is requesting 5000 PHP to be used to expand and vary her line of products and so generate additional revenue.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand and vary her shop's offerings

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 04 hijos, vive en el la comunidad de Pusuyo, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 3 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado ovino.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino, para cría, la señora se ayuda con sus chacras y a veces también elabora artesanías.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones donde comparte con sus compañeras.

loans.use: Para la compra de ganado ovino.

loans.name: Newrey

texts.en:
Newrey G. is from the village of Sinayawan in Valencia City. She is 31 years old. Newrey is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Newrey sells ready-to-wear clothing and ripe bananas in the local community. Newrey has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Newrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Newrey is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Newrey's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
ANGELICA MARIA C. H. tiene 24 años y es madre de una niña de un año y ocho meses, estudió la carrera de cosmética dermatológica en un CEO del estado. Hace tres años sus hermanos y su madre le apoyaron con un pequeño capital (préstamo) que necesitaba para comenzar con la venta de algunos abarrotes en un espacio de su casa; al inicio compró arroz, fideos, gaseosas, pañales, champú, galletas lo que con el tiempo generó ganancias debido al esfuerzo y perseverancia de María, los ingresos que obtuvo de sus ventas lo invirtió en mercadería para su pequeño negocio que lo trasladó en la casa de su suegra. Los siguientes préstamos que obtuvo compró algunos implementos de cosmética y un exhibidora de helados, porque piensa más adelante instalar un salón de belleza dado a que en la zona donde radica no hay ese servicio. Gracias a sus ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos de la familia, como la alimentación y salud dado a que ninguno cuenta con un seguro. 
Necesita el préstamo para comprar juguetes porque se acerca campaña navideña y así de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica Maria C. H. is 24 years old and the mother of a 1-year, 8-month old daughter. She studied for a cosmetic dermatology degree at a state-run school. Three years ago her mother and siblings supported her with a small loan that she needed to start selling some groceries from a space in her home. At first she purchased rice, noodles, soft drinks, diapers. shampoo and cookies, and with time earned an income thanks to her hard work and perseverance. She reinvested her profits in merchandise for her small business, which she moved to her mother-in-law's house. With additional loans she was able to purchase some ice cream and cosmetic equipment because in the future she plans to set up a beauty salon since there isn't one in her area. Thanks to her sales, she is able to help her husband with family expenses, like food and health care, since neither has insurance. She is requesting a loan to purchase toys because Christmastime is nearing and in this way she can continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys for Christmastime

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. is 51 years old and he is married to Pamela who is a housewife. They are blessed with four children. The family lives in Magongo, Mombasa and Michael is a businessman there. He has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes and shoes for nine years now.

Michael was introduced to KADET by a friend and is glad to access his first loan. He intends to increase the stock of clothes and shoes with the money. Especially during the month of December, business booms with everyone wanting to buy new attire for the Christmas festive season. He actually asked for this loan to be able to target this demand for new stuff in his business and maximize on the profits.
 
He hopes to become a manufacturer and supplier of textiles in the future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase clothes for selling.

loans.name: Santos Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Santos Angel R. tiene un molino para moler maiz y tambien vende leña, tiene mas de 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad es soltero y padre de 1 hija la cual ya esta casada.
Santos se levanta muy temprano para moler maiz a muchas personas que se dedican a la venta dde tortillas y otras para consumo en el hogar.
Santos necesita el credito para invertirlo en compra de leña, maiz y repuestos de su molino. Esto le permitira un mejor rendimiento y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes,  logrando por consiguiente mejores ingresos que le permitiran mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Senor Santos Angel R. has a mill to grind corn and also sells firewood; he has had this business for over 4 years. He is single and is the father of a daughter who is married. Santos gets up very early to grind the corn for many people who are in the business of selling tortillas and other items for home consumption. Santos needs a loan to invest in the purchase of firewood, corn and spare parts for his mill. This will allow him to increase his production and in this way provide a better service to his customers, thus achieving an increased income that will allow him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the mill and firewood

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: Doña Gloria tiene 53 años de edad, vive en barrio de la capital de Managua 14 de Febrero, junto a su familia de cuatro hijos ya casados y su esposo que vende productos lácteos, la señora Gloria desde hace diez años administra su pulpería que pudo comenzar cuando vendió unas vacas que tenia, hasta ahora a podido mantener su equilibrio de venta y gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic ha logrado aumentar su inventario. Con este préstamo quiere invertir en compra de productos enlatados, como sardina, atún, como salsa inglesa, piticuas, maíz, salsa de tomate en mucha cantidad, como pollo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, entre otros para poder aumentar las ventas en este mes ya que se vende mucho para esta temporada de fin de año. Lo cual espera ya que sus ventas en estos meses no han sido buenas, lo cual espera aumentar. A futuro desea hacer mejoras a su casa en el cambio  de las divisiones de los cuarto ya que esta muy viejo. Lo cual espera lograrlo a corto plazo junto con el apoyo de Afodenic.
texts.en:
Doña Gloria is 53 years old. She lives in the “14 de Febrero” neighborhood, in the capital of Managua, with her 4 married children and her husband who sells dairy products. For ten years, Gloria has managed her grocery store;she started it when was able to sell a few cows that she had. Now she has been able to maintain a balance of sales and thanks to the financing from Afodenic, she has increased her inventory. With this loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of canned products, like sardines and tuna, like worcestershire sauce, peas, corn, large amounts of tomato sauce as well as chicken, rice, beans, sugar, oil among other things; so she can increase her sales this month, since she sells a lot at the end of the year. Her sales were not very good in the last months, so she hopes they will increase. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her home, changing the divisions of the rooms now that it’s old. She hopes she will be able to do so in the near future with the support of Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, tuna, worcestershire sauce, tomato sauce and othe products

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José Manuel G. es un caballero que del municipio de San Rafael del Sur y que se ha preocupado por el mejoramiento del nivel de vida de su amada familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus tres hijos.
Se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superar en su familia. Actualmente ha decidido brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a ellos y para ello ha iniciado a comprar los enseres necesarios para el hogar y esta vez comprará electrodomésticos para el hogar y por este motivo solicita el crédito en Ceprodel para obtener dichos electrodomésticos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Señor José Manuel G. is a gentleman of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur who is concerned about the improvement of the standard of living of his beloved family, composed of his spouse and his three children. He is known for being a very hard-working person with many aspirations for his family. At present he is determined to offer them better living conditions and for this he has begun to buy some necessary household goods for the home. At this time he would like to buy electrical appliances for the home and for that reason he requests a loan from Ceprodel to obtain said electric appliances and thus to improve the living conditions of his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical appliances for the home

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Y. is a rice farmer who has been experienced in this business for years. She has already planted her rice but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. So Y. requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her crop.

Y. is the widowed mother of six children, three of whom are married and others are single.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 59 years old, married with 5 children, and lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.  She was once into the sale of clothes and gift items and later changed her line of business to the sale of household items like cooking pots, plates, spoons, cups and more. This has been very profitable and she hopes to improve and expand her business in future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 140,000 to purchase more cooking pots, plates, spoons, and cups to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking pots, plates, spoons, and cups to sell

loans.name: Bose

texts.en:
Bose retails groceries and medicines to make a living. She hopes to own a supermarket and a maternity home in the future. She has been in this business for a long time and she uses her years of experience to attract and retain customers. She hopes to make her businesses sustainable. 

She is 45 years old and is married with 2 children. Her eldest child is 20 years old. Her children are excelling in school and this makes her happy. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction she has with her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more medicines and groceries to sell. She says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria L. C., tiene la edad de 54 años, es madre soltera y vive en la comarca de San Caralampio, ella tiene 5 hijos de los cuales tres viven de forma independiente y dos le apoyan en los trabajos de la finca, ella es agricultora desde hace 22 años, y fue gracias a la reforma agraria que comenzaron sus días de cosecha.

Dentro de los planes que tiene para mejorar su calidad de vida, esta la compra de un tanque de almacen de agua potale, debido a que el vital liquido no abastece en la zona y amenaza a la producción por la sequía, ella solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos que aporten un mejor mantenimientos agronomo a sus tierras y garantizen un crecimiento óptimo a la cosecha, esta inyección de capital a futuro le favorecera, para el establecimiento de 1 cuarto de manzana de piña, que le ayudara economicamente a la incursion en nuevos rubros y el mejoramiento continuo de sus niveles de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria L. C. is 54 years old, a single mother, and lives in the San Caralampio region. She has 5 grown children, two of whom help her with the tasks on the farm. She has been in agriculture since she was 22 years old, and it was thanks to agricultural reform that they were able to start harvesting crops. Among the plans she has to enhance her standard of living, is the purchase of a water tank. This vital liquid is not supplied in her zone, which threatens production during times of drought. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and agricultural supplies to support better agricultural maintenance for her lands and to guarantee an optimum opportunity for her crops to thrive. This injection of future capital will aid her in establishing a pineapple crop, which will help her financially to venture into new areas of crop production and to continue to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Omolola

texts.en:
Omolola sells cooking utensils to make a living in Ibadan. Her customers are usually women and young girls. She loves this business because of the opportunity it gives her to interact with her customers.

Omolola is 30 years old and is married with two children. Her husband sells foodstuffs to support the home.

Omolola is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. N. is 35 years old and lives in Phu Man village. She is married with three children who go to school. She is a farmer. Also, every day, she goes to other villages in the region to buy scrap iron to resell. She has done this for 6 years and makes about 80.000 VND per day. She joined SEDA in 2009 and repaid her loans punctually. She feels happy because she can save a little money. Now she would like to borrow 7.840.000 VND more (or 400 USD) to buy scrap iron.

loans.use: to buy scrap – iron.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin C., who lives in Krasang village in Takeo province, was born in 1954. She is a mother of three children – one is a seller in a local village, one is a farmer, and the other attends a local public school. She and her husband, Mr. Veng Sam (pictured right), are farmers who own a 1.3-hectare piece of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Since their farming business is going well they want to expand it, but they do not have enough land to cultivate. Therefore, Mrs. Vin C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more land to cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy more land to cultivate rice

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio G. Q. de 64 años de edad es un señor jubilado, el cual es muy trabajador y emprendedor, el cual desea mucho salir adelante y de esta forma contar con una vida estable. Vive en el municipio de Ilopango, lugar en el cual vive junto a su extensa familia la cual está conformada por su esposa y cinco hijos. José posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual está ubicada en su propia casa, en donde se dedica a atender la tienda y a crear inventarios para determinar cuáles son los productos que se venden más, con el fin de comprar mayor cantidad de estos, lo cual es una estrategia que le ha funcionado mucho. El es un señor muy amable y responsable quien vela por su familia, la cual depende de él en gran manera. José solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder aumentar su inventario, tomando en cuenta las mayores necesidades del negocio, de manera que pueda sacar la mayor ventaja posible de este, ya que él cuento con el deseo de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica. José es una persona quien se esfuerza mucho por lograr sus metas y así darle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio G. Q., 64, is retired gentleman but still very hard-working and enterprising; he very much wants to get ahead in life and have a stable life. He lives in Ilopango with his large family composed of his wife and five children. José has a general store in his home; he tends to it and checks his inventories to see which items sell the best so that he might buy more of these items, a strategy that has worked well for him. He is a very kind and responsible man who watches over his family who depend on him to a great extent. José is asking for funds to increase his inventory taking into account what the business needs the most so that he can make the best use possible of the loan; he wants to improve his economic stability. José is a person who works very hard to reach his goals thus providing for all his family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Romuald Léon

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Romuald Léon vit depuis vingt ans au quartier Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Romuald Léon est marié à ADANLE Louise et est père de deux enfants qui sont scolarisés. Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble à Agblangandan. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Romuald Léon et sa femme. Romuald Léon a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une douzaine d’année, Romuald Léon vend de façon ambulante, des matériels électriques (lampes, réglettes, piles, etc.). Romuald Léon s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Romuald Léon sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un prêt, afin de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. Romuald Léon ambitionne ouvrir prochainement une boutique pour y vendre ses produits.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin, A. Romuald Léon has been living for 20 years in the Agblangandan district in the township of Sèmè-Podji. Romuald Léon is married to ADANLE Louise and is the father of two children who are enrolled in school. The couple is also responsible for one other child. They all live together in Agblangandan. Family expenses are shared between Romuald Léon and his wife. Romuald Léon left off school at the secondary level. For some 12 years he has been in the ambulant sales business, walking around selling electrical goods (bulbs, switches, batteries, etc.). He buys his goods in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. This is the first time that Romuald Léon has requested a loan from ALIDé, with a view to raising the level of his little business and better serving his clientele. His ambition is to be able to open a little store to sell his goods in the near future.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer
