loans.use: purchase of electrical goods (wires, bulbs, switches, etc.)

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S., 43, is married and resides with her husband and five children. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. and her husband are farmers growing vegetables and earn an income of $3 USD/day to cover family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1100 USD to purchase a motorbike for their children to commute work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Aneta

texts.en: Aneta G.'s main source of income comes from providing motorsikad or habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services to community members. Her husband is the driver. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of P-7, Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. Aneta has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Aneta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Aneta is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: Afuwa

texts.en:
Afuwa is 56 years old. She is married with one child who is 24 years old.  Afuwa is commonly known in the business of selling new clothes, including children's clothing, men's shirts, etc.  Afuwa has been in this business for about 13 years and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm daily.

Afuwa is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. She hopes that it will allow her to expand her business through purchasing modern styles and that these styles will bring more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase different styles of clothing for sale

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 49 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años trabaja en la venta de artículos de uso medico como: jeringas, guantes quirúrgicos, fármacos, etc. La modalidad de sus ventas lo realiza en cada visita que da a sus los hospitales, farmacias, consultorios médicos, etc.; siendo estos vendidos al por mayor. Su jornada laborar es durante todo el día, de lunes a viernes y descansa los fines de semana. Como una mujer de negocios es madre a la vez, y no descuida la atención de sus hijos. Es por ello que distribuye su horario para no descuidar su hogar. Ana manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y una buena fuente de ingresos ya que cuenta con los contactos necesarios para sus ventas  por lo que se ha proyectado a futuro ser una gran abastecedora de productos médicos. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería  ya que tiene mas pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. For the last 12 years she has sold medical supplies like: syringes, surgical gloves, medicines, etc. The way she operates is this: she visits hospitals, pharmacies and doctor’s offices and at each visit she sells at wholesale. She works all day, every day, from Monday through Friday. She rests on weekends. As a businesswoman and a mother, she does not neglect her children so she sets up her schedule in such a way that she does not neglect her home. Ana states that her business is profitable and a good source of income because she has regular customers. She is projecting for the future becoming a major supplier of medical supplies. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of her fellow members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people that will fund the loan which will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise since she has more pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on medical supplies.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz I. is a resident of Tashkomur, a small city in the Jalalabad region in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Gulnaz is nineteen years old.  Ten years ago her mother opened a cafeteria and now Gulnaz works with her mom. She earns about $430 per month. That profit made it possible for her to invest money to start building a house.  

Gulnaz applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase sheep. After fattening, those sheep will be used for meat to prepare as food in their cafeteria. In the future she plans to expand their family business and maybe try to open a good restaurant. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Adalhia

texts.en: Adalhia T. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 51 years old and is widowed with two adult children. Adalhia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste and herbal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Adalhia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Adalhia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Esther Magdalena

texts.es:
Esther Magdalena de 30 años de edad es casada, trabaja desde hace 10 años como docente de secundaria en la Escuela Paulino Halsall  de la colonia Yolaina de Nueva Guinea, tiene  una bebita de 2 añitos de edad, su esposo tambien trabaja como docente en el mismo colegio y comparten los gastos familiares y los compromisos adquiridos ya que son una familia muy unida. 

Esther  està solicitando su 5to credito para  hecharle la ceramica a su pequeña vivienda, y asi brindarle mejores condiciones a su hija. 

Doña Esther expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC ya que por medio de los créditos obtenidos han logrado obtener su propia vivienda y han mejorado sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezcan bien unida, tener estabilidad laboral y estar bien con Dios.
texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Esther Magdelena is married and has worked for 10 years as a high school teacher in the Paulino Halsall school of the Yolaina area of Nueva Guinea. She has a darling, two-year-old baby. Her husband is also a teacher in the same school. She and her husband share family expenses and committments; they are a very close family. Esther is requesting her fifth loan to install ceramic tile in her small home and thereby give better living conditions to her daughter. Doña Esther is very grateful to AFODENIC. With previous loans, she was able to obtain her own home and improve the living conditions of her family. Her biggest dreams are that her family always remains close, has stable employment, and is on good terms with God.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install ceramic floor tile

loans.name: Felipa Rosario

texts.es:
Felipa de 60 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil llamada asi porque la mayoria de sus habitantes son comerciantes, tiene en su casa una pequeña tienda de víveres. 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y tener dinero para seguir ayudando a sus hijos ya que tiene 7 hijos, vendiendo arroz, azúcar y bebidas completo el dinero para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vende todo tipo de víveres. Trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días.  

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y vitrinas, en el futuro quiere tener su tienda mas surtida y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Felipa, 60 years old, lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburbs, described as such because the majority of the residents are businesspeople. She has a small general store in her home.

She started the store to be able to support her family and have money to continue helping her children, since she has 7 children. She is selling rice, sugar, and beverages. She earned money by putting a small store in the back part of her house. She sells all types of goods. She works from 7 am to 11 pm every day.

In order to continue with her business, she needs to buy rice, sugar, and display cases. In the future she wants her store to be better stocked so she will be secure in her old age.

loans.use: Purchase rice and drinks

loans.name: Kofi

texts.fr: Koffi est un homme de 31 ans, il est père de famille avec 2 personnes à charge. Il a appris la chaudronnerie et pour augmenter ses sources de revenu il a commencé la vente en détail d’aluminium et de ferraille. Il a une expérience de3 ans dans ce commerce. Il veut s’approvisionner , il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 200Kg d’aluminium et 150 KG de ferraille.
texts.en: Koffi is a 31-year old man. He is  a parent with two dependents. He is a learned coppersmith; in order to increase his revenues he started retailing aluminum and iron scrap. He has three years of experience in this business. He would like to replenish his stock and seeks a loan from WAGES to purchase 200 kg [440 lbs] of aluminum and 150 kg [330 lbs] of iron scrap.

loans.use: Purchasing iron scrap and aluminum

loans.name: Sagheeran's Group

texts.en:
Sagheeran is a very skillful lady. She operates her clothing embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. The attractive element of her work is she makes hand-made embroidery on clothes. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs that her customers admire. She has been doing this business for over seven years. In this period of time, she has obtained a good reputation among her customers for producing quality work and fulfilling the commitments.   

She lives in Gujranwala with her family in a two room brick house. Gujranwala is an industrial city of Pakistan. She is married to M. Y. who is a government employee and works on meager income. She is the mother of two daughters. Both have learned the art of embroidery from their mother and now help her in her business.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her embroidery business. She will utilize the loan money in purchasing embroidery material such as beads, colored thread and clothes in bulk quantity that will help her fulfilling customer demand and earn more income.  

She hopes that an increased profit will help her in collecting dowry for the marriage of her eldest daughter. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah. She hopes that this will be a profitable experience for her.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Sagheeran.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for embroidery business

loans.name: Jose Arnoldo

texts.es: José Arnoldo tiene 56 años, su actividad es una barbería y venta de productos de barbería. Hace más de 39 años que tiene este negocio, es un hombre responsable y que disfruta de su negocio y el poder hablar con sus clientes. La experiencia obtenida en este medio de vida todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar los arreglos correspondientes en su negocio que son necesarios. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como talcos, tijeras, cuchillas, navajas y maquinas para afeitar.
texts.en: José Arnoldo is 56 years old.  He has a barber shop and he sells hair care products.  He has had this business for more than 39 years.  He is a responsible man who enjoys his work and talking to his customers, who has gained experience through his work.  He gets up early every day to carry out the necessary arrangements for his business.  The reason for this loan is to purchase supplies such as powders, scissors, blades, razors and shavers.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is a resident of 63-WB, which is a small area located in the city of Vehari in Pakistan. She lives in a 2-room brick house with her husband and a son. 

Manzooran supports her family by selling goats. She has been in this business for the past five years and does this to supplement the income of her family. She purchases young goats at cheap rates from the animal markets, raises them, and sells to customers for good profit. While she’s raising them, she gives the goats good food and takes care of them so they become healthy. 

Her husband has a private job, but in his spare time he works in the field and grows seasonal crops.  Her son is illiterate. He couldn’t get an education due to poor financial conditions, so now he is a laborer.

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her goat selling business. With the loan, she will buy some goats to sell for profit. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Manzooran.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn C. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Juvilyn buys and sells fish locally. Juvilyn has been engaged in her business for more than 13 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juvilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Juvilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Juvilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 48 years old. Elsa is married. To make a living, Elsa raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elsa also has some pigs she grows in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Elsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia B. is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Eulogia is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eulogia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from dealing and selling clothing, cosmetics and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Eulogia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eulogia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulogia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eulogia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like cosmetics and blouses

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza F. is from the village of Brgy. Bangana, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Flordeliza from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Applying what she has learned as a community partner in CCT*, Gloria O., 55, capitalizes on food as a basic human need to establish a business that will work. Gloria has finished college and is running a household with seven children along with her husband Nivarjo. From the province of Bohol, their family has come to reside in Baseco, Manila.

Gloria runs a peanut butter sandwich business. She personally makes the sandwiches and sells them to her neighbors. She also sells chicken meat in her stall in the President Aquino public market. She has been in these businesses for nine years now. She is able to earn around 10,000 PHP monthly.

To help her grow her business, Gloria has requested a 9,000 PHP loan. She will use this money to enhance her businesses by buying more quantities of bread and peanut butter, as well different kinds of meat to give her customers more options to choose from. She is sure that the loan will make her business more profitable.

One challenge Gloria faces is the difficulty her customers have when it comes to paying their debts. Sometimes she doesn’t have many customers, resulting in low income. She is also overly concerned with her children whom she notices have become quite hardheaded. But she chooses rather to capitalize on these challenges and turn them into stepping-stones toward her dream of having a successfully growing business and a long, good life for everyone in her family. Gloria also desires to have her own house and lot. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase quantities of peanut butter and bread

loans.name: Neeang

texts.en:
Neeang N. is a 35-year-old rice farmer who lives in the province Kompong Tom. She is married to Kong Cheurn, age 44. The couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to five children who are still single  –  two of them are employed in different jobs to earn income. 

Neeang N. would like to request a loan to invest in her farming business by planting a soy bean crop.

loans.use: To plant soy bean crop

loans.name: Felipe     Jr.

texts.en:
Felipe Jr. P., from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province, is 25 years old, married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Felipe Jr. owns and operates a service-based business providing motor or habal-habal services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over four years, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Felipe Jr. joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase tools needed to provide service, he is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase more tools. This will be Felipe's fourth loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his service.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of service

loans.name: Monzon

texts.fr:
Monsieur Monzon B. est un célibataire de 23 ans, sans enfant, qui vit chez son grand frère à Bougouni, dans le quartier Médine.
Ayant vite abandonné l’école, très tôt il commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente de téléphones portables et accessoires, qu’il apprit auprès de son oncle. Avec une expérience de 5 ans, Monsieur Monzon B. maîtrise parfaitement son activité.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement consistant il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui il est à sa première expérience, pour acheter des téléphones portables et accessoires telles les façades.  Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Monzon B. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice, il envisage d’agrandir son entreprise et aider son grand frère assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Monzon B. is a 23-year-old man who is unmarried and living in his older brother's place in Bougouni, in the Médine district.  Having dropped out of school early, he soon started a revenue-generating business buying and selling mobile phones and accessories. He learned about this work from his uncle. With five years of experience, he has mastered his business. 

To obtain substantial working capital, Monzon decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first [loan] experience for buying mobile phones and accessories, such as cases or faceplates. He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). With this loan, he plans on making a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA. Using the profits, Monzon envisions expanding his enterprise and helping his older brother cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Everline Atieno

texts.en:
Everline Atieno O. is 25 years old and comes from Migori. She is a single mother of three children. 

Everline has a business of selling onions and has been in it for the past 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. She intends to buy more onions to add to her stock. 

She hopes to venture into a cereals business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more onions to add to her stock.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 50 years old and married with four children. Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marivic has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, soap, sugar, noodles etc.

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ascencion Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda es una madre soltera de 52 años de edad que vive con su menor hijo en el distrito Lagunas ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo. Herlinda es conocida en su comunidad por ser una madre luchadora, emprendedora y cariñosa con su hijo. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales, por ser una persona carismática y amable con los demás.

Desde hace 10 años Herlinda tiene en su casa un pequeño puesto donde vende abarrotes (azúcar, arroz, aceite,  agua) con las ganancias obtenidas en este negocio, Herlinda puede darle algunas comodidades a su pequeño hijo. La bodega de abarrotes le produce dinero a Herlinda debido a que cuenta con una clientela fija, que son las personas de su comunidad, Herlinda ha creado lazos amígales con muchos de sus consumidores, quienes la estiman y le son fieles a la hora de comprar.

Herlinda solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles que desea invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda, especialmente en la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite  que son los productos que más vende y que  más han subido de precio.

Herlinda espera seguir creciendo en su negocio para poder darle una mejor vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a 52-year-old single mother who lives with her young son in the District of Lagunas, which is located in Chiclayo Province. She is known in her community for being a determined, enterprising, and loving mother to her child. She has good personal references who indicate that she is a charismatic person and kind to others.

Ten years ago, Herlinda set up a small shop in her home where she sells groceries (sugar, rice, oil, and water). With the earnings she generated from this business, she was able to provide a few things to make her son comfortable. Herlinda’s store is able to generate income because she has a steady customer base consisting of people in her community. She has become good friends with many of her customers who express their respect and loyalty by coming to her establishment to shop.

Herlinda is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alterntativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. She wants to invest in the purchase of products for her store, especially rice, sugar, and oil since these are the products that she sells the most and have gone up in price.

Herlinda hopes to continue growing her business so that she can provide a better life for her son.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 23 y 19 años ya mayores de edad. Tiene un salón de belleza.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás estudio esta profesión para poder solventar los gastos del hogar. Labora diariamente o por pedidos de sus cliente realiza su trabajo como tinturar alisados diferente cortes. Con la ayuda préstamo desea comprar secadoras tratamientos capilar varios productos de bellezas. En un futuro desea seguir adelante para ayudara su familia y poder seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 45, lives in the urban area of Las Orquídeas (named after the many orchids that originally covered the area) in Guayaquil. She is single and has two grown children (ages 23 and 19). Rosa manages a beauty salon.

Rosa studied cosmetology several years ago so that she could provide for the household expenses. She works every day to fulfill her customers’ requests, which include hair tinting and different styles of haircuts. With the help of this loan, Rosa will be able to buy hair dryers, treatments, and various types of beauty products. In the future, she wants to move forward so that she can help her family and continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase dryers, treatments, and various types of beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 37 years old, is a married man with one child. He is a motor taxi driver and his wife is a vegetable seller. His mother and his uncle are also staying with him, so he has five family members and only his wife and he are supporting the family.

Their income is $3.5 per day. Every month, he has to spend $37 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees for his child and $10 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $500 to buy seed rice to do farming. He is very eager to do farming and expects that this loan will help his family to live better than before and enable him to send his child to school until he reaches university.

loans.use: To buy seed rice to plant.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 30-year-old single mother with two children aged eight and ten. She has been running a salon where she cuts and weaves hair. She has been doing this for five years and employs one employee. Rose intends to use her loan to purchase more weaves, chemicals, and hair products for her salon. 

Rose hopes to use the profits from her business to pay for her children’s education. She also hopes to expand her business by opening a salon branch in a busy town like Kakamega. Rose describes herself as creative, humble, and polite.

loans.use: to purchase more weaves, chemicals, and hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Ricmar

texts.en:
Ricmar is 35 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with two school-age children. Ricmar is a fisherman. He captures fish and shellfish for a living. This is the only means of subsistence for his family. He has been doing this for 10 years. He earns a total of PHP 8,284 each month in this work. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase fishing nets.

Ricmar has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Ricmar hopes to gain more income and purchase additional fishing boats.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Trust And Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet with the members of the “Trust and Pay” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 500,000 SLL for each person. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Dauda is the leader of this group. The 42-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has one child. Dauda has been a businessman for 26 years now. He sells decorative flowers.  With his share of this loan, he is going to buy dozens of decorative flowers to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of decorative flowers to sell

loans.name: Martiros

texts.en:
Martiros is from the village of Gorelovka, Ninotsminda District. He is 33 years old and lives in the village with his wife Anaida and three children: two daughters (8 and 5 years old) and a 2-year-old son. Martiros works as a herdsman on the village farm. Anaida works as a milkmaid on the same farm. Along with their job, the family also runs a small dairy farm. They have two milk cows and sell milk to the village farm. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Martiros requests a loan to expand the family's agro-business. In particular, he will buy six piglets and food for them. After the piglets are grown, in four or five months, they will be sold at a higher price. The additional profits earned by the family will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase six piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco de 37 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rómulo de 39 años y sus 02 querido hijos Jover de 17 y Pamela de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.Con el único deseo de sacar adelante a su familia, Dionisia se embarca semanalmente a distintos distritos de la zona del Valle Río Apurimac, llevando fardos de ropa para vender en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en las zonas aledañas del los distritos en mención, las prendas que vende las compra de la ciudad de Lima, motivo por el cual son rápidamente compradas, ya que están confeccionadas de telas nacionales e importadas.Ella es una persona muy atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes cordialmente dispuesta a ayudarles en sus compras para que así puedan estar satisfechos, el trabajo lo cumple en compañía de su pareja donde llevan trabajando 09 años. Con el dinero del crédito comprará ganchos y andamios para exhibir mejor sus prendas.Con el tiempo, desea abrir una tienda en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.Este será su tercer crédito y ya se siente contenta al saber que en esta oportunidad también contará con el apoyo financiero para llevar consigo  su propósito, además se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente como solía hacer en los anteriores créditos.Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima, con lo cual implementara mejor su stock de ventas.
texts.en: Dionisia, a native of the city of San Francisco, is 37 years old, and is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house along with her 39 year old husband, Rómulo, and their two beloved children: 17 year old Jover and 10 year old Pamela, who are the reason for all her efforts. With the sole goal of improving things for her family, Dionisia sets off each week to different districts in the Valle Río Apurimac area, carry bundles of clothes to sell in the different markets that are held in the aforementioned areas. She buys the clothes that she sells in the city of Lima because she can make quick purchases there and because she can buy domestic and imported brands. She is a very attentive person who always receives her clients cordially and wants to help them with their purchases so that they will be satisfied. She does this work with her partner, and they've been working together for 9 years. She will use the money from the loan to buy hooks and rails to better display her clothes. In time, she would like to open a shop in the city of San Francisco where she could better attend to her clients. This will be her third loan and she is happy to know that she will once again have the financial support to pursue her goals. She also promises to make her repayments on time as she has done with her earlier loans. She will use the $1,100 to buy more clothes in the city of Lima to improve her stock.

loans.use: to improve her sales stock.

loans.name: Marys Aminta

texts.es: La señora Marys Aminta comprara más de su mercancía que es ropa para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella es madre soltera vive con su hijo de 16 año. Afirma la señora, que gracias a la atención que ella brinda a sus clientes, ahora ellos le encargan más cosas, lo que hace que ella gane más Ella dio inicio a este negocio porque no tena un medio de supervivencia y al mismo tiempo no encontraba trabajo. Esta solicitando un financiamiento que será invertido en la compra de ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, trajes, camisolas y faldas. Por lo que sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Marys Aminta will buy more of her merchandise - clothing - to meet her customers' demands. She is a single mother living with her 16 year old son. She tells us that thanks to the service that she gives her customers, they now order more things from her which helps her to earn more money. She started this business because she didn't have a way to survive and couldn't find work. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, camisoles and skirts. She dreams of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy underwear, pants, blouses, dresses, suits, camisoles and skirts.

loans.name: Darkin Joel

texts.es:
Darkin Joel es un joven de 27 años de edad, soltero, reside en barrio el Triangulo en el municipio de San Francisco de la Paz y se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.

Darkin inició a vender ropa de segunda mano en el año 2005 y lo hacia de forma ambulante, recorria las calles de su comunidad, aldeas y cacerios mas cercanos. Pero gracias al bueno manejo de los ingresos de su negocio pudo obtener financiamientos y construir una pequeña pieza en su casa de habitacion, y ahora tiene su propio local. Su horario de atencion es de lunes a sabado de 8:00 am a 5:00 pm. La ventaja de su negocio es que obtiene muy buena ganancia pero tambien tiene mucha competencia y ultimamente las ventas han bajado.

El prestamo que solicita Darkin lo necesita para comprar varios fardos de ropa usada y asi podra surtir de su negocio de varios estilos especialmente para la temporada de lluvia. 

Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en una tienda y seguir apoyando a su madre con su sostenimiento, ya que ella esta en una edad avanzada y aun trabaja hornando pan y lo vende ambulantemente.

Darkin tiene cinco ciclos en FAMA y con los prestamos obtenidos a podido mantenerse economicamente activo. Y su comportamiento de pago ha sido puntual.
texts.en:
Darkin Joel is a young man who is 27 years of age, single, and resides in the neighborhood of Triangulo in the town of San Francisco de La Paz. He sells secondhand clothing.

Darkin started his used clothing business in 2005 as a traveling merchant, walking through the streets of his community and in the neighboring towns and villages. As a result of successful management of his business income, he was able to obtain loans and build a small space in his home that he now uses for selling clothes. His business is open Monday through Saturday from 8am to 5pm. The main advantage of his business is that it generates a good income, but he also has plenty of competition and lately his sales have declined.

The loan Darkin is requesting will be used to buy several bundles of used clothing so that he can restock his business with various styles of clothes, especially for the rainy season. His goal is to grow his business and convert it into a formal store so that he can continue supporting his mother financially. She is an elderly woman who makes bread and sells it as a street vendor.

Darkin has participated in five loan cycles with FAMA and the loans he has obtained have allowed him to remain financially active. He has submitted his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

location.town: San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho

loans.name: Ashley Jane

texts.en:
Ashley Jane is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
 
Ashley Jane has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ashley Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ashley Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old and is engaged in a piggery business as one of his sources of income. He has been doing this for 10 years and has been earning PHP 5,000 every disposing season. This is not enough to support them, so as a result, he also operates a farming business to raise his two children. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs and to use in his farming business. He hopes this will lead to growth in his businesses. He devotes himself to working hard in order to support the needs of his family as well as to cover his children's educational obligation. He hopes to provide for his children so that they can finish their education and become degree holders which would help to lift their standard of living. He will not be able to borrow anymore for that reason.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his hogs and to use in his farming business

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie, aged 30, is married to a motorcyclist. Marie has three children aged between 2 and 9 years. All three children attend school. Marie sells vegetables and spices. She has been doing this business for seven years. With the profits, she wants to buy a plot of land which will be used as her home. She dreams to sell cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and spices

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old, and is married to Jacinta. He makes shoes and has been in the business for the past ten years. He realizes an income of KES 7,000 from the business.

This is his fourth loan with KADET. He repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to purchase shoes and shoe soles.

He will use the anticipated profits to cater to his family's needs. His dream is to expand his business in order to have a stable income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and shoe soles.

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Давлатали занимается купле- продажей хозяйственных товаров. Более 15 лет он постепенно за годами расширяет свой бизнес и успешен в своем деле. Он начал данный бизнес с малого товарооборота, а теперь имеет широкий ассортимент товаров. Он продает посуду, такие как чайник, пиала, ведро, кастрюли, плитки и т.д. Он продает свой товар по низкой цене, чем у конкурентов. Из-за этого он имеет много клиентов и ему необходимо пополнить место проданного товара. Давлатали хотел бы получить займ для покупки товара для пополнения товарооборота и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Davlatali buys and sells household goods. He has been gradually expanding his business for more than fifteen years and is successful in it. He started his business with a small commodity turnover and now has a wide range of goods. He sells kitchen appliances such as teapots, teacups, buckets, pots, tiles and more. He sells his merchandise at lower prices than his competitors. He has many customers because of this and he needs to restock what he has already sold. Davlatali wants to get a loan to buy merchandise to increase commodity turnaround and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 50 year old woman with 2 children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Thu and her husband have been earning an income by selling rice and variety of basic goods from their general store, a business they started ten years ago.

Thu would like to take a loan to expand her current business by buying a greater variety and quantity of rice and basic goods to stock her general store. She is hoping that this will enable her to attract additional customers. Thu hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, which would help improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of rice and basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He is single and owns a barber shop which has been in operation for three years. He also owns a retail shop, mobile phone charging and soft drinks shop. He offers many services to the large population which works in shifts at the port.

David is applying for a loan of Ksh 60,000 to purchase hair cutting machines, chairs and mirrors.His future aspirations include owning a wholesale shop. 

The only challenge he faces is the frequent power cuts which interrupt his hair cutting business. The additional income from this business will enable him to employ more people, and also buy solar for domestic use and barber shop.

loans.use: to purchase hair cutting machines, chairs and mirrors.

loans.name: Liliosa

texts.en:
Liliosa is 59 years old and is a widow with 8 children.

Liliosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her sari-sari store.

Liliosa has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending.

Liliosa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Ketty Carmen

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ketty, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 15, 10 y 6 años  de edad, el mayor de ellos estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es un muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de utensilios de cocina como sartenes, platos, ollas, cucharas, entre otras muchas cosas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también se desplaza en su carro a otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas, aprovecha donde hay ferias que es cuando más vende, muchas veces ella también le acompaña a su esposo a realizar las ventas. Ellos llevan en este negocio por más de 10 años y les va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio para comprar ollas, platos, cucharas, etc. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son  rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The members of the Unión y Solidaridad communal bank meet every two weeks in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is the capital of Manabí, which for many years has been known as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

This is where we meet Ketty, age 35.  She is married and has three children, ages 15, 10, and 6.  The oldest child goes to high school, and the youngest children go to elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She is a very good housewife who is getting the loan to help her husband in his business.  He sells all types of kitchen utensils like frying pans, dishes, pots, spoons and many other items.  He sells door to door.  He also travels in his car to other cities to make his sales.  He takes advantage of the fairs, which is when he sells the most.  Many times she accompanies her husband to make the sales.  They have been in this business for over ten years, and it has gone very well for them.

She will use this loan to stock the business with more pots, plates, and spoons, etc.  She has been in her communal bank for six cycles.  She likes it because the loans are quick and without so many requirements.

Her dream is to have a place in the center of the city.

loans.use: to buy  pots, plates, and spoons, etc.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La señora Andrea se dedica a la venta de medicamentos naturales, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace tres años y con la tienda de su propiedad desde hace un año cuenta con buena clientela ya que las personas ahora quieren utilizar medicamentos que no tengan químicos, vive en domicilio de sus padres donde vive con  su esposo y su hija de cuatro años solicita el crédito para la  compra de  mercadería medicamentos naturales y de esta forma surtir su tienda e incrementar su capital de trabajo, le va muy bien con la venta de estos productos, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación, con ganas de mejorar su calidad de vida de ella y de toda su familia.
texts.en: Andrea has sold natural medicines for three years. She has had her own store for a year with a good customer base since people want to take medicine that does not contain chemicals. She lives in her parents’ home with her husband and her four-year-old daughter. She is requesting a loan to purchase her natural medicine merchandise. She can stock her store and increase her working capital. She is doing very well with the sales of these products. She is a young person with a great desire to succeed and improve the quality of her life and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Madam Jeannette A. was born in 1968 at Tsévié. Daughter of a poor family, she has encountered all kind of difficulty of this world. For lack of means, she neither go to school nor followed a vocational training. Became adult she is married with a man who has decided to well finance her restauration activities (rice, beans, spaghetti), things rare in the surrounding. Unfortunately at the birth of their 3rd child, the husband has lost his job and was found jobless. So, the major part of the household expenditures is set on Jeannette hands, as the meagre income issued from the manoeuvre is only about hardly 45%. Beyond their three children, she has at her dependence her mother and their last child. Despite the difficulties, she is succeeding to well manage her activities. She has the sense of respect of the other property and has succeeded with rigour the two first respective credits of $100 and $300 got are even repaid promptly. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be supported financially to strengthen her activity. Dynamic and honest, she benefits from the respect of her surrounding. This credit of $650 requesting will serve to buy foods at the need of her restauration to strengthen her activity and make it profitable in order to provide for the family needs.

Madame A. Jeannette est née en 1968 à Tsévié. Fille d’une famille pauvre, elle a rencontré toutes les difficultés du monde dans sa vie. Faute de moyens, elle n’a ni fréquenté, ni suivi une formation professionnelle. Devenue adulte, elle s’est mariée avec un homme qui a bien voulu financer son activité de restauration (riz, haricot, spaghetti), chose rare dans le milieu. Malheureusement à la naissance de leur 3ème enfant, le mari a perdu son emploi et s’est trouvé chômeur. Alors, la grande partie des charges du foyer repose sur Jeannette, car le maigre revenu issu du manœuvrage n’y est que 45% à peine. En plus de leurs trois enfants, elle a à charge sa mère et de leur benjamine. Malgré les difficultés, elle arrive à bien gérer ses activités. Elle a le sens du respect du bien d’autrui et a su gérer avec rigueur les deux premiers crédits respectifs de $100 et $300 obtenus et même remboursés promptement. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement pour renforcer son activité. Dynamique et honnête, elle bénéficie du respect de son entourage. Ce crédit de $650 sollicité servira à acheter des aliments au besoin de sa restauration pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille.

loans.use: to buy foods for restauration

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Miss Nu is 35 and her husband is 42 years old. They have 3 children who are going to school in grade 9, 7 and 3. They have about 7000 square meters of rice land and they have cashew trees as well. The land is very poor and they don’t have enough money to buy fertilizer for cashew trees so productivity is low. Mr Trieu, her husband suffers spinal column disease so he can’t do hard work like hoe the land, prune away branches or spray chemicals. They have to rent a laborer to work on their land. Miss Nu sells vegetable at the small local. She has repaid first loan. Their income increased by $1.25/person/month. Average income is $10 person/month. Now she asks to borrow $50 for selling business

loans.use: sells vegetable

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esperanza is an enterprising and active woman. She is married and has two children, one six and the other 7. Her husband is a salesman. To help meet household expenses, eight years ago Esperanza started up a business selling leather items such as wallets and belts. Her business grew little by little, and today she sells in markets where the demand for her goods grows daily.

Now she has an opportunity to buy stock from her suppliers at a reduced price, but only if she places a large order. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of $475, which she plans to repay in six months. Esperanza sincerely appreciates this opportunity to improve and enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora y activa, ella es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y para poder contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, desde hace ocho años Esperanza inició su propio negocio en el que vende artículos de piel, como billeteras y cintos, poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio ahora ya se instala en los mercados donde la demanda de productos y sus ventas se incrementan día con día.

Ahora se le ha presentado la oportunidad de recibir un mejor precio por parte de sus proveedores pero tiene que hacer un pedido grande y para poder cubrir el costo está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Esperanza agradece sinceramente la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To stock leather goods

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta P. is a talented young woman of sixty years of age.  She uses her sewing talent for her business, in order to earn money for her family's living.  She is married with six children and they are all attending school.  Her first loan was spent on buying the materials she needed to start her sewing business.  Due to the growth of her customers, she will spend her second loan on buying a new electric sewing machine. Ruta, who is now the best tailor with in her area, hardly rests.  She struggles so hard to meet her customers' needs and at the same time earn more money for her family.  Her husband and her six children also support her and that really encourages her in what she’s doing.  Ruta really appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D. office for lending her the money to make everything in her business possible.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Teresa Eudocia

texts.es:
Teresa is 43 years old and married. She and her husband are inseparable. They work closely together creating ceramic handicrafts. With their patience and talent, they produce very fine and beautiful pieces which they sell wholesale in the city of Lima. This work gives them a lot of satisfaction, because they have been able to achieve rapid results which means they can provide a better quality of life for their 4 young children. Today, Teresa and her husband want to continue growing their ceramic business so they can begin to export outside their country. To reach their goals, they are requesting a loan to buy the materials they need to make their handicrafts. They both have committed to repay the loan within a 6 month period. With your support, we can help give them the opportunity to continue growing their business and improving the quality of life for themselves and their children.

Doña Teresa de 43 años de edad y su inseparable esposo están dedicados a elaborar trabajos de cerámica basados en arcilla, gracias a la paciencia que tienen y al talento de sus manos realizan finos y hermosos trabajos, que luego son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de lima, esta labor los llena de satisfacción porque están logrando obtener rápidamente resultados favorables, con los que pueden ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro hijos menores.Hoy en día Teresa y su esposo están deseosos de seguir creciendo con su trabajo de cerámica, hasta llegar a exportar al mundo entero y para lograr sus objetivos anhelan obtener un préstamo, con los que podrán comprar materia prima para seguir realizando sus trabajos, ambos se comprometen a rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses. En nuestras manos está poder darles la oportunidad de seguir creciendo con su oficio de toda la vida.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED TO CREATE THEIR CERAMIC HANDICRAFTS, INCREASE PRODUCTION  AND GROW THEIR BUSINESS.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying tools and materials for his workshop (Comprar herramientas y materiales para su taller)

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem Y. is a widow and has three children. To earn her living, and to support her children's tuition fees, she and one of her daughters sell a variety of fruits at Phsar Pouk market, earning collectively about $4 each day.

Yem has requested a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet her client demand; she will also use part of the loan to install in her house a protection from flooding, which she experienced a couple years ago.

loans.use: To expense her inventory by purchasing more fruits to meet her cleint demand.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon C., 49, is married with ten children and works as a housewife cooking food for her large-member family. Her husband, Mr. Koy Keo, 51, works as a trailer driver (a motorcycle attached with a two-wheel trailer to transport goods and passengers) and earns between $7.00-9.00 a day. Two of her children are employed by a garment factory making collectively around $200 per month; three other children work at a construction site. The remaining five children are married and live outside the family home.

This couple will use the loan to purchase another trailer for one of their sons to operate a business and increase the family income. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Suon C. is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase another trailer for one of their sons to operate a business in order to keep their income up.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Two years ago Lilian received an idea from family members to start selling children’s clothes from the school where she works as a teacher. She decided to give it a shot, and since then has been very successful, thanks to help from her parents and family members.

Due to the large amount of orders she recieves, Lilian is applying for a loan so as to invest in greater quantities and varieties of garments. With your important contribution, this honest woman will continue working with her beloved parents.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Lilian, se desempeña como maestra en un centro educativo de su localidad, hace un par de años sus familiares que residen en la capital le dieron la idea de ofertar prendas de vestir para niños desde su centro de estudios con el propósito de mejorar sus situación económica, decidió incursionar en este campo y ha ido cosechando satisfacciones gracias a la ayuda de sus padres y familiares, debido a la inmensa solicitud de prendas, solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de prendas.Con tu importante ayuda esta noble mujer seguirá contribuyendo con sus ancianos y amorosos padres.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of garments for her clothes sales

loans.name: Shafiq Allah

texts.en: Shafiq Allah lives in District 5 of Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and has a small grocery store, a business he has operated for more than five years. With an excellent location in Kabul, his store is doing well, so he now is requesting a loan to expand his inventory. The resulting increased income will allow him to better support his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is a native of the department of Ica; for family reasons, she moved to the little town of Santa Lucia in Puno 27 years ago, and since she set up her household, she has devoted herself to innumerable activities to earn her own income. One of these was the sale of electric appliances, but unfortunately, she suffered a break-in. Since then she has worked at selling fruit juices, while her hard-working husband, Valerio, works as a laborer for the mining operation San Rafael. A couple months ago, Angélica had an operation, which is why she had to stop working at her business. But now she finds herself eager to retake the reins of her business, and with her earnings, build her own little home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Angélica, es natural del departamento de Ica, por situaciones familiares hace 27 años radica en el pueblito de Santa Lucia – Puno y desde que formó su hogar se dedicó a innumerables actividades para generar sus propios ingresos económicos, una de ellas fue la venta de artefactos eléctricos, desafortunadamente sufrió un robo, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de jugo de frutas, mientras que su laborioso esposo, Valerio, trabaja como obrero en la empresa minera San Rafael.Hace un par de meses doña Angélica fue operada, es por ello que dejó de dedicarse a su negocio, pero en estos momentos se encuentra deseosa de retomar las riendas de su actividad y así con las ganancias concretar su anhelo de construir su propia casita.

loans.use: Injection of cash to get her juice stand started up again

loans.name: Kurbonbibi

texts.en: Kurbonbibi N. was born in 1962 in Asht, Tajikistan.  She is engaged in the family business of raising livestock, and therefore makes her living selling meat, milk-sour products, yarn, and felt.  With over ten years of experience, she has successfully grown her business while working alongside her fellow villagers.  Kurbonbibi is now applying for a loan of $825 for seven months in order to purchase computerized equipment which will help her make milk-sour products.

loans.use: To purchase computerized equipment for making milk-sour products.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch P. and her husband, Mr. Choem Khat, are subsistence farmers in Prey Changva Village in Kampong Speu Province. They have five children, three of whom are construction workers while the remaining two are attending school. Although the family members have different business activities, they still cannot improve their living conditions. Mrs. Touch P. and her husband want to start an ice-cream selling business which is likely to do well since Cambodia is hot. Thus, Mrs. Touch P. has decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike with a freezer for her husband to sell ice-cream door-to-door. Last year, one of Mrs. Touch P.’s children got dengue fever and  she spent $175 on medical bills to cure. The additional expense hurt the family budget. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a freezer for her husband to sell ice-cream door-to-door.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
Jairo M. is a professor dedicated to his work. He has worked as a teacher in the Rafaela Herrera School for 8 years, where he is known as a hard-worker and a very responsible man. In the time that he has worked he has developed a lot of dedication toward the rural children of the Municipality of New Guinea.

Jairo is single and still lives with his parents. He assumes the household expenses. He does not have children. He has gone about improving the house of his parents with a lot of effort, because he desires a worthy dwelling with all the conditions that a citizen aspires to. The loan will be used for the purchase of wood and zinc for the construction of the kitchen. Through loans he has been able to improve the house of his parents and waits to be able to have stability in his employment so that he can leave his parents a complete house and also be able to think about his future and the formation of a family

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Jairo M. es un profesor dedicado a su labor, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera, desde hace 8 años, identificado en su trabajo como trabajador y un hombre muy responsable, el tiempo que tiene de trabajar ha desarrollado su trabajo con mucho dedicación hacia los niños campesinos del Municipio de Nueva Guinea.

Jairo es soltero y aún vive con sus padres, él asume los gastos del hogar, no tiene hijos. Ha dio mejorando la casa de sus padres con mucho esfuerzo, porque desea una vivienda digna con todas las condiciones que un ciudadano aspira. El préstamo será usado para la compra de madera y zinc para la construcción de la cocina. A través de préstamos él ha podido mejorar las casas de sus padres y espera poder tener estabilidad laborar para dejarles a sus padres una casa completa, y también poder pensar en su futuro y en la formación de una familia

loans.use: To buy wood and zinc for the construction of the kitchen in his parent's house.

loans.name: Valeh

texts.en: Valeh is married, has two children, and has settled in the town of Khirdalan. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan. He started this business 15 years ago. This man was born in 1966. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy food to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Fiva

texts.en:
Fiva L., 50, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells to the public and villagers three days per week.

She has had six previous loans with SPBD. With this loan, Fiva would purchase more materials and equipment for her business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 360 Tala (~$150 USD). SPBD loans are Fiva's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment needed for making handicrafts

loans.name: Aweza

texts.en:
Aweza owns a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $110 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.

Aweza has three children, aged 2, 4, and 8.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Husniya

texts.en:
B. Husniya is 30 years old, and is married with two children. To supplement her husband, who is an electrician, Husniya sells different kinds of sweets for the children in her community in front of her house. 

In a day, she can earn $10 with a net profit of $3, or $60 in a month. Husniya is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni         ($ 600 USD), and with this loan, she hopes to buy more food. In turn, she can more or less double her income. 

Husniya very much wants to earn more money in order to invest in her children's education and to give them a better life than she grew up with. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 11 months. She deeply appreciates your assistance and expresses her gratitude.

loans.use: To purchase the foodstuff in order to increase the range of her business' goods

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Vũ Thị Khuân năm nay 43 tuổi, chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại Huyện Kim động tỉnh Hưng Yên. Tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000, đến nay qua 8 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương chị Khuân luôn hoàn trả vốn đúng hạn và thực hiện tốt các quy định của Quỹ. Hiện tại với mức thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng từ chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và lương công nhân của chồng  cuộc sống gia đình chị Khuân đang ngày càng được cải thiện hơn.
Với số vốn vay 17.000.000đ xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị Khuân dự định sữ sử dụng để đầu tư mua thêm giống cây về trồng
texts.en:
Mrs. Vũ Thị Khuân, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Kim Động district, Hưng Yên province. She has participated in the TYM Fund since the year 2000. During her eight years of membership, she has always repaid her loans on time and has followed the rules of the Fund diligently. Currently, her family has an income of 2,500,000 VND (147 USD) per month from raising animals, growing crops, and wages her husband earns as a laborer. With this level of income, the life of Khuân’s family is gradually improving. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 17,000,000 VND (1000 USD), which she plans to use to buy more seedlings.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seedlings

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mr. O., 41, is a blacksmith in his village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. He started the business in 1991 and now can earn around US$ 5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Yum, is a housewife and cooks food for the family. His business is going well because he is skilled and customers believe  in the quality of what he has made. He has one child whom he loves so much. To expand his business, O. would like to request a loan to purchase more raw materials for his blacksmith business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for his blacksmith business

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon P. is a villager in Andoung Pour village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four more piglets and pig food for breeding.

Her husband, Mr. Hen Sopheap, is a construction worker. Mrs. Samon P. is 34 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker while another is employed in a garment factory. Two of the children are attending the local school, and the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: Mary D., 42 ans est mariée avec 03 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 1 an et demi. Son activité est la vente de produits divers dans une boutique. Elle veut acheter de l’huile, du lait, du riz, du poivre, des produits de lessive et autres pour renforcer son commerce. Ses revenus  vont lui permettent d’améliorer ses conditions de vie, de santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Mary D., age 42, is married and has three children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for a year and a half. Her work involves selling various goods in her shop. She wants to buy some oil, milk, rice, pepper, cleaning products, and more in order to boost her commerce. This income will enable her to improve her children's living conditions and health and their schooling. The loan she's requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her shop with various goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana B. R. vive en la localidad de Santa rita cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con su esposo y sus cinco hijos, tiene la actividad de venta de comida, hace 6 años que viene trabajando con dicha actividad, su esposo el Sr. Alberto Toledo trabaja de sereno en la chancadora de Santa Rita, además de esto el le ayuda también en el negocio de la venta de comida.
El crédito que esta solicitando, es exclusivamente para aumentar su capital de negocio quiere para la compra de  vajillas, sillas y mesas, además también quiere invertir en la compra de un frisser.
Su objetivo es agrandar mas su negocio, quiere ampliar y ya no solamente atender a pensionados si no también al publico en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana B. R. lives in Santa Rita and owns a home whom she shares with her husband and five children. She has been working in food sales for the past six years. Her husband, Mr. Alberto Toledo, works as a watchman in Santa Rita's grinder and also helps her with her food sale business. The loan she requests is exclusively reserved for her business and will go toward the purchase of dinnerware, chairs and tables, and a freezer. Her objective is to grow her business and expand to serve the general public and not just retirees.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital and purchase a freezer

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw A. is 32 years old. He is single and lives independently. Yaw says he is not married yet because he is not fully prepared to. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. 
Yaw is a trader. He trades in all kinds of footwear for women. He sells full shoes, half shoes, slippers, etc. He procures the goods from the wholesalers in the regional capital, Cape Coast. He sells his products in a shop in the market square. He says he also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Yaw has been in business for 13 years and wants a loan to procure footwear in bulk to increase his profit margin.

loans.use: To procure footwear in bulk

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a farmer living in the rural community of Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Due to financial problems, he was not able to pursue his college education. He is married and they have three children who are in the tertiary and secondary level. His dream is to give and support the education of his children. He knows that he can do this through his hard work.

Reynaldo cultivates his farm and plants rice and vegetables twice a year. He is now applying for a loan of PHP 15,000 to finance needed farm inputs such fertilizer, seed and so on. Some of the loan will be used for the compensation of farm laborers during the tilling and cultivation process. Reynaldo hopes that his request loan be granted and also for future improvement of his business.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such fertilizer, seed and so on

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: la Sra. Guillermina M. tiene 45 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser ropa americana usada y carteras usadas, ella tambien vende golosinas, esta comida la vende a partir de las 4 de la tarde todos los dias y en la mañana se dedica a vender la ropa, este negocio es muy bueno ya que a mucha gente le gusta comprar este tipo de ropa ya que es de buena calidad y tiene un precio muy accesible, ella vive en la colonia pedregal de la ciudad capital, en la colonia la conocen como una persona amable y sociable, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas, dos estan en la escuela y la mayor esta en la universidad, con este negocio ella le ayuda a su esposo a salir adelante con los gastos del hogar. ella necesita el credito para poder comprar mas fardos de ropa y asi tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina M. is 45 years old. She sells merchandise such as second-hand American clothing and handbags. She also sells sweets every day from 4 o’clock in the afternoon; in the mornings she sells clothes. This business is very good because many people like to buy this type of clothing because it is of high quality and is at an affordable price. She lives in the Pedregal district of the capital city, where she is known as a kind and sociable person.
