She lives with her husband and has three children, two of whom are at school and the eldest is at university. With this business she helps her husband to cover the household expenses. She needs the loan to be able to buy more bundles of clothes and thereby earn a better income.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing and handbags

loans.name: Jawed

texts.en: Jawed is the son of S. D.. He is 22 years old, single, and lives in district of 12 Kabul Afghanistan. There are four other members in his household and all of them benefit from his income. He owns a general store where he sells different kinds of goods. He would like to expand his business by buying more products to sell. Hence he is requesting a loan of 50,000 Afghanis. He is very happy about this small loan process in Afghanistan that wants to help poor people.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita lives in Barangay Paunga Aliaga in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alberto and gifted with five children who are studying in high school and at the elementary level. They want to send them to college so they can find a good job someday.

Anita manages a small eatery business in the village. Her husband helps to operate the business daily by cooking and assisting customers. Farming is their major source of income. She is asking the borrow PHP 5,000 to make her business grow.

She endures the hardships for their children.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the Bekaa. She has owned a grocery store for twenty-four years and also sells sweets (candies), fruit, vegetables and home products. She requested a loan of 2,500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her second loan and she has always repaid on time.

Mariam’s previous loan helped her expand her business and diversify her merchandise. She is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and you can find all you want in her store. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Mariam decided on her business because of her financial need. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by selling chickens.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lira's Group

texts.en:
The group’s leader Lira. She sells milk products and eggs. These days she barely sees her husband as he works in the field. He grows wheat, barley and clover. They have three children. Their eldest son is serving in the army. The other son and daughter are at home. After the collapse of Soviet Union, they obtained a piece of land and started farming. They put in all their energy and devotion to obtain a good harvest and were able to buy a house and car.

Now their monthly income is $290. They need a loan to buy gas to cultivate their land and to purchase chickens. They are hoping for a good harvest this year and when it happens they plan to buy a new lorry and some livestock: a horse, cows and sheep. They are making plans to help their son find a job, after he completes his serve in the army.

Lira’s partners are excellent examples of hardworking people, who are not afraid to try new things. Damira, Gulnara and Istatai. Damira is forty eight. She sells milk and milk products. Her husband and son raise livestock and are farmers. Damira wants to get a loan to purchase hens, ducks, turkeys, to sell their eggs, chickens and ducklets.

Gulnara, a mother of three children is 46. She milks cows, sells milk and grows vegetables in her garden. Her husband looks after cows and works in the field. Their earnings constitute around $150 a month. Gulnara has decided to get a loan to purchase sheep for feeding, getting meat and wool for sale.

Istatai is a widower and mother of four children. She earns $120 by selling milk and hay. During twelve years of hard work she has been able to provide all her children with a proper high school education and now wants to start farming. However since it involves expenses she needs to obtain a loan. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her cafe.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 31 años, tiene 2 hijos menores que estudian y son su razón D. ser, vive junto a su esposo, quien es policía, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 5 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa para damas y caballeros, este negocio lo desarrolla desD. su casa. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado conseguir muchos clientes quienes son lo que acuden a ella para adquirir sus prendas D. vestir, pero cuando le quedan prendas por vender sale a ofrecerlas por los distintos lugares D. su zona. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es vender, pues ahí tiene un contacto directo con sus clientes y ella se preocupa mucho por darles un buen trato para que siempre retornen a comprar sus artículos y mejor aún, la recomiendan con otras personas. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son buenos amigos, con quienes comparte sus experiencias y momentos agradables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más ropa y también zapatos, pues sus clientes se lo están pidiendo.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is thirty-nine years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the city. Her first born has completed senior high school while the last child is in junior high school.

Patience sells products like beans, soya beans, groundnuts (peanuts), rice, millet, maize, etc. and has been in business for twelve years. She buys her cereals and other goods from villages and supplies to the market women in her communities. Patience says that food vendors also come to her to buy in large quantities.

Patience is requesting a loan to top up her working capital to enable her to buy stock in bulk on each trip to meet the demands of her customers. Being able to buy in bulk is very advantageous. It means fewer trips to fill the demand, and it is a hedge against the rapidly rising prices. She therefore wants the loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Leti

texts.en:
Leti P. is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Alafua.  She is married and has 5 school-aged children.  To make a living, Leti owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  Leti has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 550 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leti joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Leti has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  Leti is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Leti plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita S. is from the village of Lumbayao in Valencia City. She is 61 years old. Susanita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Susanita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Susanita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Susanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to additional capital for the business. Susanita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Susanita's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anelita

texts.en:
Anelita M. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 27 years old. Anelita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Anelita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products, as well as firewood in the local community. Anelita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Anelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jebraeel

texts.en:
Jebraeel is married with three children and his wife owns a small restaurant that helps the family.

Jebraeel sells souvenirs in the street to tourists and has a license from the ministry of tourism to do this. He has been practicing this work for ten years. Bethlehem is a big attraction for Christians and where the nativity church is located he sells wood carving products, T-shirts, small gifts, etc.

Jebraeel needs the loan to buy new products as Christmas and the New Year are next month and it is the peak for selling such products.

Jebraeel appears in the photo at the FATEN office with some of his products.

loans.use: To buy goods for the Christmas and New Year season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying provisions

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es: María Angélica G. D. A. D. 59 años D. edad, resiD. en Cojutepeque en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella es una persona la cual es muy dedicada y que se esfuerza día con día por contar con todo lo necesario para vivir. María tiene cinco años D. poseer una tienda D. productos perecederos. Ella solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio y comprar más productos D. primera necesidad, ya que a pesar que ya cuenta con varios años D. tener la tienda, es poco lo que la ha logrado surtirla ya que no contaba con los recursos necesarios para hacerlo. María es una mujer la cual brinda un gran ejemplo por ser muy trabajadora y que cuenta con el deseo D. querer seguir adelante. Así también su negocio es una manera en la cual se distrae, ya que ella es una señora que vive sola, debido a que sus dos hijas ya son casadas y viven en el extranjero y su esposo murió hace algún tiempo atrás. D. esta manera María busca seguir adelante y poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Angélica G. D. A., 59 years of age, resides in Cojutepeque in the department of Cuscatlán. She is a person who is very dedicated and she makes an effort each day to esure she has everything that is necessary to live. For 5 years Maria has owned a shop selling perishable products. She is seeking a loan so that she can supply her business and buy more products of the first necessity. Even though she has owned the shop for many years, she has only been able to supply it a little and didn't have the necessary resources to do it. María is a woman who provides a great example of a hard worker, and desires to move forward. Her business is also a way to distract her, now that she lives alone, owing to the fact that her 2 daughters are now married and live far away, and her husband died a while ago. In this way María looks to move forward and expand her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.en:
Ms. Sokhna T., aged 60, runs a small convenience shop in the town of Bambey, about 100 km from Dakar.  U-IMCEC recently opened a new branch in Bambey to better serve its more rural clientele.  Previously, Ms. T. was a client with the branch in Diorbel, about 30km away.
She explains she chose her trade because she does not have any training or qualification, so commerce was one of the only choices for her.  With her loan of 150,000 FCFA, she is looking to diversify her revenue by purchasing earrings, bracelets and watches for sale to her customers.  She is widowed and has two adult children.

loans.use: To replenish her stock of jewelry

loans.name: La Paix Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe La paix sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 42ans et  3 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames au quartier 1, un des quartiers de la ville de Loulouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse de croître. Elles  ont comme activités l’achat vente des fruits, condiments, habits, atiecké etc.
Avec leur prêt, elles comptent acheter, des fruits (1chargement de charrette d’orange + 5 régimes de bananes), 6 paquets de condiments, 3douzaines d’ habits et  5 sacs d’atiecké + 1bidon de 20litre d’huile pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Loulouni ville le jour de foire et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent à Loulouni ville  à domicile, au marché et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante. Elles vendent au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager un point de vente.
texts.en:
The members of the group "La Paix" (Peace) are essentially married women with an average age of 42 and three children, on average. They mostly live in monogamous families in District 1, a district of the town of Loulouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their third collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele which grows from day to day. They have businesses buying and selling fruit, condiments, clothing, 'atieké' (cassava grits), etc.

With their loan they are counting on buying fruit (a wagenload of oranges and 5 stalks of bananas) 6 packets of condiments, 3 dozen pieces of clothing, and 5 sacks of 'atieké' + 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of oil for making cooked food.

They buy their inventory at the market of Loulouni town on weekly market days and in surrounding villages. They sell their goods in Loulouli town, out of their houses, in the market, and walking on foot through the neighborhoods. They sell for cash and often for credit to a clientele composed of men and women.

They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 32,000 F CFA of which part will be used to add to their savings or for family expenses, and the rest reinvested into their businesses.

They expect to have more working capital so as to better satisfy the needs of their clientele and to be able to set up a sales point.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale

loans.name: Mrs. E De Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan, which consists of fifteen peopL., is located in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. Mrs. E D. is the village bank president selected by the members who all use the loan for different purposes. She is 57 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local public school.

Mrs. E D. sells the fish that her fisherman husband, Mr. Hok Choeung, catches. This family has a problem because their fish nets are too old to use, but they D. not have enough money to buy new ones. Thus, Mrs. E D. decided to apply for a loan to buy fish nets.

loans.use: To buy fish nets

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
Rafaela M. O., tiene la edad de 57 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 17 y 20 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es comprar terneros  pequeños, engordarlos, y una vez que están grandes venderlos para obtener el mayor ingreso posible. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Rafaela tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y también con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rafaela M. O. is 57-years old, married, and has two children who are her prime concern. They are 17 and 20 years old. Rafaela wants a loan to buy livestock; her plan is to purchase young calves, fatten them up, and once they are big, sell them for as much money as possible. This isn’t the first time that she has had a loan through Kiva partner, FUDECOSUR. She is very happy with the credit terms that have always been available to her. Doña Rafaela has worked in agriculture for several years, always with livestock. She hopes to be able to provide a better standard of living for her family in the future, and to continue developing both as a person and as a provider. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten up

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela tiene 60 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rafael D. 68 años, quien trabaja junto a ella en la chacra y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila.

Trabajando arduamente, Estela ha logrado que sus cultivos le brinden los productos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Antes D. que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale D. su casa y camina cerca D. una hora para llegar a sus tierras donD. tiene sembrado zanahoria, papa y alverja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso; lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda D. abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. 

Este es el quinto préstamo D. Estela con MFP, está muy feliz D. poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que lo hacen posible. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas semillas, además D. abono y insecticidas.
texts.en:
Estela is 60 years old and a cheerful hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Rafael (age 68), who works with her on their farm. What they desire most is to have a peaceful retirement.

Estela works hard to grow crops that proviD. the necessary products to support her family. Before the sun shines its first rays, she leaves her house and walks nearly an hour before arriving at her farmland where she grows carrots, potatoes, and peas. These products are later sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating the land because she believes it provides good use. She has been in this line of work for 40 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to Tarma because the sacks of produce are very heavy and greatly tire her. Over time she hopes to open a grocery store, which will help her improve her family’s financial situation.

This is Estela’s fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have qualified for this loan and wants to thank everyone who maD. this possible. In her Communal Bank, Estela is a highly respected member of the highest order at all of their meetings. With her loan of 2000 PEN, she will buy seeds, compost, and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, compost, and insecticides

loans.name: Kijjamunsi Women's Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
G. Deborah, shown at the top left in a small photo, also appears in the big photo and she is the leader of her lending group. She is 53 years old and married with four children: two at the University while two are out of school. She also helps to take care of seven grandchildren and orphans.

Debra has operated a retail shop in Mabuye for ten years and she is able to make 200,000/= as monthly profits. She works so hard to ensure that she is self-sustaining as well as to have a better life for herself and her family.

Debra is a very hardworking and honest lady and she needs a loan to be able to restock her retail shop with more goods. She will be able to buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other goods for expansion.

In the group photo, Nakintu Faridah, standing third from the right, is a part of the group although in recess. Hence she is not one of the members that are seeking a loan.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items for increased stock

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en:
Nana Adjoa F. is divorced and lives with her two children. She has been through senior high school. Nana Adjoa is into palm oil production at Jukwa. She uses the earnings she makes from the sale of palm oil for the general upkeep of her home. Nana Adjoa will use this loan to purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana Adjoa plans to save to buy a palm nut peeling machine.
 
To prepare her locally made palm oil, she gets his palm nuts from the farmers on the farm.
She washes them, boils it for about forty minutes until it becomes soft and tender. The cooked fruits are strained and put into a big mortar and gently squeezed with a pestle avoiding damaging the nut but only to peel the pulp covering the nut. Water is then added to it, the juice obtained is strained separating the nut and taking out the chaff with the hand. (The chaff is sometimes used by the local people to light charcoal fire).The juice is boiled again and as it boils, the fresh oil will be seen floating whilst the water keeps boiling beneath. The scooped oil is left to cool and later bottled or preserved for sale.
Fresh oil form palm fruits are traditionally used in eating roasted yam or plantain in Africa especially in the farms after a hard days work.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to make palm oil for sale

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en: Sulaiman M. is an experienced businessman who has traded for about 15 years. He lives on Jumbu Street, Bo, and his shop is on Fenton Road. He sells various types of electrical equipment. Sulaiman is married with two children, both attending primary school. He usually sells on credit to staff of various organizations and collects his money at the end of every month. He is looking for a loan in order to buy more stock so that he can satisfy his customers' desires. Moreover, he intends to complete payment for a piece of land he already has a deposit on.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel P. D. V. está casada con el señor Maximiliano V. por más D. 45 años y viven en la ciudad D. Cochabamba en la zona D. Muyurina a solo una cuadra D. la agencia central D. Cidre en Cochabamba.

Juntos tienen una pequeña tienda D. barrio por casi 15 años, es esta la que los ayuda a sustentarse y a poder vivir. Sus 2 hijos mayores ya son casados y tiene sus propias familias, a pesar D. que ayudan en lo que pueden a sus padres, la señora Isabel y el señor Maximiliano dependen casi un 100% en su tienda para poder cubrir con sus gastos diarios.

El crédito que solicitan es para poder aumentar algunos productos en su tienda y así poder vender más y mejorar un sus ingresos. La señora Isabel nos cuenta que su mayor y único sueño que tiene es poder vivir muchos años más para ver a sus 3 nietos crecer.
texts.en:
Isabel P. D. V. has been married to Maximiliano V. for over 45 years; they live in the Muyurina area of the city of Cochabamba just a block from Cidre’s main office in Cochabamba. For the last 15 years they have had a small neighborhood grocery store which helps them support themselves and live. Their two adult children are already married and have their own families but try to help their parents out as much as they can. Isabel and Maximiliano depend almost 100% on their store to proviD. for their daily expenses. They will use the requested funds to increase some of the items they stock in their store so that they can sell more and increase their income. Isabel tells us that her greatest and only dream is to live many more years so that she can watch her three grandchildren grow up.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Binta D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de DINGUIRAYE depuis le 02 mars 2006 et 06 fois bénéficiaire de crédit au niveau de l'institution de microfinance CAURIE-MF. C'est un membre très engagé, dynamique et assidu ce qui lui a valu un assez bon niveau d'épargne.

Elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits tels, du riz, de l'huile végétale, du sucre, du lait, du thé, de la cigarette etc... Elle vend également des œufs durs et le petit déjeuné. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital d'investissement afin de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises.

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, de prendre en charge sa progéniture et de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille en appuyant financièrement son mari.
texts.en:
Binta D. is a married, 26-year-old mother of two. She has been a member of the Dinguiraye Banc Villageois since March 2, 2006 and has received 6 loans from the microfinance institution Caurie Microfinance. She is very engaging, dynamic, and dedicated and this has enabled her to save up a good amount. She owns a shop where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, tea, cigarettes, etc. She also sells hard-boiled eggs and breakfast foods. Her new loan will allow her to increase her investment capital so she can purchase more goods. Her goal is to increase her savings, take care of her children, and improve her family's quality of life by supporting her husband financially.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her investment capital

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Ganchimeg J. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in a ger, the traditional Mongolian housing tent, in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her daughter, age 6, goes to a kindergarten while her husband runs a consumer goods trading business.

Ganchimeg used to work as a knitter in the Gobi Cashmere factory of Mongolia and now she is self-employed, making a variety of knitted and woven products in her small factory and selling them in the western provinces and the countryside. Her husband operates a stable shoe-trading business in Harhorin, one of the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar.

Currently, Ganchimeg wants to ensure the stability of her business and expand her small factory. She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics, knitting machine spare parts, and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, knitting machine spare parts, and equipment for her business

loans.name: Jhoan

texts.en:
Jhoan L. is from the village of Benhaan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 22 years old. Jhoan is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jhoan owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Jhoan has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jhoan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jhoan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Jhoan's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra en pleno desarrollo dentro del tercer ciclo y todas se encuentran muy satisfechas con su trabajo, pero desean seguir trabajando para lograr mayores cosas, y sacar adelante a sus familias de la mejor manera.
Así cada una trabaja realiza actividades diferentes para sus ingresos individuales y también realizan trabajos en conjunto para  y de esa manera contar con un fondo en común para cualquier emergencia. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria Estela quien se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos.
Su actividad consiste en vender sus productos sobre pedido es decir sus clientes solicitan los productos y de acuerdo a la cantidad solicitada, y los vende, en la mayoría de los caso a créditos. 
Actualmente cuenta con varios pedidos y por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como cremas para la piel, perfumes, maquillejes.
texts.en:
This group is in the middle of the development of their third loan cycle and everyone is very satisfied with their work. However, they want to continue working to achieve bigger things and have their families succeed in the best way.

Each member has different activities for their individual earnings and they also have jobs that they do together so that they have a communal fund for any emergency.

One of the group members is Maria Estela who works in cosmetics sales. Her business consists of selling her products by order, which means that her clients request products and according to the amount requested, she sells them in the majority of cases on credit. She currently has several requests and as a result, she is requesting the loan for the purchase of cosmetics such as skin creams, perfumes, and makeup.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of skin creams, perfumes, makeup, and other accessories

loans.name: Yimmy Geovanny

texts.es:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F., tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo. 

Yimmy es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Yimmy se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz en ciclo corto. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños superarse en los estudios y terminar la universidad. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como la variedad del clima

Le gusta jugar fútbol los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F. is twenty years old. He is single without children and lives with his parents. He lives in Ventanas a province in Los Rios. Yimmy is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 partners in all most of whom work in the agricultural sector. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Yimmy works in agriculture; he grows corn that grows on a short cycle. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, and he sells his product there too. He is applying for a loan to purchase corn seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to improve his life. HIs dreams are to continue with his studies and finish university. His business faces difficulties such as infestations, diseased plants, and the variability of the weather. He likes to play soccer on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn for planting

loans.name: Banin

texts.en: Mr. Banin H. and his wife, Mrs. Sokea Chhom, have been married since 1995 and have two sons who are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Banin has been a rice farmer for more than thirty years, while his wife has been selling dessert in her village for more than six years. Banin obtained a previous Kiva loan and he wants to continue increasing his productivity. So, he is asking for another loan in the amount of 300 USD to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm

loans.name: Lucky Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Lucky Group” from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isata B.. Isata was born in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The thirty-seven-year-old is married and has three children. Her husband is a motor-bike driver and her children are attending primary school. Isata sells bread and flour. She will use her share of this loan to buy flour wholesale.

loans.use: Buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Amistad Eterna Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Amistad Eterna” están organizándose para iniciar el ciclo número tres. El grupo está compuesto por diez mujeres, de este grupo se ha elejido la mesa directiva: presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas. 

La señora Juana, con tres ciclos en la asociación es la presidenta de la asociación.  Actualmente su negocio es la venta de verduras y fue iniciado por iniciativa propia.

Sus créditos le sirvieron para la compra de mercadería, la misma que es comprada de los mayoristas en la Ceja de El Alto y vendida por menor en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
Una de sus hijas le ayuda en la venta de verduras.

A la pregunta de qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, la señora Juana responde la "capacitación".
Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de artículos varios, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada) y papas, venta de refrescos, agencia de pollo, venta de abarrotes, venta de lotería, venta de vegetales, venta de productos de limpieza y aseo, venta de pensión y otros.
texts.en:
The "Amistad Eterna" (Eternal Friendship) Communal Bank is preparing to start their third cycle. The group is comprised of ten women. The group has elected its governing board; the president, treasurer, and secretary. Juana, the president, has been with the bank for three cycles. Her current business is selling vegetables. She started on her own initiative. Her loans have served to buy merchandise, which she buys from wholesalers in the outskirts of El Alto. She sells the merchandise for retail prices in different fairs in the city of El Alto. One of her daughter helps her sell vegetables. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Juana said "the training". The other members of the communal bank also have their own businesses, which are selling various things, selling "chuño" (dehydrated potatoes), selling potatoes, selling soft drinks, a chicken business, selling cleaning products, selling groceries, selling lottery tickets, selling room and board services, and other activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy showcase and sweets to boost sales

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan J. makes a living selling tomatoes and onions and is applying for a loan to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers. She is 34 years old, married and has one child who is a student in the local school. She hopes to use the additional income made possible by this loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is from the village of Poblacon, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Lilia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products  like biscuits, shampoo, milk sachets, coffee, Milo (drink powder) and other items in the local community. Lilia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es: Magdalena del Carmen S. D. F. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Juan Opico, en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista D. transporte público y junto a tres hijos D. 17, 10 y 7 años D. edad. Con el deseo D. poder brindarle ayuda a su esposo y así mismo aportar con todos los gastos del hogar, desD. hace 2 años y medio que Magdalena inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Magdalena atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 D. la mañana y termina a las 10 D. la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite poder cuidar a su pequeño hijo. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas, contando con el enorme beneficio D. estar al cuidado D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen S. D. F., 39, lives in the city of San Juan Opico, La Libertad department, with her husband, who is a public transportation driver, and their three children, who are 17, 10 and 7 years old.

Hoping to help her husband by contributing to household expenses she started her own grocery store two and a half years ago in her home.  Magdalena is open for business from Monday through Sunday from 6am until 10pm.  Despite her work being hard, having to attend to customers throughout the day, it allows her to care for her small son.

She is asking for a loan through which she can buy larger amounts of basic needs items to improve sales while having the enormous benefit of being able to be watchful of her children.

loans.use: To buy perishables to sell.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem K. (pictured) is a 40-year-old, married woman. Her husband, Mr. Dara Roeun, is 45 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 15 kilometers from the city. They have been married since 1991 and they have three children: two sons and one daughter.

To earn a living, Sem is a tailor, but she also sells sugarcane juice at her home to generate additional income. She is seeking her first loan in the amount of $200 to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente y reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el Anexo Santa Rosa del Caserío Lagunas, una zona ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque. La localidad se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales desde hace diez años. El cría ovejas, patos, pavos y gallinas en algunos corrales ambientados cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a la economía de su familia, por ello trata de cuidarla del mejor modo posible.

José desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de mejor modo, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento y algunas reparaciones a su vivienda. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old.  He has a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and three children in Santa Rosa annex of the village of Lagunas, in Mórrope district, in Lambayeque province.  The village is more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

José works raising and selling animals.  He has been doing this for ten years.  He raises sheep, ducks, turkeys and hens in some pens that he has near his home.  He feeds his animals grains and natural fodder and, when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to traders who usually visit the area where he lives.  This is the main source of income through which he supports his family financially.  For this reason, he takes care of his business as well as possible.

José would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed so that his animals develop better.  He would also like to maintain and make some repairs to his house.  To achieve his goal, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and balanced feed so that his animals develop better

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí  vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Arisain Trejo Estrada  del cual tiene  dos niños a su responsabilidad y son: Daniel de ocho  años, Hilton de cuatro años.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra  de ingredientes para elaborar panes como son: harina, aceite, huevo, leche, queso entre otros y para tamales son: maza, aceite, carne, chile ancho entre otros más, y con ellos apoyar se para elaborarlos.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que su familia es lo más importante para ella, y para salir  adelante necesitaba comenzar a trabajar pero sin descuidar a sus hijos, por ésta razón ella empezó a elaborar tamales y panes y a venderlos con sus vecinos.
De lo que ella va obtenidiendo de ganancias en su negocio compra más ingredientes para seguir con su negocio además de guardar dinero por alguna necesidad que pueda presentarse, como una enfermedad, un gasto adicional en la escuela, etc.
Noemi nos dice: "Gracias a Fundación Realidad y a KIVA por poner su confianza en personas como yo y que nos apoyan en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
Noemí lives in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, in Mexico.  She is married to Arisain Trejo Estrada and they have two children in their care: 8 year-old Daniel and 4 year-old Hilton.

Noemí will invest her loan in buying ingredients for making bread such as: flour, oil, eggs, milk, cheese, etc. and ingredients for making tamales such as: corn, oil, meat, poblano chili peppers, etc.  This will help her in making her products.

Noemí is in this business because her family is the most important thing for her and to get them ahead in life she needed to start working but without neglecting her children.  For this reason, she started making tamales and bread and selling them to her neighbors.

Noemí uses the profits from her business to buy more ingredients so that she can continue in her business and also saves some money for any need that might arise such as an illness, an additional school expense, etc.

Noemí says "Thank you Fundación Realidad and KIVA for putting your trust in people like myself and for supporting us in our businesses".

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tamales and bread such as corn, oil and meat

loans.name: Anna Mae

texts.en:
Anna Mae P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 25 years old and married. She is engaged in farming and particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest to the market. Anna Mae also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells various products like sugar and vinegar.

Anna Mae joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anna Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Anna Mae is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Brendalee

texts.en:
Brendalee A. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Brendalee owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Brendalee has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Brendalee joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brendalee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Brendalee is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Brendalee from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda L., 40, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She manages her own household while helping her family. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Criselda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Arlene buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 400 every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Criselda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to continue her maturation in her Lord Jesus Christ. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory

loans.name: Ung

texts.en: Ung N. has been spending her life cultivating crops in the province of Battambong. She learned how to grow rice crops from her grandparents when she was young. She is now married and has four children, two of whom are single and the other two are married and have their own houses. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Besides farming, Ung N. sells a few products next to her house; products such as cooking ingredients, fast food, shampoo, and other necessary items. This family earns an income of about 6 USD each day to support all the family's expenses. In order to make additional profit, Ung N. would like to apply for a loan to buy essential items for selling.

loans.use: To increase inventory in general store

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
The two people shown in the picture are Kuy O., 50, and her husband, age 45. They currently live in Kompong Cham province. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has five single children. One of their children is employed as a worker at the garment factory. 

In addition, Kuy O. also feeds some piglets in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. Kuy O. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase pig feed and piglets for breeding to sell.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and piglets for breeding to sell

loans.name: Ibad

texts.ru:
Ibad K. 44 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Lachin regiona, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ibad jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Dvoye iz kotorix uchatsya v kolledje. 
Ibad uje 11 let kak rabotayet masnikom. Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil otec kotoriy toje bil masnikom, eto professia u nix idet po rodu , dedushka Ibada toje bil masnikom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit maso dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Ibad K. is 44 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Lachin region who now lives in Baku with his family. Ibad is married with three children.  Two of his children go to college.  Ibad has been a butcher for eleven years.  He started this business with his father who was also a butcher.  This profession runs in the family; his grandfather was also a butcher.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy meat for resale to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy meat for resale

loans.name: Chepkoech

texts.en:
Chepkoech is married with one child aged four years, she herself being 28. She has been in dairy farming for seven years  in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, producing milk and selling to Brookside Dairies.She specializes in dairy farming but gets additional income from tea as well.

Chepkoech has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to help her put up a zero-grazing unit for her dairy cows. She says she expects her production to improve and make her a major supplier of milk in her area. She believes her dairy produce will be adequate to provide the basic requirements such as education of the children when that time comes.

Chepkoech says their major challenge is scarcity of land to hold a good number of dairy cows. She is glad that farmers can access agricultural loans through Juhudi Kilimo's help

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for six years and also earns an income from farming and pig fattening.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, sardines, groceries, etc. in her general store. She has borrowed and paid off 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Elena aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m y también se dedica a la venta de parlantes para diferentes eventos como fiestas de cumpleaños y orquestas, la socia prepara desayunos en el mercado del distrito de Anta, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de desayunos y el negocio para comprar parlantes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar los desayunos y para el mantenimiento para los parlantes. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca, 49, is a member of the AMANECER ANTENA community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Francisca is single and has 2 children.  She makes a living making and selling prepared breakfast meals.  She works from 6:00am to 2:00pm.  She also earns extra money renting speakers for events such as birthdays and concerts.  She sells the food that she makes in the Anta area market and the income that it generates allows her to provide for her children.  She wants to grow both businesses so she is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her food business and to pay to maintain the speakers that she rents.

Sra. Francisca is pleased with the loan terms and has agreed to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business and to pay for speaker maintenance for her speaker rental business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalia vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Rosalia tiene la edad de 30 años, esta casada con el señor Gustavo el cual trabaja haciendo el aseo en algunas tiendas de Tierra Blanca, ellos tiene 3 hijos: Angel de 7 años que asiste a la primaria y unos cuates de nombre Brayan y Gustavo de 9 meses de edad.

Doña Rosalia nos platica que hace mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar asi que inicio a vender visuteria (pulseras, aretes, collares, anillos, bolsas de mano) con sus amigas y vecinas de su comunidad, ellas nos dice que desde que inicio con su negocio siempre a tenido buenas ventas ya que lo que vende es algo novedoso que a las mujeres nos gusta usar mucho.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de bulsas de mano, pulseras, anillos, collares, aretes. Su venta la realiza en su tiempo libres ya que por las mañana trabaja en una muebleria.

Ella espera que con esta invesion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad a sus hijos y que en un futuro estudie una carrera ademas de que le gustaria tener un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosalia lives in the state of Veracruz in the town of Tierra Blanca which is better know as "the bride of the sun." This area is known for its livestock and for the abundant heat during the summer when temperatures can reach up to 54°c. Rosalia is 30 years old and is married to Gustavo who works as a janitor at some stores in Tierra Blanca. They have three children: Angel who is seven years old and goes to elementary school and nine-month-old twins named Brayan and Gustavo.

Rosalia tells us that more than two years ago she decided to start her own business so that she could help her husband with the household expenses. She started selling costume jewelry (bracelets, earrings, necklaces and rings) and purses to her friends and neighbors in her community. She tells us that since she started her business she has always had good sales since what she sells is new and something that women like to wear a lot. 

She needs this loan to purchase purses, bracelets, rings, necklaces and earrings. She makes her sales during her free time since she works during the mornings at a furniture store. 

She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper since she wants to give her children a better quality of life and in the future she wants them to have a career. She would also like to have a small shop where she could sell her products.

loans.use: to sell bracelets, purses and earrings.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 38 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He has been growing corn for almost 15 years. Last harvest season his net income was 30,000 PHP. Ruben believes that his farming has been a great help in improving his family’s living conditions.

Ruben is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He would like to continue availing himself of loans and he hopes that Kiva lenders will continue to extend their assistance to him in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She also owns real estate houses which contribute to her other source of livelihood. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of establishing another retail shop business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, bundles of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married, 44 years old, and has two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines.  She requested an PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish.

Josephine has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia  is 28 years-old and single with one nine year-old child.  For the past one year, she has been running her business. She earns a monthly income of about KES. 6,000 which she saves and also uses in the business.

She has been loaned KES. 10,000 from Kiva partner KADET Ltd. This is her first loan from KADET. She intends to use the loan to purchase stock like sugar flour, salt, rice, beans etc. to expand her business.

She plans to use the anticipated profit to start another business of trading clothes.  In the future, she hopes to buy a plot or piece of land to build.

loans.use: to purchase stock like  sugar flour, salt, rice, beans etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 29 years old and is married with two children. She sells clothes such as: adult clothing and children`s clothes. Her business is well-organized. 

The hours of her business are from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. She has two years' experience in this business and she currently employs one person to help her.

Dinah has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes (adult clothing and children`s clothes) for sale. With her profits, Jeanne will reinvest in her business,  save for her future and she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase various clothes (children`s clothes and adult clothing) for sale.

loans.name: Orencia

texts.es: Orencia, de 47 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre. Su familia lo conforma su esposo Roberto y sus 3 hijos, a los que ama mucho; juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como esposos, amigos y socios, Orencia, puso una tienda de comestibles, donde todas las mañanas, vende productos de primera necesidad, mientras que su esposo “Lolo”, así lo llama de cariño, trabaja en sus terrenos agrícolas, desde hace 31 años. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y palta. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder compartir los gastos familiares entre los dos, pues así logran desarrollarse juntos. Los planes de está pareja es poder obtener un buen grano de café, por ello están trabajando arduamente para la próxima campaña agrícola, donde comercializan sus granos a la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, obteniendo ganancias de acuerdo a la calidad del café. Según cuenta, este año el precio de venta del grano, aumentó considerablemente y espera aprovechar la demanda surgida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la unión palomar”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde desea salir adelante en compañía de su asociación; asimismo agradece el apoyo recibido por todos ustedes. Orencia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, que esparcirá en sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Orencia, 47, is a working woman and cheerful person. Her family is composed of her husband Roberto and their 3 children, whom she loves very much.  They live together in their own home, located in Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). Orencia and her husband work as spouses, friends and associates.  Orencia installed a grocery store, where every morning she sells staples, while her husband "Lolo", whom she calls with affection, works on his agricultural land, as he has been for 31 years. His main crops consist of coffee and avocado. 

What Orencia likes most is to to be able to share family expenses between the two of them, as well as to develop together. The couple's plans are to get a good coffee bean, so they are working hard for the next crop year where they market their grain to the cooperative Alto Palomar, a profit based on the quality of coffee. Orencia says, this year the selling price of grain increased considerably and she hopes to take advantage of the arising demand. She belongs to the communal bank "Prestatarios de la unión palomar," and this is her second loan with MFP.  She wants to get ahead in its association and also appreciates the support received from all of you. Upon receving your support, Orencia will invest the requested loan to buy bags of natural fertilizers, that she will spread over their coffee plantations.

loans.use: to buy bags of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa se dedica a la venta de productos varios desde hace más de 20 años, vende frijoles cosidos, leña, leche y posicles. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Tiene su familia, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de frijoles, leña y leche pues tiene una gran demanda de parte de sus clientes.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en:
María Teresa has sold various products for over 20 years.  She sells cooked beans, firewood, milk and popsicles.  She is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family and very proud of her roots.  She has her family and is always concerned to provide them with everything they need.  

The requested loan is to buy beans, firewood and milk because she has quite a bit of customer demand.  She wants to be able to continue with her means of earning a livelihood which is the most important thing.

loans.use: to buy beans, firewood and milk.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es:
La señora Katy nació en la ciudad D. Ocobamba provincia D. La Convención del departamento del Cusco, Actualmenrte, ella  vive en la comunidad D. Coya D. la provincia D. Calca. (En la fotografía la señora Katy está levantando la mano). 

La señora Katy es madre soltera y tiene una hija (Jorym D. 5 años D. edad), ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su hija, ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras como por ejemplo lechuga, repollo, cebolla, zanahorias y muchas más, ella lleva sus productos a la ciudad D. Quillabamba una vez al semana, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en unos D. los mercados más visitados por los pobladores D. la Ciudad D. Quillabamba. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

La señora Katy pertenece al banco comunal “San Antonio D. Padua” y en esta oportunidad Katy requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital para comprar un carro para poder transportar sus verduras. 

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “San Antonio D. Padua” son cada treinta días en la ciudad D. Coya. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad D. Coya y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. animales menores, venta D. comida, ganadería, agricultura y artesanía. La ciudad D. Coya se encuentra ubicada a una D. hora D. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mrs. Katy was born in the city of Ocobamba, province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.  She currently lives in the Coya Community in the province of Calca.  (She is the one raising her hand in the photograph).

Katy is a single mother and has a daughter (5-year-old Jorym).  She is a hard-working, responsible mother who cares for her daughter.  She sells vegetables such as lettuce, cabbage, onions, carrots and many more, in the city of Quillambaba once a week.  She has a stall in one of the busiest markets in Quillabamba.  She has been in business for a year and thanks to her hard work it is going very well.

Katy belongs to the communal bank "San Antonio D. Padua" and is requesting a loan to buy a car to transport her vegetables.

The members of the communal bank "San Antonio D. Padua" meet every month in the city of Coya.  The bank is comprised of working entrepreneurs who look for every opportunity to get ahead and, through their daily work, proviD. a better future for their children.

Most of the members live in the city of Coya and their business activities involve sales of small animals, food sales, livestock farming, agriculture and crafts.  The city of Coya is located an hour away from the city of Cusco.

Cusco is well known for its tourism, traD. and Inti Raymi traditional festivities, and also because it is home to one of the Seven Wonders of the World: "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy a car to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport recyclable material to sell

loans.name: Daisy M.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone to seek a loan of 8,400,000 SLL to solve their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will then repay the loan from their monthly salaries. 

Daisy is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Segbwema village, the 48 year old has been in the teaching profession for 25 years now. She is married and has 3 children – 1 in secondary school and 2 in college. Daisy has requested this loan to buy building materials like iron bars and  corrugated iron and zincs for the construction of a family house. She will also use part of the loan to pay her children's college fees.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chick to raise.

loans.name: Imaculate

texts.en:
Imaculate is 38 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Imaculate has been working hard to manage her mini supermarket, which sells food ingredients, cosmetics and basic items. 

To help expand her business, Imaculate has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy new kinds of food items for resale, and will help Imaculate to generate greater profits and improve her family's welfare. Imaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to grow the business into a bigger supermarket. 

Imaculate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Imaculate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of food items for resale

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with four children. 

Consuelo has a pigpen that sells matured and grown pigs.  She has been in business for five years.  Consuelo requests a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy animal feed for her pigs.

Consuelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Consuelo hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. Her husband is a cobbler. Hue earns a living running a general store, which she has done for three years. 

Hue would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mirtha comerciante, emprendedora, humilde mujer que tiene como planes mejorar las condiciones de vida. Con el préstamo anterior logro cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes, ya que además de tener en existencia constantemente el producto también vende por catálogos. Para este tiempo de fiesta navideña le solicitan más cantidades y variedad de mercadería. 
Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprara: cosméticos, prendas de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, así también bisuterías (colas, aros, llaveros, aretes, sintió para cabello, perfumes, cremas de manos, cuerpo y cara, cosméticos, gel de cabelló, shampoo, entre otros. Aumentando su inventario tendrá mayor variedad para ofrecer. Agradece a la financiera por el hacer posible que pueda obtener ingreso económicos para sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a merchant, entrepreneur, and humble woman who has plans to improve her living conditions. With the previous loan, she was able to meet her customer orders, consistently stock product and also sell by catalog. For this holiday season, they are asking her for higher quantities and more variety of merchandise.
With this new loan cycle, she will buy: cosmetics, clothing for women, men, and children, as well as  (hair ties, rings, key chains, earrings, headbands, perfumes, and lotion for hands, body and face, cosmetics, hair gel, and shampoo, among others). By expanding her inventory she will have more variety to offer. She is grateful to the lender for making possible her ability to earn income to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe FAÏDA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques à  HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  MARIAM N°1 à l'extrême gauche  fait le commerce de friperies.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une balle de friperie qu’elle revendra en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The members of the FAÏDA group are mainly married women with an average age of 35 and six children each. They live mostly in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

This is their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to achieve customer satisfaction.

Mrs. MARIAM, who sells used clothing, can be seen at the far left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to purchase a bale of used clothing for resale at retail at the Medina market of Sikasso and among family members, for cash, to a clientele composed of men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA, which she will use to pay off the loan and interest, and to boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for resale.

loans.name: María Angeles
