texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña María tiene 53 años, es separada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, 3 son casados y viven independientes, 3 trabajan, estudian y le  ayudan económicamente. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora María se dedica hace 33 años a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de frutas, labora de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo. En su casa cría pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas y pollos.
 
Su meta es construir su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Morlaquitas communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca. Since 1999, this city has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a place of great beauty and natural and cultural riches. Its people are kind and cordial, and they maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

María is 53 years old and separated. Her marriage has produced 6 children. Three are married and live independently. Three work, study, and help her economically. She does not have her own house, since she rents. 

For 33 years, María has sold all kinds of fruit door-to-door. She works every day without a fixed schedule. In her house, she raises chickens. 

She has been a member of the communal bank for one year, and she will use her loan to purchase fruit and chickens.

Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and chickens

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Mr Kossi K. has been a shoe cobbler for more than 15 years. Born at Havé in 1965, he moved to Tsévié N’Danyi for his work. He is a shoe maker and sells the commercially. Remarried, he has a child with his former wife who left him due to his very difficult socio-economic situation. As he was living in extreme poverty; sometimes he couldn’t find anything to eat. But his courage and determination have helped him to overcome that situation little by little thanks to his first credit of $ 100 which he repaid without incident. His primary level studies have helped him to well manage his business and make profit thanks to the advices of the credits agents. Which have helped him to get two other respective loans of $ 300 and $ 550 which are all repaid. To improve his business Mr Kossi K. requests a credit of $ 850 which will allow him to acquire material and cobbler articles. The improvement and profitability of his business will allow him to accomplish in a responsible way, the duties of the household chief by improving his existing conditions.

Translated from French by Farron BLANC, a Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur K. Kossi est cordonnier depuis plus de 15 ans. Né à Havé en 1965, il s’est installé à Tsévié N’Danyi pour ses activités. Il fait la réparation des chaussures et en fabrique pour la commercialisation. Remarié, il a un enfant avec son ex-femme qui l’a quitté à cause de sa situation socio économique très déplorable. Car il vivait dans une extrême pauvreté ne trouvant même pas dès fois de quoi manger. Mais son courage et son abnégation l’ont aidé à s’en sortir peu à peu de cette situation grâce à son premier crédit de $100 qu’il a remboursé sans incident. Son niveau d’études élémentaires lui a permis de bien gérer ses affaires et à les rentabiliser grâce aux conseils des agents de crédit. Ce qui lui a permis d’obtenir deux autres crédits respectifs de $300 et $550 qui sont tous bien remboursés. Pour renforcer son activité, Monsieur K. Kossi sollicite un crédit de $850 qui va lui permettre d’acquérir des matériels et fournitures de cordonnerie. Le renforcement et la rentabilité de l’activité va lui permettre d’accomplir, d’une manière plus responsable, les devoirs de père de famille en améliorant ses conditions d’existence.

loans.use: to acquire material and cobbler articles

loans.name: Dede

texts.en: Dede is a school dropout. She left school because her parents could not afford to pay her fees in addition to those of seven other siblings. She now sells fish on a wooden board. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She knows about the TEACH Lending program and has knowledge of record-keeping. She needs a loan of $675 to expand her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sayaad Habib

texts.en: S. Habib is 18 years old. He lives with all members of his family. He is in school and also he is supporting his family. He is a butcher and working part time in his shop. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to enlarge his shop and buy new materials to attract more clients. He wants to make a good income for his family and also make a better life for himself. He is happy now that he can help his family with this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials for his shop

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es:
I have a small business that I run from home, as you can see in the picture. I've had my business for about a year. Currently, I would like to buy more merchandise to offer more inventory to my clients and to provide better customer service. I need to buy milk, eggs, beans, sugar, pastas, etc. I would appreciate your help since this is my only livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo este pequeño negocio como ustedes pueden ver mi foto, lo tengo hace un año en mi casa. Ahora yo quiro comprar mas producto para poder vender mas y dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes que son los de mi comunidad. Nesecito comprar leche, huvos, frijoles, azucar, pastas y otros.Les agradecere mucho su ayuda ya que no tengo otro trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase refreshments, churros, candy products, bread, tortillas, milk & eggs, etc.

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab T., 57, and her husband live together in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Between them they have 3 children, one of whom works at an airport earning $200 a month, one as a construction worker earning $3 a day, and one selling souvenir products to tourists for $2 a day. They have applied for this loan so that they can build a house as there own house has fallen into disrepair.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana is a hard working and caring mother. She has a 6 year-old son and as of one year ago has been dedicated to selling yogurt, cakes, and caramels in a small square in her birth town, Pukará. She begins her small business at 9 A.M. every day and works until 5 P.M. Thanks to her friendly nature and the delicious yogurts and cakes that she prepares, she has been able to procure a lot of clients. The funds that her business has generated have permitted her to cover the basic necessities for her home and most importantly to help her husband Roger raise the level of education of their son. Maximiliana asks for a loan of $300, with the objectives of enlarging the area where she sells and increasing the variety of her products in order to better her economic situation. She promises to reimburse the loan within 7 months and anxiously awaits your response to her request.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Maximiliana es una madre muy trabajadora y cariñosa, tiene un niño de 6 años y desde hace un año está dedicada a la venta de yogurt, tortas y caramelos en forma ambulatoria en una plaza de toritos de su pueblo natal Pukará; atiende su pequeño negocio a partir de las 9:00 de la mañana y concluye su labor a las 5:00 de la tarde.Gracias a su amabilidad y a los deliciosos yogures y tortas que prepara ha logrado obtener asiduos clientes y las ganancias que ha generado con su trabajo le ha permitido cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y sobre todo apoyar a su esposo Roger a incrementar el nivel educativo de su retoñito.Ella desea obtener un préstamo de 300 dólares, con el objetivo de ampliar su puesto de ventas y aumentar la variedad de sus productos para mejorar su situación económica. Maximiliana promete reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de siete meses y espera ansiosa tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Increase her capital to enlarge her small working area

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Here we find Madam Marcela in the company of her four adorable children. Weaving with extreme patience and elegance as she makes her beautifully colorful blankets. This is one of the many trades that she dedicates herself to. This hardworking woman also works in agriculture and the raising of livestock, work that she shares with her husband Auturo. Between the two of them they try to give the most of themselves in order to get ahead and prosper. They actually live in a place located in a little town called Ayaviri and their greatest hope is to one day own their own house where they could offer wellbeing and security to their beloved children. To formalize their plans they wish to obtain a loan to increase and consolidate their businesses so that they can increase their profits and finally be able to afford to get their dream house.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Marcela en compañía de sus cuatro adorables niñas, tejiendo con suma paciencia y elegancia sus hermosas y coloridas frazadas, uno de los tantos oficios a los que está dedicada esta ejemplar madre.Esta laboriosa mujer también se dedica a la agricultura y a la comercialización de ganadería, trabajo que comparte con su esposo, Arturo, y entre los dos tratan de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante y prosperar . Actualmente viven en un domicilio alquilado del pueblito de Ayaviri y el deseo más grande que tienen, estos emprendedores padres, es poseer su propia casita, en donde puedan brindarles bienestar y seguridad a sus encantadoras niñas.Para concretar sus planes desean obtener un préstamo para acrecentar y consolidar sus negocios para que con los beneficios económicos que obtenga construyan su anhelada morada.

loans.use: Investment of capital to consolidate family businesses.  Inversión de capital para consolidación de los negocios familiares.

loans.name: Ocheng B (Ii) Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.p>

Edith is a 30 year old widow with seven children. She has a small broiler poultry farm. She wants to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more broilers to increase business volume

loans.name: Susiawati

texts.en: Susiawati, 39, is married to M. and does not work anymore. To support her family needs, she sells household goods such as glasses, clothes, etc. on credit door-to-door around the villages, earning $35 a week with small profit. She is a member of MBK and now asks for a loan of $150 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to her business capital

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Selling beauty products is the daily work of señora Ana Consuelo. She gets ready very early to travel the streets in search of women who desire personal advice so they can look more beautiful every day. With the goal of improving the quality of life of her family and with dreams of progress, she has been able to establish a wide portfolio of clients, who turn to her month after month. While keeping this in mind, and since she has the space in her house where she sells her products, she has decided to acquire a display case to display her articles permanently with the goal of having them at arm's reach when one of her valued clients wants to look at them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La venta de productos de belleza es el trabajo diario de la señora Ana Consuelo, desde muy temprano se dispone a recorrer las calles en búsqueda de damas que deseen un asesoramiento personal para verse cada día más hermosas, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sus deseos de progreso ha podido establecer una amplia cartera de clientes, quienes mes a mes acuden en su búsqueda.Teniendo en cuenta esto y contando con el espacio que dispone en casa ha decidido adquirir una vitrina para exponer de manera permanente sus artículos a fin de tenerlos siempre a la mano en cuanto haya alguna disposición de sus queridos clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of a display case

loans.name: Maota A Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
The three women pictured in the photograph live in Maota A on the island of Savaii. They are borrowing from SPBD for the first time. All of them have undergone four weeks of training in business management and maintenance of a savings account, and have passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments, and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and in repaying their loans on time. 

Ao U., 45, is married and has three children. For the last three years, she has been selling pancakes (round lumps of fried bread) at a local school. With the help of the loan, Ao will be able to open her own shop and increase the productivity of her business. She will purchase iron roofing, bags of cement, flour, bags of sugar, cooking oil, and cooking powder. Ao expects her weekly profit to be 230 Tala (~US$92).

Keke I., 36, is married and has two children.  She sells coconuts, bananas, pineapples, and other fruit at a flea market once a week. Her business is known for its wide variety, low prices, and good customer service. Keke's loan will be used to purchase materials to build a sales stall.

Naama U., 55, married, has 10 children. She has three years of experience in farming. Every day, she sells taro, bananas, coconuts, and other fruits and vegetables. With her loan, Naama will purchase 5 rolls of wire, 2 pliers, 2 gallons of water, chemicals, 2 machetes, and other farming equipment. She expects her weekly profit to be 200 Tala (~US$80).

loans.use: Purchase of building materials and farming equipment

loans.name: Tafutatafuta Group

texts.en:
Patrick S. is a young Kenyan father aged 39 with 3 children. He also lives with 1 orphan child of his late sister who perished 2 years ago.

Patrick started his business 2 years ago, after accumulating savings from his former work place in a local petrol station in the Bungoma district. He currently deals in the sale of electronic spare parts for TVs and radios, but he would also like to diversify into selling computer accessories in the near future.

As Patrick is the bread winner for the family; the business enables him to feed, clothe, and educate his wife and children. With the help of his loan, Patrick will be able to purchase more electronic spare parts to enable him to increase his monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic spare parts to sell

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha L. and his wife, Mrs. Hoeun Lao, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1999 and have three children, two sons and one daughter.  Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Chantha started his business of producing fresh noodles and selling them to the local market in 1995. Now he has become a Khmer noodle wholesaler. He learned his business from his neighbor, while Mrs. Hoeun sells other food produce and also assists him with producing fresh noodles as well. 

Now Chantha is requesting a loan of US$1000 to expand his business of selling fresh noodles.

loans.use: For expanding business of Khmer noodle wholesale.

loans.name: Fariz

texts.en: Fariz was born in 1982. He is married and has 2 children. Fariz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Lachin region, settled in Baku city, Yasamal region. He has been in this business for 5 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts so as to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has a general store in her home which she started one year ago. This client started her business with basic merchandise such as chips, bread and soft drinks, and today she has a few more products since she has been able to stock her store with more items. She has been tending to and managing the business so that it is stable.

This is the first time she requests a loan. She decided to make this request from FVP (Kiva’s partner in Nuevo Laredo) to stock her store with more merchandise and see it grow. This business is one of the sources of income with which she and her husband, Jose Fidel, count on to sustain their family (they have two children).

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Esther maneja su negocio de abarrotes de su propria casa desde un año. Este cliente inició su negocio con una mercancía sencilla de Fritos, pan, y refrescos y hoy en dia la señora tiene un poco más de productos ya que ha podido surtir de otras mercancías. Ella se ha dedicado a atender el negocio y administrarlo para que su negocio esté estable.

Esta es la primera vez que ha solicitado un préstamo. Ella decidió solicitar un préstamo de FVP (el socio de Kiva en Nuevo Laredo) para surtir más la mercancía y hacer crecer el negocio. Este negocio es una las fuentes de ingresos con que cuentan ella y su esposo, Jose Fidel, para sostener a su familia (tienen a dos hijos).

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Laki

texts.en:
Laki is married with three children aged 25, 20 and 18 years old. She has been a fruits seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 8am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Laki now requests a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Liutofaga

texts.en:
Liutofaga F., 36, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the banana and taro growing business. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week.

She has had one previous loans with SPBD. Liutofaga intends to use this loan to purchase chemicals, pesticides and vegetable seeds for her business. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Liutofaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchasing of chemicals, pesticides, vegetable seeds

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Âgée de 30 ans, dame  N. Françoise est originaire de Porto-Novo et est née à Cotonou. Mariée à KOUHOUENOU Raymond elle a 03 enfants dont Lucie 10ans est en classe de CE2. Dès son jeune âge elle s'est mise à vendre de la nourriture qu'elle a hérité de sa défunte mère.Toujours dans le soucis de satisfaire ses clients qui ne cessent de s'accroître, elle sollicite ce sixième prêt de 120000fcfa pour augmenter son stock de riz.
texts.en:
Ms. Françoise N., age 30, is originally from Porto-Novo and was born in Cotonou. Married to Raymond KOUHOUENOU, she has three children, including Lucie, age 10 and in the 3rd grade. At a young age, she got started selling food, a business she inherited from her deceased mother. Always concerned with meeting customer expectations, which is continuously growing, she is requesting this sixth loan amounting to 120,000 francs CFA to increase her stock of rice.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of rice

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne G. was born in 1977 in Cotonou. She married Agossou Hounkpevi, a taxi driver, and they have two children in school. She has sold fabric and assorted products such as soap for the past four years. Jeanne has lived in Midombo, a neighborhood in Cotonou, for 8 years. With her first loan, she grew her clientele, and is now applying for a second and slightly larger loan. 

Née vers 1977 à Cotonou. Elle est  mariée à HOUNKPEVI Agossou (Chauffeur taxi auto) et est mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est dans la vente de tissus et de divers (savons, Omo) depuis 04ans.Dame G. réside à Midombo depuis 08 ans. Avec son premier crédit d’un montant de 75000, elle a su fidéliser sa clientèle ce qui a fait accroître la demande de cette dernière. Voulant satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de 180000 f CFA. 

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of 19 swatches of fabric

loans.name: Najjanakumbi A- Resty Group

texts.en:
N. Resty is 48 years old and operates a restaurant  in Najjanakumbi. Her business is 5 years old and she prepares a variety of local dishes like matooke, lumonde, mayuni, buga, luwombo, among others. She purchases the food stuffs and spices from the  Kibuye market. On a good day, Resty sells about 150,000USH worth of food from which she earns an average daily profit of 20,000USH.

She is hardworking and jovial. She is married with 4 children aged between 18 and 27 years. She also takes care of 2 of her grand children. Resty dreams of transforming her restaurant into a modern one that would earn her a reputation in catering services to functions like weddings, kwanjula (traditional marriage), and graduations.

loans.use: Purchase a bag or rice, crates of soda and mineral  water.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en:
S., 44, works raising pigs and poultry to sell in her village of Sthaney in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been raising small livestock since 2005. Her husband is a staff member of an NGO who gets a salary of US$ 100 per month. She has five children, all of whom are teenagers; she is responsible for caring for them.

To increase her income by adding more pigs and chickens, S. would like to request a loan to purchase more piglets and chicks to raise. She expects the loan to help by improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets and chicks to raise

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Mambo ("Hello") from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Juliana M. from Mwanza. She is separated from her husband, and has 3 children between the ages of 11 and 19 years old. Juliana has been running a grocery business since 2008. Her shop is a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof. She sells items such as beer, soda and water. She works in her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Juliana currently earns about $160 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase drinks like beer, soda and water. In the future, she plans to open another business. Juliana thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase drinks like beer,soda and water.

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
Ancelma es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Ancelma es conviviente  tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 27, 26 y 15 años que esta en la escuela  estatal.
Se dedica a la venta de empanadas  en el verano y al tejido de chompas en el invierno, llevo un curso de repostería  ahora esta haciendo dulces y postres.  Desde los 17 años empezó a tejer con una señora que exportaba chompas, tejía una chompa  semanal. 
Ancelma necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para hacer empanadas  y comprar harina, huevos, leche.
En Finca recibe apoyo con los prestamos que dan,  y orientación  con las charlas sobre negocio, en las reuniones del Bancomunal ha encontrado unión,  ha hecho amigas. 
El sueño de ancelma es poner una panadería.
texts.en:
Ancelma is a member of the Communal Bank 'Unidas Triunfaremos' ('United we will Triumph').

Ancelma lives with her partner, she is 44 years old and has 3 kids who are 27, 26 and 15 years old, and the youngest is in the state school.

She dedicates herself to selling empanadas (a type of pie consisting of filled tortilla dough which is then fried) in Summer and knitted sweaters and cardigans in Winter. She has been on a baking course and now is making sweets and desserts. She started to weave 17 years ago with a woman who exported sweaters, and she knitted a sweater a week.

Ancelma needs a loan of 1000 soles to make empanadas and buy flour, eggs, milk.

In Finca she receives support with the loans they give her and giudance with the business talks, and in the Communal Bank's meetings she has found unity and made friends.

Ancelma's dream is to have a bakery.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ancelma needs a loan of 1000 soles to make empanadas and buy flour, eggs, milk./Ancelma necesita un préstamo de  1000 soles para hacer empanadas  y comprar harina, huevos, leche.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Era.
Maximiliana es casada, tiene 53 años y 5 hijos, Maximiliana tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donD. venD. cereales, sus productos los adquiere D. los productores que le traen a su puesto.
Maximiliana necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. maní, papa seca.
Maximiliana sueña con tener mas capital y educar a sus dos últimos hijos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a member of the Banco Comunal Nueva Era (New Era Communal Bank). Maximiliana is married, 53 years old and has 5 children. Maximiliana has a place in the Grau Market where she sells cereals. She acquires her products from the producers that bring them to her at her place in the market.

Maximiliana needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of peanuts and dried potatoes. Maximiliana dreams of having more capital for her business and being able to educate her two youngest children.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of peanuts and dried potatoes.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur Adjamon koffi est un jeune homme dynamique qui s’est lancé en 2000 dans le commerce de ciment, il a ouvert  une boutique qu’il a appelé « Ets ADJAMON & FILS », il reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs et des maçons. Son stock actuel de ciment étant épuisé il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 12 paquets de ciment. Etant célibataire il arrive à bien gérer ses économies et subvient convenablement à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi Adjamon is an energetic young man who began selling cement in the year 2000. He has opened a store he calls « Ets ADJAMON & FILS ». He receives orders from entrepreneurs and masons. His present stock of cement is expended, so he is requesting his first loan from WAGES to purchase 12 packages of cement. Since he is single, he manages to put aside savings and support himself correctly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cement in order to increase his inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with one child. She sells women's shoes at the central market in the city of Melitopol. Her profit is 3,000 UAH per month.

Svetlana has been in this business for 13 years and enjoys selling this type of goods. She chooses each model she sells individually and offers her clients only the best goods at reasonable prices. Her kiosk is located at a good place in the market, which also helps Svetlana to have many clients.

Svetlana would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She would spend additional income to purchase some home equipment for her family needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of women's shoes

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
With five children and the responsibility of providing food for his family, Vaqif E. has raised cattle and farmed from a very young age. He has been able to improve his family’s financial situation thanks to the excellent care that he has given his animals.

Today, Vaqif finds himself in need of more calves to raise, to sell them when necessary, or when their sale will be most advantageous. Vaqif has applied for a loan of $1500 to obtain these animals and raise them so that in time they can be used to support his family.

loans.use: To purchase three calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Shafakhat

texts.en:
Shafakhat A. is a 32-year-old married man who owns a small farm. He is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his two children.

Shafakhat has a business raising and selling sheep and has seven years of experience in this field. Since sheep raising and selling is a profitable business, Shafakhat has become a very successful businessman. He works very hard and spends all his time with his animals, cleaning them and feeding and pasturing them.

Now Shafakhat wants to expand his business and buy more sheep, so he has applied for a loan of $2,000. Shafakhat thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Flaivienne

texts.en:
Flaivienne T. lives with her husband in CoT., the largest city in Bénin. Her husband makes a living as a carpenter, and she runs a beauty salon. They do not yet have any children. Flaivienne's activity consists of selling hair care products, cutting hair and doing braids. Many women come to her salon to have colorful streaks woven into their hair. Braiding hair is a lengthy process and is often a social gathering for women in the neighborhood.

Flaivienne has been working in her salon for four years. Before opening shop, she was trained under another hairdresser, not far from where she works now. Feeling competent in the trade, she decided to open her own business. Flaivienne is seeking a loan from Alidé in order to expand her operations. She would like to be able to fully stock her salon with hair products.

loans.use: Purchase of hair care products

loans.name: Nozimchon

texts.ru: Бобокулов Нозимчон проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 1 ребенка. Нозимчон по специальности "налоговик". Но вот более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает арбуз и лук. Некоторую часть для продажи, а некоторую для потребности семьи. Кредит просит для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Nozimchon B. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 28 years old, married and has 1 child. Nozimchon is a tax collector by trade. However, he has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He grows watermelons and onions; some for sale and some for his family’s use. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Roberto C. de 37 años de edad, habitante de Carlos Fonseca comarca de villa del carmen, casado tiene dos hijos, su esposa ama de casa, viven en casa propia, se desempeña como Electricista Automotriz desde hace ocho meses, profesionalmente aumentar sus ingresos para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y unas remodelaciones en su vivienda son parte de sus planes. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, piso, zinc. Obteniendo seguridad y protección para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto C. is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He and his family live in the Carlos Fonseca region of the town of Villa Del Carmen. His wife is a homemaker. Sr. Roberto has been working as an automotive electrician for the past 8 months. His plans include increasing his career earnings and remodeling his home so that his family will experience better living conditions.

Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy constructions materials such as cement, flooring, and zinc. These improvements will provide security and protection for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for home improvements

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Maria es viuda, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, gas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su nieto.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria son aumentar su negocio y que su hijo tenga un negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Kausachun”, which means “Long Live!” in Quecha. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has 5 children. She operates a store out of her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and gas. Maria works every day with the help of her grandson.

Maria needs a loan in the amount of 1050 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her son will also open his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 38-year-old married mother of two children, both currently attending school, loves selling, the business through which she makes a living. A trader in herbal medicine, Lydia treks to villages to purchase the prepared local herbs, creams and medicines that she retails to her customers. These herbs and local medicines treat common diseases including malaria, typhoid, diarrhea, cholera, boils, etc. The medicines are prepared under strict hygienic conditions supervised by the Food and Drugs Board, and many people use them because of their effectiveness in treating the aforementioned diseases.

Lack of adequate working capital prevents Lydia from carrying enough stock to make profits sufficient to support her family. She is therefore requesting a loan to increase her stock in order to scale up sales. She believes the loan will enable her to save more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase local herbs and medicine.

loans.name: Asomaliu

texts.en:
Asomaliu S. is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of Magiagi.  She is married and has 4 children school-aged children.  To make a living, Asomaliu owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Asomaliu has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately $355 WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Asomaliu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Asomaliu has successfully repaid a previous loan of $750 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment.  Asomaliu is now requesting a new loan of $1150 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD.  Asomaliu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie D. is from the village of Pwerta, Lurugan Valencia City. She is 33 years old. Margie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal products such as bags and some clothing wear in the local community. Margie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Margie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng V., 61, is married with six children. Two of her children are still students at a local high school. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband and children.

To make a living, she is in business selling vegetables, earning an income of about $3.30 USD per day. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is currently engaged in business as a carpenter. He is able to earn an income of about 80 cents (USD) per day which supports the childrens’ studies and helps cover the household expenses.

Mrs. V. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Mrs. V. is asking for a loan of $550 USD to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached in order to more easily transport vegetables to the market.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her café business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena C. is a 42 year old store owner who has been in the food business for many years.  She has eight children; the eldest is in college, two in high school and three in grade school.  Her husband Rodrigo, also 42, is a carpenter and is working overseas.  They live among the poor communities in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.

Maria Elena has been into cooking and serving food to her neighbors until she opened a small variety store a few months ago.  She makes a net profit of P4,000.00 per month which she uses to sustain the studies of her children.
 
She has just finished repaying a previous loan with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative which qualifies her for a new loan so she applied for a new loan in the amount of P14, 000.00.  This would be her tenth loan cycle with CCT.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase additional merchandise for her store so she won’t need to come to the market as often.

Maria Elena works hard to sustain her children’s education, hand-in-hand with her husband working miles away.  She also dreams of owning a bigger grocery store.


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fariva Zulema

texts.es: La señorita Fariva es soltera y vive sola en su hogar y con esfuerzos esta saliendo adelante ya que es una persona muy responsable, ella labora para una empresa de casa de empeño y esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para mayor protección de ella misma y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Fariva is single and lives alone in her home. With much effort she is getting ahead in life because she is a very responsible person. She is employed by a pawnshop and is requesting this financing to build an outside wall on the back side of her property for better protection both for herself and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an outside wall.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco Jose M. tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería esto le genera lo necesario para poder aportar a los gastos del hogar, el señor M. tiene 5 años de ser conductor , lo principales problemas que afectan a la familia M., es que ellos radican en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla este es un lugar que no aporta a un ambiente familiar optimo, brindando inseguridad ciudadana y una mala higiene a la comuna, es por esta razón que el señor Francisco solicita un préstamo con el objetivo de comprar materiales de construcción para comenzar con la primera etapa de construcción y remodelación de su vivienda esto le aportaría un lugar más optimo, seguro para él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco Jose M. is 49 years old and married. His wife has a small store, which generates enough income to be able to cover their household expenses. Also, Mr. M. has been a driver for 5 years now. The main problem that affects the M. family is that they live in the Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla, an area that does not offer an ideal family environment. There is a lack of safety for the citizens and poor sanitation. It is for this reason that Francisco is requesting a loan, for the purpose of purchasing construction materials to begin with the first stage of construction and remodeling of his home. This will provide him with a more ideal home, safe for him and all of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the village of Owaon. She is 48 years old. Victoria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Victoria owns and operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP, on average, a month for these activities.

In 2007, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Mena Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata K.. Fatmata is age 42 and was born in Makeni. She is married with 6 children. Her husband is a businessman and 3 of her children are adults; 2 are attending secondary school and 1 is in primary school. For 22 years now, Fatmata has been selling market food – rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, fish, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, palm oil, Maggi cubes, onions, fish, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, Maggi cubes, onions, fish, vegetable oil, sugar, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Irma Elena

texts.es: Irma Elena tiene 74 años y su familia la conforman sus 7 hijos, que trabajan de manera independiente. Ella tiene una panadería que la estableció en su humilde vivienda, a pesar de la edad que tiene es una persona muy activa ella tiene mucha competencia, pero esto no la desanima ya que esto es lo que más le gusta hacer y la mayoría de sus clientes disfrutan de la calidad de sus productos. Por lo que le genero la experiencia necesaria para generar los ingresos necesarios y mantener a sus 7 hijos y proporcionarles estudios. Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina, huevos y azúcar. Por lo que sueña con mejorar las condiciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Irma Elena, 74, has 7 children, who all work independently. She has a bakery that she set up in her humble abode. Despite her age, she is a very active person and she has a lot of competition. However, this doesn't discourage her because she loves what she does and most of her customers enjoy the quality of her products. Her work produced experience and generated enough income to support her seven children and provide them with schooling. She needs financing to buy raw materials like: butter, cheese, flour, eggs and sugar. She dreams with improving her business' conditions so that she can offer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 37 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora. Por el momento, vive independientemente en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Andrés de 40 años, quien trabaja como obrero en una mina, y con sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación.

El arduo trabajo que realiza en sus chacras ha logrado que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos; lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso. Para más adelante, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus cultivos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Marlene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de gladiolos (flores) y de alverja, también abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 37-year-old hardworking and loving mother. At the moment, she is living in her mother's home with her husband, Andrés (age 40), who works as a miner, and their 2 children, to whom she wishes to provide a good education.

The arduous work she does on her farms have helped her fields to be very abundant and productive. She sells her produce at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she gets good profits from her faithful customers.

What she likes most about her job is having to protect her crops from any invading pests. She has been in business for 25 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to transport her produce to the market since she transportation is so scarce. In the future, she would like to have her own produce stand at the wholesale market, where she can sell her produce herself.

This is Marlene's third loan with MFP. She is ready and willing to make her payments punctually. She is a very joyful and supportive member of her communal bank. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase gladiola seeds, pea seed, and fertilizer for her crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran wants a loan to buy used handsets for her mobile phone shop. Zarina wants a loan to buy paint for her paint-selling business. Farzana is the group leader for the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. Farzana feels herself blessed that she was born in a holy place. 

Her husband's name is M. M. and he has a fruit-selling business. He purchases fruit from the fruit markets and sells in the various places on his cart. He has been in this business for over fifteen years. Farzana is a housewife but she also helps her husband by arranging the fruit on his cart. She does this work every morning. Her husband earns approximately Pak Rs. 20,000 every month. Currently, he need a loan to complete the large order which he has received from the fruit shops, therefore Farzana is requesting a loan of Pak Rs. 20,000. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit to complete the orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
Rauf M. is 44 years old and is married with three children. His goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God will continue to provide him with more years of life so he can get ahead and fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Isfara, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 11 years. Currently Rauf’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow 1000 USD. Rauf thanks Kiva and all the lenders who make this help possible.     
       

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON International's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to completely repair his car

loans.name: El Rosario Sumpango Group

texts.es: El grupo El Rosario Sumpango esta conformado por 3 socias, la representante es Maria C.. Las socias viven en Sumpango Sacatepequez, la mayoria de las socias que conforman este grupo venden ropa. La representante del grupo tiene una tienda de ropa ella viaja a diferentes departamentos para comprar trajes tipicos y asi vender en su negocio diferentes productos. Ella tiene 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Doña Maria J. es viuda y tiene dos hijos que la apoyan en su negocio, con el dinero que esta solicitando pretende comprar ropa tipica para distribuirla por medio de su negocio. El grupo a trabajado durante varios años con FAPE, y siempre han sido puntuales con sus pagos. El sueño que tiene Maria J. es darle un mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Rosario Sumpango group is made up of three members; the group representative is Maria C.. They live in Sumpango Sacatepequez; the majority of the group members sell clothing for a living. Maria runs a clothing store and travels to different regions to buy traditional clothing so she can sell a variety of products in her store. She has worked in this business for 10 years. Maria J. is a widow with 2 children who help her in her business. She will use the loan to buy traditional clothing to distribute through her business. This group has worked for quite some time with FAPE and have always been punctual in their payments. Maria J.'s dream is to give a better life to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, cosmetics, clothing and meat

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Monsieur Magatte G. est un mécanicien  transporteur  conducteur d’un  car rapide depuis 10 ans. Il est marie, âgé de 57 ans, père et soutien d’une famille composée  de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 17 ans. Il a aussi en charge  5 autres parents. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juin 2009 et n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution. Auparavant il était apprenti mécanicien  mais actuellement il est en possession d’un certificat en mécanique. C’est surtout pendant la période de Magal et de Tabaski que son activité connait un essor considérable. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour réparer son car rapide qui est tombe en panne. C’est un véhicule qui lui permet d’assurer le transport urbain des passagers et ceci lui procure des recettes journalières  qui lui permettent de gérer  sa famille et d’épargner régulièrement  pour régler  les imprévus.
texts.en:
Mr. Magatte G. has been a mechanic, goods carrier and driver of a fast coach for the past ten years. He is married, 57 years old and he is father and breadwinner for a family of five children, whose ages vary between two and 17 years old. He also has responsibility for five other relatives. He has been a shareholder-member of the Baye-Laye savings bank since June 2009 and has never had a loan from the institution. Previously, he was an apprentice mechanic but now he has a mechanics certificate. It is above all during the period of Magal and Tabaski that his activity really booms. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to repair his fast coach which has broken down. It is a vehicle which allows him to provide transport around town for his passengers, and this brings him a daily income, which enables him to manage his family and save on a regular basis to provide for unforseen expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a student at Al-Quds Open University. He lives in Bethlehem and works while studying so he can afford to pay his tuition fees and contribute to his family's household expenses. 

Mustafa saved a good amount of money and then took a $3,000 loan from FATEN to start a small restaurant near the students residences. The area is in need of a restaurant, because the closest restaurant is 30 minutes away. Mustafa will use the loan to purchase needed cooking tools and machines. With the profit from his restaurant, he can pay his tuition fees and other expenses and help his parents pay for their household expenses.

In the photograph, Mustafa appears in front of the FATEN office.

loans.use: Restaurant equipment and supplies

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs. Tol S., 26, sells various kinds of vegetables in a local market to earn a living. She buys the vegetables in bulk from farmers or wholesale suppliers and sells them retail to people who come to buy something for their cooking.

Tol S. is married to Hort Minea, age 30, who shares responsibility for his family by working as a military policeman. They are good parents to both their children who are students at the public school.

Tol S. is running her business well because she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has come to a low capacity due to insufficient financial capital.

Tol S. wishes to have more money to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Embajadores Group

texts.en: Juan plans to use this loan to invest in his business: a fruit stand where he sells all kinds of fruit. He makes his home in a simple structure with his long-term partner and two children. He has had his business for two years, starting when he stopped working in private enterprise. He says that his most difficult challenge is to bring home income even when he doesn't have a job. In the meantime he plans to continue to enjoy his work and being with his family. He will use his profits to invest in his business and house. His future plan is to have a fruit mall. His story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. His group is located in rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable). Juan is the coordinator of his group Embajadores 1 & 2 ("Ambassadors"). He is excited to be taking out his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. This associate began with Esperanza because it is an interesting program offering more than just loans and low interest.

loans.use: To buy fruits like bananas, pineapples, mangoes, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Giovanny

texts.es: Geovanny R. C., tiene la edad de 42 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 10 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Geovanny  tiene muchos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Geovanny R. C., 42, is married and lives with his wife and 10-year-old son. He wants funds to buy a few calves and to buy feed for them. He wants to provide his cattle with proper care so that they will produce the best possible sale price when time to sell them comes. He also wants to increase his herd size. He has an ideal site for their care. This is the first time he’s negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms they offered. Geovanny has been a cattleman for many years. He hopes in future to provide his family with a better quality of life and a better economic stability as well as to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Sianto

texts.en:
Sianto L., 34 years old, and her husband, Samson, have four children. They have been rearing and selling animals in Naivasha town for the last nine years.

Sianto was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy more goats which she will sell in December when it's peak season.

Sianto is also planning to start crop farming in the future on her piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell in December.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva F., 41, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. Already widowed at such a young age; she manages to be mother and father to four children, one of whom is already in high school, while the younger children are enrolled in elementary school. By the grace of God, Minerva has managed to support her older child's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college--a dream for most Filipino parents like Minerva as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Minerva operates a food stall where her main products are mostly breakfast fare. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals in the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Minerva's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Minerva dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her own stall someday, so that she can save her rent money and use it for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
La persona que sale en la fotografía es la esposa.

Román M. P. es un hombre muy trabajador que es guardia de seguridad en una oficina de la ciudad. En este momento el requiere de un préstamo para arreglar el techo de su casa ya que con el tiempo se a deteriorado, lo cual necesita una reparación pues parte de el techo se cae cada que llueve y teme que esto se agrave lo cual no tenga remedio.
texts.en:
Román M. P. is a very hard-working man. He works as a security guard at an office in the city. At this time he is requesting a loan to fix the roof of his house since it has deteriorated over time. Every time it rains part of the roof falls in and he is afraid that it will get worse and there will be no way to fix it. The person that appears in the photo is his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his roof

loans.name: Marelin

texts.en:
This is Marelin S., 42, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Joel S. and is mother to their children. By the grace of God, Marelin has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses.

Marelin operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at piecemeal rates. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 
 
Marelin dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with the proceeds from all her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 2 & 4 Group

texts.en: Epifania is one of the members of the group Mujeres en Victoria 2 & 4 (Women in Victory). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their only child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to make her business a great source of income for her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook; that why she is dedicating to this kind of business. Epifania is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for around six years, starting with her Esperanza first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, beans, oil, meats and vegetables. She is running a little restaurant (in the Dominican Republic it is called Comedor). She will use the profits to save, to cover some needs like paying bills, and to invest in her business. She is planning to have a good restaurant and the biggest one. This Esperanza associate began with us because she was waiting for money to work, and to start making her dream of having her own restaurant come true. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity. A man in the circle is the husband of one of the women missing from the picture

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, oil, meats, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: Laura L. V. de 45 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como pescador, y así mismo vive junto a dos hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales el mayor le ayuda con el negocio, ya que Laura no sólo trabaja en su casa vendiendo mariscos y cócteles, sino que también se dedica al cuidado de su hijo menor quien es especial. Laura trabaja arduamente durante toda la semana, comercializando diferentes tipos de mariscos, sus ventas sus muy estables ya que se encuentra en el puerto de La Libertad en donde hay una gran afluencia de turistas que visitan el lugar. Laura solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más mariscos y de esta forma mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Laura L. V., 45, lives in the Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad with her husband, a fisherman, and their two grown children, the oldest of whom helps with the business.  Laura not only manages the family business--seafood sales--but also takes care of the couple's younger, special-needs child.  Laura works very hard during the week, selling different kinds of seafood, and sales are steady.  The business is located in the port area of La Libertad and the business can depend on the large number of tourists who come here.  Laura is applying for a loan that she will use to increase her inventory and, in turn, her income.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS LIDERES ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julio; El socio tiene 34 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, el socio se dedica  a la compra y venta de autopartes, el socio  trabaja vendiendo todo tipo de autopartes y accesorios para autos, el socio vende desde ropa para autos, pisos de autos, farros, copas de autos y mucho más. El socio tiene su tienda de venta de autopartes ubicado en la calle prolongación los ingenieros y el trabaja junto a su esposa. El socio requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de accesorios para autos, el viajara a Lima este mes. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar accesorios de autos. 

El socio  agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Los Lideres" ["The Leaders"] communal bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Julio. He is 34 years old and married, with 2 children. He works in purchasing and selling auto parts. He sells all types of auto parts and auto accessories, including car covers, car mats, headlights, hubcaps, and more.  His auto parts store is located on "prolongacion de Ingenieros" street, and he works with his wife. He needs a loan to invest in the purchase of auto parts and accessories. He will be traveling to Lima this month. 

The member appreciates and values the loans received through this service, and agrees to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase auto parts and accessories.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz lives in Arifwala, a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area called Muhallah Eid Gah which is a small residential area of the city. She came here after her marriage. 

She supports her family with her profession, working as a midwife. She also sews clothes in her spare time and earns money from her neighboring clients. Her husband’s name is M. K. and he operates a dairy business at his home. For this purpose, he keeps buffalo and gets milk to sell to his nearby customers. Her brother also lives with her. He is a driver by trade and drives a rickshaw. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase the milk productivity and his sales as well. Mumtaz is hopeful that an investment will be very productive for her husband’s business and her family will be able to have a better standard of living. 

She is the mother of 2 daughters who have not started to attend to school yet. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she built up a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
This is Mary Ann M., a single young woman who, through her business, supports her family and their needs. She manages to look after her variety store and her electronic cellular phone loading station. These businesses enable her to continually provide income to her family.

Mary Ann operates a variety store and a loading station. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php19, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Mary Ann hopes to be able to live a happy and abundant life, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory

loans.name: Luisa María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

La señora Luisa es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pago  y  está  muy contenta, le gustan las charlas más que todo las de salud, además de los créditos que le brindad una gran ayuda en su negocio. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores e independientes. Su esposo es chofer en la aviación civil.

Se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde distribuye mariscos como pescado, camarón, etc. trabaja tres  días de la semana, durante todo el dia ya que como el negocio lo tiene en su casa no se le hace difícil atender a cualquier hora. Sus productos los va a comprar a Manta.

Este crédito es para ir a manta a comprar pescado picudo y camarón que es lo que más vende. Sus sueños son tener un local en centro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Luisa is a founding member of her community bank.  She is the bank's payment officer and is very happy.  She likes the talks, particularly the health talks.  She also likes the loans which are a great help to her in her business.  Luisa is 47 years old, married and has three grown-up children who live independently.  Her husband is a civil aviation driver.

Luisa has small premises in her home where she sells seafood such as fish, shrimp, etc.  She works three days a week and works whole days because, as her business is located in her home, it isn't difficult to serve her customers at any hour of the day.  She buys her products in Manta.

Luisa will use this loan to buy blue marlin and shrimp since that is what she sells most of.  Her dream is to have premises in the city center.

loans.use: To buy blue marlin and shrimp

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena G. is from the village of Lugdungan. She is 33 years old, single, and has one school aged child. Rowena operates a family member's business in the retail sector, running a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for her store renovation. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her sari-sari store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rowena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Bunna

texts.en:
Mr. Bunna S. and his wife, Mrs. Savang Sou, live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have five children – four sons and one daughter. Four of their children are in school while the youngest is still too young.

Bunna is a mason. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to buy the neighboring land to expand his property.

loans.use: To buy land to expand property

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Gloria Esperanza V., reside en Bosques de San Antonio, ubicado en la cabecera departamental de Santa Ana, lugar en el cual vive sola, ya que su único hijo es mayor de edad y vive en casa propia, a pesar de esto le brinda una pequeña ayuda a su madre. Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos varios, entre ellos, jugos, galletas, tostadas de yuca y plátano, sodas, entre otras más.
