Gloria es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su trabajo, ya que cuenta con el enorme deseo de poder mejorar su negocio aún más y de esta forma percibir mayores ganancias. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo a Integral, pormedio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir comprando mayor cantidad de productos que ya posee y así mismo incluir nuevos. Su negocio es muy estable, ya que se encuentra a la salida de una escuela por lo que posee clientes fijos y ventas diarias.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza V. resides in Bosques de San Antonio, which is located in the departmental capital of Santa Ana. She lives alone since her only child is grown and lives in his own home despite having to provide his mother with a little bit of support. Gloria sells various products including juices, cookies, plantain and cassava chips, sodas, and other items. She is a hard worker who is dedicated to her job. Gloria has tremendous desire to improve her business so that she can generate better earnings.

For this reason she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to have the money needed to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of products, which includes new items. Her business is very stable since it is located outside of a school where she has established customers and can make daily sales.

loans.use: Purchase candies to sell

location.town: Bosques de San Antonio, departamento de Santa Ana

loans.name: Djavad

texts.ru:
Djavad M. 28 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Djavad uje 7 let kak jivet v Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Djavid ranshe rabotal prodavcom v druqom magazine no teper u neqo svoy magazin uje kak 6 let on zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji ovoshey i fruktov. 
Seychas Djavad nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chotbi rasshirit pomesheniye magazina i uvelichit kolichestvo polok dlya ovoshey i fruktov.
texts.en: Djavad M. is 28 years old.  He is single and has no children.  Djavad has been living in Baku together with his parents for 7 years.  He previously worked as a salesperson at another store, but now has his own store, where he has been involved in selling vegetables and fruits for 6 years.  Currently, Djavad needs 2000 AZN in order to expand his store space and increase the number of shelves for vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: Expansion of store space

loans.name: Laîdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments (tels le choux etc), d’articles divers de boutique et des savons.                                                                                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur sixième prêt et SITAN B. qui un membre du groupe compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeurs du marché de Fana, pour ensuite revendre quotidiennement sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en: The women of the group Laïdou, all married, are 38 years old on average, have 4 children and live in large traditional families in Warassala village, in the Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through parental, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They sell condiments (such as cabbage), various boutique items, and soaps.  The women of the Laïdou group are on their sixth loan and Sitan Bagayoga, who is a member of the group, expects to buy spices from the re-sellers at the Fana market, to then re-sell it on a day-to-day basis there in the village, for cash and credit to a customer base made up of men and woman.  She plans to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be used to pay back the loan and to contribute to social ceremonies, while the rest will be re-invested in her business of selling spices.

loans.use: to purchase spices for food

loans.name: Khalil

texts.ar: خليل في عمر 26 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في نقل البحص والرمل وغيره له في عمله 4 سنوات يعمل بجد ونشاط متطور مجتهد ومجد في العمل يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله ويطور نفسه وعائلته يتميز بالمعاملة الحسنة والجدية في العمل يعاني من صعوبة مادية في زيادة مدخوله له معارف وزبائن من محيطه كونه يسكن في منطقة عمارية والمنطقة هي بحاجة الى عمله بشكل جيد يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بيك اب لنقل الرمل والبحص لحسابه الخاص
texts.en: Khalil is 26 years old and married with a child. He works transporting sand and gravel and has 4 years experience in this. He works hard and with enthusiasm, and is innovative and up to date in what he does. He would like to increase his income and seeks progress for himself and his family. He is distinguished with his good customer service skills and hard work but he suffers from lack of financiA. capitA.. He is well known in his locality and has many customers since he lives in a residentiA. area where there is a high demand for his services. With this loan he wants to purchase a new pick up truck for transporting sand and gravel.

loans.use: to purchase a new pick up truck for transporting sand and gravel.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luís es instructor de gimnasio y arbitro de fútbol; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de un equipo de sonido para clases de aerobics en el gimnasio y para clases particulares. Con las actividades que realiza cubre los gastos que tiene. Vive en casa en alquiler ubicada en la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad De La Paz, es soltero y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Sr. José Luís is a fitness instructor and soccer referee.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sound equipment for his aerobics classes held at the gym and for private lessons.  These activities enable him to cover his expenses.  José Luís lives in a rented house located in the District of Buenos Aires in the city of La Paz.  He is single and has one child.  This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase sound equipment for his aerobics classes.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy G. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Juvy is married and has three school-aged children. Juvy owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling green and yellow bananas & coconuts in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 5000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. 

This loan will be her second from HSPFI. Juvy is requesting 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jovita; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,fideos entre otros productos y su esposo se dedica al negocio de panadería y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia trabaja en la tienda de abarrotes desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar panadería y comprar productos de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jovita is a member of the “AMANECER ANTEÑA” community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Jovita is 47 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Jovita sells staples such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  Her husband runs a bakery and together they get their children ahead in life.  Jovita works in her grocery store from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  She would like to expand her grocery business and the bakery business. 

Jovita is requesting this loan to buy goods for the bakery and products for her grocery store.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy bakery items and products for her grocery store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
La señora Estrella tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía como es zapatos, ropa para niños, juguetes y ropa de temporada de verano. Con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de la mercancía serán para pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Eleuterio le ayudara con los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos. 
Desea tener mas más mercancía para vender, para en un futuro tener un local fijo, ya que por el momento esta vendiendo la mercancía afuera de su casa.
texts.en:
For more than five years, Estrella has worked selling new and used clothing. 

She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise such as shoes, children's clothing, toys, and clothes for the summer season. With the earnings she obtains from selling the merchandise, she will pay off the loan, since her husband, Eleuterio, will help her with the family's expenses and the school costs for their three children. 
 
She would like to have more merchandise to sell, and in the future she would like to have a permanent store, since for the time being she is selling her merchandise outside her house.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one child. He has owned a blacksmith shop since 2009. He is specialized in repairing auto bodies. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. His business income is very important because he is the main income provider of the family. 

Today he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his shop inventory. He estimates that the loan will help him meet his business needs and increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: to increase his shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours.  Mariam faces a major challenge of competition from other food sellers in the market.  She dreams of establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles sugar, cooking fat oil, maize flour and cereals.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat oil, maize flour and cereals.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 29-year-old hardworking lady. She is married and has no children. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last three years. She hopes to expand her business so that she can get enough capital to buy a piece of land.
Faith joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that she could easily access loans because the members of the group guarantees each other's loans.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Vanessa es socia del banco comunal Caminando Juntos del Distrito de Echarate, Departamento del Cusco, tiene 24 años de edad.

Lleva varios años trabajando de esta manera y Asociación Arariwa ha estado brindándole los préstamos que ha requerido en cada ciclo. Gracias a su experiencia invierte cada préstamo adecuadamente. Empezó con un poco de mercadería y ahora ya tiene buena cantidad de comestibles y bebidas alcohólicas.  

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 3 cajas de cerveza, paquetes de gaseosa, paquetes de agua mineral y comestibles. 

La venta de sus bebidas las realiza por cajas y para llevar a sus casas, de esa manera evita tener que atender hasta muy tarde, ya que el trabajo doméstico también demanda esfuerzo.

"Vanessa nos comenta que... La Asociación Arariwa nos brinda la ayuda necesaria para poder iniciar nuestros propios negocios y no debemos desaprovecharla".
texts.en:
Vanessa is a member of the “Caminando Juntos” (Journeying Together) Communal Bank in the Echarate district of Cusco department. She is 24 years old.

Vanessa has worked with this program for several years and Asociacion Arariwa has offered her the loans she needs in each loan cycle. Thanks to her experience, she has invested each loan adequately. Vanessa began with very little merchandise and how she already has a good quantity of groceries and alcoholic beverages.

With her new loan of 500 new sols, she will buy 3 cases of beer, packets of soft drinks, packets of mineral water, and groceries.

The drinks are in boxes to take home. In this manner, she avoids having to attend to customers until very late, since domestic chores also demand her efforts.

Vanessa comments that “The Arariwa Association offers the help we need to be able to initiate our own businesses and we should not miss the opportunity.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en: Norman, 30 years old and single, operates his dairy center business in Ibanda in the western part of Uganda, known as "the land of milk." The fact that there are many dairy farms and milk sale centers doing well was motivation for hard-working Norman to set up his dairy, which acts like a collection center of fresh milk in town. Many milk dealers flock in to his dairy for fresh milk. Monthly he makes about 1.5 million UGX as profit. He has run his business for about four years. He says he has a dream of raising his standard of living. With the kiva loan, he plans to buy more milk for resale.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Ernesto nacido en Chuquisaca casado con la Sra. Prospera con 5 hijos, 3 mayores y 2 menores tiene su parcela en villa San Carlos a 25 km de Limoncito donde trabajan y vive el se dedica a la agricultura y también sacan maderas paras las carpinterías, es primera vez que trabaja con Emprender, el aprovecho la promoción que le hicimos ya que estaba necesitando para la siembra de sandia y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra fue una oportunidad buena  ya que le abrimos un nuevo camino para su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora y se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto was born in Chuquisaca and is married to Sra. Prospera. They have five children, three adults and two minors. He has a plot of land in Villa San Carlos, which is 25 km from Limoncito, where he works and lives. Ernesto engages in farming, but he also harvests lumber for the carpentry shops.

This is the first time he has worked with Emprender. He is taking advantage of a promotional offer because he needs the funding in order to prepare his land for growing watermelon. This is a good opportunity to start a new branch for his business.

Ernesto is a hardworking individual and is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing watermelon.

loans.name: Jose De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús es un hombre muy trabajador el tiene 41 años de edad y es originario de una población rica en cultura y hermoso en paisajes, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos uno estudia la secundaria y la menor la primaria. El tiene un taxi el cual da servicio en su población desde hace 6 años, dice que le costo mucho trabajo obtener su taxi ya que son muchos requisitos para obtener un permiso pero el es una persona muy constante y de “fe”, y gracias a Dios obtuvo su permiso através de muchos sacrificios. Don Jesús comenta que trabaja su taxi de lunes a viernes de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche para obtener algo de ganancias, dice que en época de lluvias es cuando tiene mas trabajo y que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprarle llantas nuevas a su taxi y darle mantenimiento ya que lo tiene que tener en muy buenas condiciones para que no se le descomponga y tenga que pagar mas en refacciones. Jesús esta muy contento con el crédito que le están haciendo por que con las ganancias que obtenga podrá comprarles a sus hijos lo que ocupen para darles una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Jesús is a hardworking gentleman. He is 41 years old and originally from a town with a rich culture and beautiful landscapes. Jesús is married and has two children, one in high school and the other in elementary school. He has a taxi that he uses for providing his services around town. Jesús has been in business for six years and says that it took a great amount of work to acquire his taxi. There are many requirements that must be met to obtain a permit, but he is a steadfast person of faith. Thanks to God, he was able to obtain a permit after much sacrifice.

Don Jesús says that he operates his taxi Monday through Friday, from 6am to 9pm, in order to earn some income. He says that the rainy season is when he has more business. Jesús is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders so that he can buy new tires for his taxi and maintain his vehicle so that it stays in very good condition. This will prevent his vehicle from breaking down and creating additional expenses due to repairs.

Jesús is very pleased with the loan and will use the profits that he earns to buy his children what they need to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Isidra is the coordinator of her group "Nuevas Emprendedoras" 1 & 2 (New entrepreneurs). She is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business producing natural jams for 2 years. Her husband is an upholsterer, and they sell furniture.

Isidra is the mother of six children, five of whom are living at home. She says that her biggest challenge is to establish a new business to sell furniture with her husband. She said her most favorite activity is to cook, and that is why she choose to make jams for sale. 

Isidra dreams of having a home furniture store where they can sell all kinds of furniture. With this loan, Isidra plans to invest in fruits and sugar, as well as wood, upholstery fabric, and thread . She will uses her business profits to save and reinvest in her new business. 

All the members in this group are taking loans to improve their businesses and their lives.  They are located in the city of Los Alcarrizos, a very industrial city, in the north of Santo Domingo.   Isidra thanks all of you for such amazing support!!!

loans.use: to buy fruits and furniture materials

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 43, is a hardworking business man.  He is married and blessed with four children who are in school.  

For the last ten years, he has been doing photography.  He also rears pigs and does tailoring to supplement his income.  

In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a hardware business.  He has requested a 30,000 Kenya shilling loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 30-year-old, single woman. She describes herself as tolerant. Emily runs a beauty salon where she provides hair and beauty services to the local people. She has been involved in this business for two years and employs two staff members. 

Her business is located in a shopping center in Kisumu. Financial constraints are her biggest business challenges. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy hair weaves, relaxers and treatments. Her business goal is to grow the business and also start a cosmetics shop within five years. 

Emily hopes that in the future she will open a hair-dressing school.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves, relaxers and treatment.
